story:
Our Story

Blackwyrm Books And Games is a publisher of experimental fiction and quality roleplaying games. In conjunction with Hero Games' release of the Star Hero 6th Edition roleplaying game at GenCon 2011, we are attempting to simultaneously release seven science fiction settings that can be played using the Star Hero rules.  

 

We're calling this entire undertaking Project WyrmStar. 


The Impact

Hero Games isn't planning on releasing any settings for Star Hero: only the core rulebook and some equipment books. We are hoping to "fill the gap" that leaves by releasing unique and interesting setting books that can be used to play the game immediately, rather than forcing Game Masters to take the time to create their own setting. 

 

Terracide for HERO System 6th Edition is one of these settings. 


What We Need & What You Get

Humanity was struggling to catch up with its alien neighbors when Terra ceased to exist.

 

The attack had been a long time coming; it had traveled for over 200 years before it hit. Thousands of relativistic weapons swept across the system in a matter of hours, moving too swiftly for anyone to see them coming, try to escape, or to warn anyone else what was happening. When they struck the homeworld, the surface of Terra became a molten holocaust, and the oceans boiled away into the tortured skies. Every settlement on Luna, Mars, and the Galilean moons met the same fate. Colonies on smaller moons and asteroids simply shattered, vaporized instantly by the impact. In the final hours of the attack, on the fringe of Sol's oort cloud, the last comet-herders were just beginning to figure out something was wrong as they went off the air, one by one. And then it was over.

 

There were no survivors.

 

Terracide (by Grady Elliott) is a gritty, space opera noir. The Earth has been annihilated, leaving only the few thousand humans who were working in deep space alive. Those who have survived must not only continue the human race, but to discover who--or what--destroyed their home world. Players can chose from character Package Deals that include private eye, pirate, socialite, soldier, and many, many more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell other gamers about Blackwyrm and Project WyrmStar!

story:
PLOT

Senshi Samurai its developed in a alternate world , inspired by the Kamakura period of ancient Japan. A world where the Samurai force was not only military, but a way for justice and redemption. Senshi, is a young man from the village Sabaku, Yamikido region.

Senshi 's father ( Seiwa Soga ) belonged to the well known Soga clan, after many battles he retired as a war hero. they called him Tensai '天才" ( genius ) as a symbol of honor and strength. 

After the war , Seiwa step away from the capital and retired to and outskirt Village named Sabaku, where he meet Mikio the love of his life. Of that great love Senshi is born, and then his younger brother Takeda.

as the black dragon year came Village started facing serious numbers of calamities. First came the flood, then came the hunger, a cold winter and with it the plague came. The population was 1,500 people but after the Black Dragon year, only 302 survived, people die everyday some because of hunger,diseases, ruthless climate and others were victims of thieves and outlaws. 

Dead was normal back then but one day it calls Seiwa Soga's doors and change the fate of senshi's life forever…………....










Senshi







More to come ......


Character selector


Gameplay






Senshi will be available in:

iOS: Iphone, Ipad, Ipad mini

Android: Android 4.0 Ice Cream Sandwich and above

Indie consoles: OUYA

Mac: OSX 10.8.5 and above

PC: Microsoft Windows 7 and 8

Linux: Pending


Also For OUYA




We initially need $30,000 to get us along and start working on the game more often. This is to cover basic costs, like music assistance on assets and game content, marketing, and reward production.

story:
«I will tell you a story about the very first Crusade; a story about the liberation of the Holy Sepulcher and the Holy Land.

It was 1096th. Europe drowned in drought, crop failure and famine. Those days were terrible and natural cataclysms forced people to think how close the doomsday was, when Jesus Christ will come down to Earth for the Last Judgment of the living and the dead. At this time Peter the Hermit appeared on the roads of Europe. Sitting on a donkey, barefoot,   holding a crucifix in his hands, traveling from city to city, preaching in squares and roads. He said that Christian churches in the East are turning into pigsties, and Christians are taken away into slavery, that church services are banned, and that Church of the Holy Sepulcher had been desecrated. His eloquence impressed the crowds, every mind was ignited, and every heart was touched, anger and rage boiled up in every Christian’s blood.

Peter preaches his gospel in the Eternal City of Rome. Pope Urban II summons Catholics to regain the kingdom of God. Like lightening hitting the ground, the shout of innumerable crowd's hearts explodes in the air of the square: “God wants it, God wants it!” At that moment every faithful human swore to go and release Jerusalem. The news spread in a whole Europe as fast as a wind. All ranks, ages and estates were mixed under the Cross.

Those days were grim, all thoughts were addressed to Jerusalem, in light of coming doomsday, as expected a path of wander would become a path of eternity. How else could sins be redeemed without capture of the Holy Sepulcher?»


Single player campaign describes the times when thousands of Christians went from Europe to the East in order to liberate the Holy Sepulcher. Our goal is to recreate atmosphere of Middle Ages, to make the game stylish, beautiful and alive, that is why each and every image, icon or background was redrawn several times until we could confidently say “yes, this is exactly what we were looking for”. We would like to recreate setting that you can see in Ridley Scott’s Kingdom of Heaven and the first part of Assasin’s Creed.

Music from our game:



The game is a synergy of a board game with elements of tower defense and something similar to angry birds. The entire plot of single player game was illustrated by hand by our artist. In single player there will be no repetitive missions with the sole goal of mechanical elimination of enemy's troops. Instead there will be a linear storyline accompanied with missions where you will have to reinforce and defend your fortifications, endure intense assaults and execute timely and well-judged counterattacks.

The whole goal of single player campaign is to make you rationalize and think through your decisions in order to develop the most efficient strategy for achieving victory in multiplayer game.

The main idea behind the game’s mechanics is in wise placement of troops which will give the player advantage in battle. For example a regiment consisting of 3-5 soldiers of the same type has a great bonus to attack and defense. However if the regiment is dissipated by a precise strike of an arrow or spear the whole bonus will be nullified. The player can quickly rearrange his soldiers and whole lines of troops in order to gain his advantage. For example if your first line of swordsmen is attacked by cavalry, you can quickly switch this line with a line of pikemen. Also you can manually control your ranged attacks in order to focus your barrage of arrows on particularly important regiments of your adversary. Different troops specialize on eliminating particular type of enemy troops. For example swordsmen are highly effective against pikemen and pikemen are effective against cavalry and so on.

There are 5 types of primary units – cavalry, swordsmen, pikemen, peasants and archers- each type has their own advantages and drawbacks. For example assaulting cavalry can instantly kill the first unit on their way, so it is wise to put the least valuable peasants in the line of attack. At the same time in each battle including multiplayer game amount of soldiers is limited (knights in full armor can not appear in the middle of the desert from nowhere) so life of every soldier is valuable and thoughtless attack incurring substantial losses can prevent the player from winning in the long term.

So a plethora of gameplay nuances gives the player tremendous amount of miscellaneous tactical and strategic solutions that of course can be implemented in full during a multiplayer game online and that will make your game with your friends truly interesting and captivating.

You will be able to use a number of improvements and achievements from single player game in multiplayer after you unlock them. Also, in multiplayer you will be able to reinforce your fortifications and encampments right during the battle. In PvP game players will be matched according to their level. Such parameters as amount of troops that you can use during each battle , their level and arming will depend on how well the player manages his assets. Player can learn how to adequately manage his resources during the single player game. So before starting multiplayer game it will be necessary to complete several missions in single player.


Investing real money in the game will allow you to purchase additional game currency- treasures (1$ = 1 treasure). 

Using this currency player will be able:

- To hire mercenaries from other countries for 4 treasuers per unit (mercenaries can exceed hiring limits).

- Purchase special weapons and armor from Damascus and Milanese steel (5 - 10 treasures).

- Acquire Holy Relics which will improve battle morale of player’s troops. 

- Also player will be able to unlock paid mode Crusader (cost 5 treasures, one time payment for a year) which will expedite draft of troops after battle and will permanently increase battle morale of troops.


We have a feathered team consisting of young creative and active programmers and designers . We are located in Prague, Czech Republic and we have a small company specializing in IT projects. Our company, Vergil Development Studio is the guarantor of fulfillment of all goals in the Crusaders project.

Our company, Vergil Development Studio completed more than 150 different IT projects ranging from websites to complex internet-systems and several apps. Although we are young, we have great experience in IT management and organization of creative process so we are confident that we will finish this project in time and create a great captivating game. This game is our dream, our passion and we want to dedicate our efforts and life to game industry and we are hoping that you will help us make this dream come true while benefiting from it by playing great games.

We are hoping that you will be interested in this project and we are counting on your support. On our part we vouch not to disappoint you. If you have any thoughts or ideas about features that you would like to see implemented in the game or if you will discover any discrepancies in historic facts , please send us your feedback to info@vergildesign.com

Like us on facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/groups/302495283284703/ 

=)

story:
Plushies!

At Fruitbat Factory, we try to keep our ear to the ground and deliver what the users want. After extensive research and polling user preferences, we prototyped two plushies for production: Marie Poppo from the popular online board game 100% Orange Juice, and Suguri from the SUGURI video game series (and also from 100% Orange Juice), and ran a Kickstarter campaign to fund their production!

 

The campaign turned out wildly successful, and we successfully funded all of our goals, unlocking 6 characters: Suguri, Marie Poppo, Sora, Star Breaker, QP and Hime, as well as a personal cool accessory for each!

For those users who weren't able to take part in our original campaign, we are now offering the remaining stock on IndieGoGo inDemand, so you can still get the plushies of your favorite characters!

InDemand Details

The production of all plushies is now complete! You can order all plushies as long as stock lasts - they all come with a free accessory!

The list of characters and their accessories is as follows:

Suguri + Attachable Accelerator wings.

 

Marie Poppo + Stolen Star

 

Sora + Zapper Sword

Star Breaker + Bomb

QP + Rbit

Hime + Binding Chains

Worldwide shipping costs $15 for 1 plushie, or $20 for 2 plushies in an economical double pack.

Plushies ordered via the InDemand campaign will be shipped within approximately 2 weeks of the order. 

The Poppocalypse

In 2018, a horde of Mass Produced Marie Poppos will take over the world - Poppocalypse is truly here!

 

We are currently partnered with the U.S.-based Symbiote Studios for the production of the plushies. 

The largest risks involved in the campaign are shipping delays, or the need to change manufacturer mid-campaign.

Share the Happiness!

If you'd like to participate but aren't able to order the plushies for one reason or another, you can help by simply spreading the news!

You can follow us on Twitter, Facebook, or join our Discord server to talk to us.

Thank you for the support!

CAMPAIGN CLOSURE:  Thank you all so much for your generous support!!  We really appreciate everyone's contributions and rest assured (even though we did not acheive our target) GCM2 will rise to greatness!

Thanks again everyone and game on!

story:
Don't forget to click above ^ Share, Link, Like, Tweet, Spread the word

The artwork in the videos are not final draft, the game will get a final artistic polish near the end of development.

What is the Walled Garden?

The Walled Garden is an action/platformer PC game set in an surrealistic Garden of Eden. I am developing the game for the PC (with a little support from some friends) with hopes to bring it to more platforms such as PSP and Mac if it's successful.

The intent of this game was to create a hectic platform shooter;
Where destroying terrain was both a strategy, defense, and general way of getting around the levels.
Destructive terrain acts as a good puzzle system in terms of using the terrain to your advantage.
The whole game aims to be a Random juxtaposition.

In the Garden you control Atom.

  • Surrealist take on The Garden of Eden and the Fall of Man.
  • Outsmart predator enemies, as you attempt to find Eva and hunt down the deity "El".
  • Explore a strange new world; where Destruction leads to Creation.
  • Destroy nearly everything in your path.
  • Discover the secrets that lie in the story of Eden...

The Walled Garden is a 2D side-scrolling shooter which focuses on the events of an ever changing environment, utilize your maneuverability to find Eva and try to leave the Garden for good.

Further details can be found at the TIGsource DevLog.


What is the Plot?

By now you all know the story of Temptation.

El created Atom from the dust of the ground and in his sleep, split Atom to create Eva.
Atom knew that to eat from the Tree of Knowledge was forbidden.
Tempted by the serpent, Eva offered Atom the fruit...
Atom knowingly chose to sin
"Cursed is the ground because of you; until you return to the ground, for out of it you were taken. You are dust,and to dust you shall return."
Eva was ripped out of existence from this world and forever remains, drifting through dimensional planes...
Expelled from the garden and now alone Atom became increasingly rebellious. Using his new obtained knowledge Atom created a weapon and busted back into Eden...


Who are You?

My name is Derek Boe I am an independent artist and game developer. Who is very much the epitome of a starving artist, currently I am attending the Alberta College of Art and Design for a bachelor of fine arts in Media Arts & Digital Technologies.
You can view my portfolio website here to see more of my work.

I started making this game back in 2008
I have been working very hard on this game by myself doing all the art/animation, programming and sound effects.


What still needs to be done?

  • Finish working with some composers
  • Begin designing art for the levels such as backgrounds and tile art.
  • Work on the levels and focus on making the level design fun and interesting
  • Fix up any small bugs with some of the enemy A.I.
  • Get some testers to play my game before release

What do you need money for?

School tuition (average $2000 per semester)

Sadly... art school isn't cheap; I need some assistance to pay for my tuition if I want to work on this game full-time.
Working on this game in my spare time is only going to get me so far on it. And the only way I can work on this game full-time is to get some funding, so if you would like to help me or see this game out ASAP please donate to help support the project.


Since I will be releasing the game for free, I will not be making any profit from the games release what so ever.


Any extra funding will help pay for music and advertising.
Even if I don't achieve my funding goal, the game will still be made; Though chances are, if they goal is not met I not be going to school next semester.

What do I get if I donate?

  • Donating $5 or more gets you same-day access to regular 'work-in-progress' versions of the game
  • Instant early access to the full version
  • Access to pitch ideas and critique the games condition
  • Your name in the credits as a special thanks
  • There are bigger rewards for donating more
(these are examples of the bleach work that I do, which is what comes with a donation of $50 or more)

Other Ways You Can Help!

Don't forget, if you can't donate to the project the least you can do is share this link to some of your friends.
The only way I can get help is by getting noticed so the more exposure I can get, the better.

Remember there are quick and easy sharing tools above this post near the top. /\

attending the Alberta College of Art and Design for a bachelor of fine arts in Media Arts & Digital Technologies.You can view my portfolio website here to see more of my work.I started making this game back in 2008
I have been working very hard on this game by myself doing all the art/animation, programming and sound effects.
What still needs to be done?


Finish working with some composers

Begin designing art for the levels such as backgrounds and tile art.

Work on the levels and focus on making the level design fun and interesting

Fix up any small bugs with some of the enemy A.I.
Get some testers to play my game before release




What do you need money for?

School tuition (average $2000 per semester)

Sadly... art school isn't cheap; I need some assistance to pay for my tuition if I want to work on this game full-time.



Working on this game in my spare time is only going to get me so far on 
it. And the only way I can work on this game full-time is to get some 
funding, so
 if you would like to help me or see this game out ASAP please donate to
 help support the project.

Since I will be releasing the game for free, I will not be making any profit from the games release what so ever.


Any extra funding will help pay for music and advertising.Even if I don't achieve my funding goal, the game will still be made; Though chances are, if they goal is not met I not be going to school next semester.What do I get if I donate?


Donating $5 or more gets you same-day access to regular 'work-in-progress' versions of the game
Instant early access to the full version

Access to pitch ideas and critique the games condition

Your name in the credits as a special thanks
There are bigger rewards for donating more


(these are examples of the bleach work that I do, which is what comes with a donation of $50 or more)




Other Ways You Can Help!


Don't forget, if you can't donate to the project the least you can do is share this link to some of your friends.
The only way I can get help is by getting noticed so the more exposure I can get, the better.
Remember there are quick and easy sharing tools above this post near the top. /\

story:
Quick Facts

Innovate concepts within GamersOnline.

· Cloud storage use to eliminate the need for physical copies of games.

· Intricate software that removes requirement of a console

· Maximum connectivity that permits you to play on any electronic device you own.

Our Mission

The mission that GamersOnline strives to achieve is the ability to bring all games to any platform while connecting gamers all around the world. With the technological advancements available in society, you can now game without a console. The virtual console that GamersOnline provides lets you access all your games on your personal devices or on your television through our futuristic Eclipse G1 controller. We strongly believe that your personal device is your console.  Our mission is to bring an inexpensive form of gaming to this new generation, while pushing the limits of quality and value in your gaming experience.

How it All Started

Thomas Lah(CEO)

Growing up my father was an engineer, he worked on projects like Netflix. One day I had an idea where people would be able to stream games through a cross platform system and not be restricted to only playing good games on things like a console, but be able to play high end games on things like a phone. Being a college student I was tired of paying 60$ for a game and 500$ for a console. We thought this would be a great opportunity for me to start this adventure. So I drove to Washington D.C. where I met with some investors and networked with people. I worked with multiple business people, and people from my College to build up this concept and idea. As we progressed we worked day in and day out on the best way to allow Gamers the full control of their systems but without the steep prices of gaming products these days.

How It Works

GamersOnline is a virtual application that allows you to access a variety of games on our marketplace and will be the primary graphics rendering and gameplay engine. The GamersOnline application will cover a multitude of electronic devices from Windows, Mac, iPhone, IPad, Android, Linux, and other device platforms, having a unique VirtualConsole app for each device. One of the main innovate ideas within the GamersOnline concept is the ability to play any game regardless of the memory required with the use of our cloud server. 50% of the game will be downloaded directly onto your device from our application. Once this happens, you will be able to start playing your game while the rest of the memory will be downloading in the Clouds.

GamersOnline Milestones 

Phase  1- 400k Controller, Software, and Prototype Systems

·  Complete finish of both the software and hardware of the controller

·  Manufacturing of the controller, Ready for testing!

Phase 2- 750k Full Software, Controller

·  Completion of software for application

Phase 3- 3 Million Marketable Software/ Hardware (Beta testing phase)

·  Mass Production of Controllers

·  Manufacturing of new hardware and software

·  Beta Testing on application

Phase 4- 5.8 Million Full Start-up (Including Building)

·  Infrastructure for building complete

·  Data Servers across the east coast

·  Accessibility to the application on any device

Phase 5- 12 Million US Wide Servers and Distributions

·  Accessibility across the U.S.

·  Instantaneous downloads

See below for descriptions of all the perks!!

Beta Testing

GamersOnline is serious when it comes to gaming! We are going to be offering you an opportunity that you can’t find anywhere else. Depending on your emblem ranking you will be one of the first to test our application, as you can see the higher the rank the better the opportunity.

Gold Emblem Donars - PreTest up to a month early.

Silver Emblem Donar - PreTest up to two weeks early.

Bronze Emblem Donar - PreTest up to a week early

For more information of the Ranking system refer to the GamersOnline website

http://www.gamersonline.co/

Press

http://videogamewriters.com/gamersonline-interview-thomas-lah-67212



Partnership


Overview of the Eclipse G1 Controller:

Eclipse G1, a fully wireless controller that you can link to any device that runs the GamersOnline application. The controller has a battery intergraded into it that uses any USB to charge. The controller will have a LCD screen on it that will let you interact with the your games directly with the tips of your fingers.

Our Plan/ Our Vision

We see an opportunity to not only do something revolutionary, but to also bring joy to the world in the process. The world has progressively been moving to a new technological age in just about all fields. Looking specifically at the realm of entertainment product is moving away from the physical item and towards the digital. The exact process that GamersOnline is executing has been done before just in different industries, namely Music with the introduction of musical libraries such as iTunes, and in the film industry with Netflix. GamersOnline is looking to provide another option to gaming where your personal device is your console. 

GamerCoins

As a gamer plays games on GamersOnline, they will earn GC (GamerCoins) as well as build a rank. For every minute played on an online game a Gamer will earn approximately 15GC, and in offline games approximately 10GC a minute. GC will allow gamers to significantly lower the cost of games as well as give access to a feature that will allow gamers to use their GC to play games that they have not yet purchased. When you challenge other Gamers you will be able to make wagers in which you can chose GC, Game License (bet your own game against another Gamer), or you can wager your rank. If you wager your rank what you are playing for is to knock the other Gamer down to a lower rank. If you win you will earn a higher rank and the opposing Gamer will either be reset or lose a portion of their rank. With a global ranking system, even playing offline games while connected to GamersOnline will allow Gamers to build their rank. On top of new gaming currency and custom PvP(Player vs. Player) gaming we will also offer GamersOnline hosted tournaments with numerous prizes and benefits.


GAMERSONLINE MARKETPLACE

The GamersOnline VirtualConsole will render the GamersMarket content such as user dashboard, game store, and social functions. The GamersMarket will also be accessible from both desktop and mobile Internet browsers. Through the GamersMarket you will be able to access and download our wide variety of games ranging from Indie publishers to Triple AAA publishers. 


PERKS!!!

$1- Super heartfelt thank you to express our deepest gratitude!

$5- You will receive an exclusive GamersOnline screen saver to download and show all your friends about this new revolution. This package also comes with a brand new stylish GamersOnline  lanyard!

$15- This perk includes not only the screen saver, but comes with the addition of a vintage GamersOnline sticker that you can put on your phone, laptop, tablet, or any other device or item you own. Also gain the right and honor of the ability to  Pre-Register a Gamertag of your choice which includes a Donor Emblem at the Bronze Rank.

$25- This perk includes the previously mentioned rewards above along with the introduction of the exclusive GamerCoins. Start your gaming off right with 5,000 GC towards your GamersOnline Account!

$50- Along with a screen saver and a lanyard, we even threw in a exclusive GamersOnline Decal just for you! And you also gain 5000 GamerCoins to your name. Also, write your name in stone to receive the high-end, never before seen Eclipse G1 Controller with $5 off of the manufacturing cost!

$100- This perk is a fantastic assortment of prizes! Along with the Screen saver, Lanyard, Pre-Order of the Eclipse G1 Controller, and personal email at GamersOnlineDonor.co. We are going to throw in a fashionable GamersOnline T-Shirt and upgrade two of the previous awards. Obtain an additional 5,000 GamerCoins from the last perk for a total of 10,000 GamerCoins in your GamersOnline Account! With this perk you also achieve the rank of Silver Donor Emblem attached to your personal pre-registered Gamertag!

$250- Just when you thought it couldn’t get any better! Along with everything in the last perk, we at GamersOnline stepped up our game with the inclusion of the awesome GamersOnline Hoodie! With yet another upgrade with 10,000 more GamersCoins! That’s a whopping total of 20,000 GC! Why settle for Silver? With this perk you advance in the hierarchy of GamersOnline system to the level of Gold!

$500- If you thought the last one was a catch then read on… At this point you know what we’re about and how we look out for the GamersOnline Community. You’re getting EVERYTHING from above, as usual, but we have to add more and here’s what we got for you! We’re throwing in an exclusive GamersOnline Beanie to go along with the Lanyard, T-Shirt, and Hoodie you’re already getting, and to top it all off more GC! This perk includes an additional 15,000 GamerCoins added to your GamersOnline Account, giving you a total of 35,000 GC! The opportunity of a lifetime is presented before you! Be one of the first in the world to test the games on our platform through the GamersOnline application.

$1,000- This next perk is for all you Indie Developers out there that would like to have any of your games featured on our platform. Have 10 of your games featured on the front page of our indie marketplace, while receiving a 1% Royalty for all 10 of your featured games. You also have the opportunity to reach out to us through Skype, Oovoo etc. to have a video conference to learn more about the inner workings of  GamersOnline.

$1,500- This perk is an upgrade from the previous one. This time for 5 of your games, you obtain 2.5% royalties on all of your 5 featured games. With all of the games still being on the front page of our indie marketplace. While still having the opportunity to hold a Video Conference with the GamersOnline team.

$2,500- The perks just keep rolling in! With this perk you’ll be literally one of the first in the entire world to receive a fully paid for (including shipping and handling) Eclipse G1 Controller. On top of this amazing deal, gain 100,000 GC added to your GamersOnline Account! Also be able to have a group conference with the GamersOnline team to see what we do behind the scenes. While all still receiving your own personalized email at GamersOnline.co, the ability to Pre-register your Gamertag, and achieve the rank of Gold.

$5,000- This perk comes with an upgrade of the last one. Along with everything from the previous perk you’ll obtain an additional 100,000 GC added to your GamersOnline Account, giving you a total amount 200,000 GC to brag about to your friends. You will also receive not 1, but TWO fully paid for(including shipping and handling) Eclipse G1 controllers.

$10,000- We’re playing no games with this one! You’ll receive everything from the preceding package, including the ability to Pre-register your Gamertag, achieve the rank of Gold within the GamersOnline system, have your own personal GamersOnlineDonor.co email, skype in with the GamersOnline team to get a behind the scenes look at our company, and still receive two fully paid for(including shipping and handling) Eclipse G1 controllers! You will also accumulate 500,000 GC to show all your friends who’s boss! But we’re still not finished… On top of all of this, we will buy the plane tickets for you and a friend to attend a two day private release party. Also get a private behind the scenes tour of our company to meet the team. Finally, you’ll get your hands on the astonishing GamersOnine AllPro Bundle! We guarantee you don’t want to miss this!(Details to be released)


Publishers

With the extensive platform we provide allowing gamers instant access to any game we provide, we would like to offer publishers all around the world the opportunity to be able to have their game featured on our marketplace (GOI Sphere) through the “Developers Package” perk. GamersOnline is extending its hands out to all publishers of any level, whether you run a successful gaming publishing company, or you are a young kid that wants to share his or her game with the world! If you have a great game, we can help the world see it. As long as its GamersOnline approved then it will be placed on our platform.

GamersOnline Approved means games that are appropriate under the ERSB rating system

For any questions regarding GamersOnline approved games contact the marketing division email at the bottom of the page.

FAQ

Q: What kind of company is GamersOnline?

A:  GamersOnline is a new kind of company because we are striving to achieve something that has never been created before. In whole GamersOnline is a technology company that focuses primarily on gaming distribution, but will bring along brand new innovate products that will advance the gaming experience to a whole new level.  

Q: If GamersOnline is a gaming distribution company then why create a controller?

A: The console has been around for such a long time that we realize people aren’t just going to quite let go of the concept. We still want to give you the console like feeling by giving you the opportunity to play any game on our gaming application using our controller.

Q: What other ways does GamersOnline intend on expanding and enhancing the gaming experience?

A: By allowing consumers easier access to a much larger magnitude of games we will also assist in taking out expensive hardware requirements of gaming and allowing for a better and smoother gaming experience.

Q: What is your console?

A: We have no physical console; the console is whatever device you decide to play your game on. Our application is our virtual console that we’ll be providing on your device.

Q: How do we differ from other companies that have attempted to stream games?

A: By 100% streaming games, you are being deprived from quality gaming such as poor bandwidth speed. With our concept at GamersOnline, 50% of the game will already be on our gaming application. You will instantly be able to play. While your enjoying your game, the rest of it will be streamed in the background allowing for a powerful gaming experience.

Q: What are some of the challenges that arise with a project like this?

A: The main framework of the project lies in the technological development of the concept. GamersOnline aims to do something that hasn’t quite been done efficiently yet, and for that exact reason great minds were brought along to make this concept a reality.

Q: How do you think GamersOnline will affect the rest of the gaming industry?

A: From a gamer’s standpoint it would be reasonable to presume that other innovate projects will arise, further asserting that gamers are multiple steps closer to having their wildest gaming fantasies come true.

Q: Why move away from the console?

A: To add flexibility and more convenience to the gaming experience. GamersOnline is taking the concept behind the wireless controller and then taking it one step further. You still have your console; this time around it is just your own personal device that you can take anywhere.  

Q: What can a gamer expect from GamersOnline in the future?

A: We can’t say too much just quite yet, but we assure our gaming community that we are constantly coming up with innovate ideas, which are in development, that will bring certain aspects of gaming that have yet to be seen.

For more information about GamersOnline refer to the GamersOnline website

 http://www.gamersonline.co/

Contact Info

Marketing@gamersonline.co- Marketing Division

story:
Gravy 1.6.4

i never wanted to sell gravy because this is a free bot... but like all people i like big money and no one donate to my paypal for my work... over 2500 people downloaded Gravy 1.6.2 and over 3000 the 1.5.4. so i will release the next update when i reach 20 €

story:
Bonjour à tous,

Je m'appelle Alain Truffier (Alias Angelstar) et je suis le créateur de plusieurs jeux en ligne dont 650km.com et Druidik.com.

Ce projet de financement INDIEGOGO permet de maintenir 650km.com en tant que jeu gratuit en ligne sans abonnement et sans blocage de niveau.

Cette page INDIEGOGO vous permet de faire vos contributions en toute sécurité et de recevoir vos KM-POINTS sous 48 heures après le crédit des achats sur le compte de 650KM

Je vous invite à mettre à jour vos informations personnelles dans 650km.Com afin que je puisse faire la liaison entre le contributeur INDIEGOGO et le joueur de 650km!

Grâce à ces fonds il me sera possible de maintenir le jeu en ligne et de m'assurer que les serveurs soient toujours opérationnels.

Il est désormais possible d'utiliser vos cartes de crédits ainsi que vos comptes Paypal pour obtenir des KM-POINTS!


Alain Truffier / Angelstar

story:
Short Summary

Tennis is an amazing game requiring a unique combination of physical and mental skills that can take years to perfect. The combination of hitting, running, and decision-making, make tennis one of the hardest sports to play. As an individual sport, players are required to become totally self-reliant; depending on themselves, exclusively, and their own efforts. Unfortunately, due to these high demands, many players leave the sport before they ever experience the many benefits tennis has to offer. Fear and intimidation are turning children away from the sport in record numbers to pursue sports they believe to be more "fun" or simply to be with their friends.

Our goal with the American Youth Tennis Association is to encourage a sense of 'Community', typically not found in tennis, in addition to player development by abandoning the lesson/tournament model and replacing it with the 'Team Sports' model. This combination of self-reliance partnered with teamwork produces a more well-rounded person as well as a more enjoyable experience.

Within the parameters of the TEAM concept, players are required to cooperate; a skill not learned in isolation. Players learn responsibility and accountability because there are others depending on them. Players learn to persevere and to support their teammates when they may be going through some difficulty. Players learn respect for the rules and for authority because their Coach, and a Referee, are always present. These and much more are learned while participating in sports other than tennis. And as such, tennis players tend to become self-centered, cynical, intolerant of others mistakes, and unable to cooperate. We're out to change all of that. Four teams at a time!

Over the past year and a half we've been sharing our unique style of youth tennis with the children in Palm Springs, FL and the surrounding communities.  But it's time to share it with all of Florida and America. From team uniforms, to Coaches, to Referees, to Team and individual awards, to the Playoffs and field trips, children love playing here. In fact, over the past 5 seasons, and out of the 90 players who have participated in our Youth Tennis League, 71 have played multiple Seasons. That's a 79% retention rate! We must be doing something right.

We believe more children would perticipate/benefit from tennis if it were marketed properly. And by that we mean Team Tennis. There's a pride in being part of the Team. Simply putting on the uniform can boost a child's confidence. The lack of which can make a child feel like an outsider. And nobody wants that.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $16,000 to seed the project. This money would include trademark registrations, billboard and bus bench advertising, trade show booth setups, capital improvements, uniform upgrades, as well as Referee/Coach/P&R Department  recruiting efforts, among other things.

But the American Youth Tennis Association is only the beginning. As Team Tennis begins to grab hold of the American conscience, the next logical step would be to produce a Professional Tennis League, similar to the NBA... but for tennis. Imagine being a part of the next great wave of tennis in America. Imagine seeing as many kids on the tennis court as on the basketball court. Imagine children wearing the jersey of their favorite tennis team/player. Imagine cheering for the Home Town Tennis team... more than once a year. More on that later.

Anything less than the stated goal will be directed towards efforts to expand the League, locally. Everything helps as we continue to share the message of tennis as a Team Sport. And for your contribution of $175 or more you will reveive your very own, custom-made jersey of your favorite team with your name on the back.

The Impact

Too much of America (including adults) feel like tennis is 'scary'. There are numerous reasons why people choose not to play; too difficult, too much running, can't keep the ball in play, too hot outside, etc. But there's an answer to every one of these objections, and many of them can be answered with two simple words: Team Tennis. The Team acts as a container big enough to hold players of every ability because while one player is learning, there's another one carrying them. Especially when dealing with children, if there isn't some sort of success early on, children become discouraged and quit. But they can't tell you why they don't want to do it anymore. They simply say 'It's boring' or 'I don't like it'.

But we have witnessed, first hand, the transformation of players on the tennis court because of the support structure of the Team. When they fall, there's someone there to pick them up. Having a bad day isn't so bad when your friends are there to help you forget about it.

We have done "exhaustive" research and have discovered that children often do not play a sport for the 'Love' of the game, but for other things like friends, the uniform, or because their parents are making them play. Regardless of the reason, the emphasis in tennis has always been about Winning. So lessons are required and tournaments are the only place to get ranking points. Tennis has never been about Fun, for children, but rather player development. I guess the thinking is "If they are good, they'll have fun". That is backwards. We have discovered "If they are having fun, they'll play better."

Other Ways You Can Help

Every great Sports League thrives on the 'cool' factor. So be sure to tell everyone you know about the Youth Tennis League in Palm Springs, FL. Let them know that there IS an alternative to boring lessons and scary tournaments. Kids need friends. And the American Youth Tennis Association is here to rescue kids from bad tennis.

Also, be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools to let everyone know about us.

GO TEAM!

story:
Multiplayer Survival Simulation set on board Space Stations far away from Earth.


Centration is a unique multiplayer survival experience. Players take on the role of a member of crew on board a space station in a solar system far from our own. Your goal is to survive with your fellow crew to the end of your shift.

Easy job, you might say? You couldn't be more wrong. Centration throws every obstacle imaginable at you - the environment, the cold vacuum of space, explosions, gasses, side objectives, and of course, other players. 

You have the state-of-the-art tools of the trade at your disposal, you have an entire space station to explore and vandalise in whatever way you see fit. You could spend your shift sitting in your office wiling away the hours playing a little bit of SpaceTag with your fellow crew on the station computers; or you could spend it sprinting through the corridors of the station, attempting to escape inevitable death from one of the many forms in which it will come.

The Story

Centration is set in 2152, where after centuries of development and growth, corporate entities have essentially taken control of humanity. They patrol the skies and the streets... and they control who lives or dies. UniTech, the biggest of the corporations, owns or directly controls more than 60% of the world's economy. They have established a government-like entity with a military and fleet of combat-ready spacecraft in order to police the band of squabbling corporations. 

Humanity is desperate to escape and UniTech is going to provide that escape. The Centration expedition is a corporate-funded endeavour to colonize the moon of a gas giant in the Keplar-16 solar system. Preliminary probe scanning has proven it to be capable of sustaining human life, and the moon will provide a perfect starting point for a human colony in a new solar system. 

The launch of the expedition goes well, as UniTech forces arrive and set up space stations and habitation modules in orbit while the company investigates the surface properly.

A Typical Game

You start a game of Centration when everything is swell and dandy. Nothing in the world could go wrong on such a beautiful day in outer space, right? 

Wrong.

You're a crew member on board one of the state-of-the-art space stations in the Keplar-16 solar system, on a mission of vital importance to UniTech. You have duties to carry out, whether you're an engineer or a medical technician. You'll go about doing what you need to do to make sure the space station stays in working order. The calm before the storm.

Sooner or later, someone inevitably breaks something. Someone might have a mission to kill you, or one of your crew. They might be tasked with sabotaging the station, stealing some chemical or important data, or they might just be causing havoc for the sake of entertainment.

The station's security will naturally try to keep order, protect the crew, while the engineers will keep the station functioning. The medics will heal and the officers will lead. The storm. 

Centration is played your way, and what happens during a round will differ massively from one to the next. A quiet shift where you don't even realise something's gone wrong until it's all done and over with. A crazy shift culminating in the death of the entire crew. A really long shift where everything goes wrong, and you and your crew try your hardest to keep on top of everything and it just seems never ending... then comes the conclusion period. The end of your little story. Have you survived this long? Will you survive to the end? There's a shuttle on its way to rescue you. There are escape pods, space suits, and there's also death. 

The shift ends when everyone is dead, the time limit is reached, everyone has left the station permanently (shuttle or escape pods), or the antagonist has successfully fulfilled all of his/her objectives.


Features at a Glance

A first-person survival horror sandbox, Centration delivers some of the most dynamic features you've ever seen in a computer game. 

  • Airflow that flows around the station, providing you with that vital air... or maybe poison? 
  • Electric Systems that power every bit of machinery you operate
  • Scripting that controls the machinery
  • Realistic Physics (Yes, that includes explosive decompressions.)
  • Combat - Brutal, visceral, and most of all... dangerous. Centration isn't about face-paced, in-your-face combat. There's no running and gunning. It's not an shoot 'em up. It's a battle for survival. Everything is a weapon, with limitless potential for creativity.
  • Health - You can bleed, suffocate, burn, get poisoned, and break. 
  • Computing - Keep an eye on vital statistics and information, send interdepartmental messages, or just browse Facebook.
  • Multiplayer Round-Based - You play online with dozens of others, in rounds that could last from 5 minutes to 5 hours. 
  • Fully interactive environment - If you can see it, you can interact with it. Don't like that table? Move it. Don't like that console? Re-install it. Don't like that crew-member? Eject them. Don't like that window? Break it. You get the picture.
  • Persistent character statistics - grow your character over time, increase your competency, earn credits, evolve.
  • Computers to do everything from play games to browsing the web.. all from in-game. What better way to pass the time than browse reddit or youtube while your fellow crew-mates kill each other off?
  • Science! Perform amazing scientific experiments with the help of your friends, mix chemicals together and discover the potentially explosive results or see what happens when you feed antimatter to a monkey. (Hint: It doesn't go well for the monkey.)

Who are we?

Angry Engineers Entertainment are a group of avid creative and dedicated developers with a shared passion for creating games. Centration has been a passion of ours for some time now, it's been our baby and we've nurtured it from little seeds of ideas in our minds to a sprouting sapling that needs gentle care and attention in order to grow into a giant redwood. But enough of the analogies; let's get into what we're asking.


How are we releasing Centration?

Centration is a commercial one-off fee project with two main types of membership:

Basic
Basic membership implies full ownership of the core game on release. This is aimed at giving those who do not wish to purchase the entire game a chance to try it out before backing us completely.

Premium
Premium membership implies full ownership of the entire game, all future updates and content free of charge, along with early access to new information, exclusive access to areas of our website and forums and special goodies that are just for you guys. This is by far the most popular option.

We do not believe in subscription fees and we do not believe in charging for content updates (DLC). Once you own Centration, you own Centration, you do not have to put another penny into the game to get the most enjoyment from it.

Centration is made with the Unity engine - a powerful 3D engine that has been used for many popular games such as Kerbal Space Program, Wasteland 2, Endless Space and more. 

We plan on making the best use of the features available to us with Unity 3D Pro, which also gives us the ability to launch on the following platforms:

  • PC - Windows
  • PC - Linux
  • PC - MAC
  • Oculus Rift Support

Steam Distribution

Thanks to Steam Greenlight, we've been greenlit on Steam by the community and approved by the awesome ladies and gentlemen over at Valve for distribution via Steam.

Our primary distribution platform is Steam. We've got a digital distribution agreement in place with Steam which allows us to release, sell and distribute Centration via the biggest game distribution platform in the world. 


Centration is an ambitious project. It aims to bring some of the best kinds of gameplay mechanics together along with simulation mechanics to create an experience that can be enjoyed for hours, days, weeks, even months on end - no game will be the same, none will have the same outcome or the same sequence of events; and the realism we're focusing on will make for one hell of an entertaining project.

Our primary budget for Centration is $60,000 USD. So far, we've raised $20,000 USD towards that budget. We're here now, to ask for the remaining $40,000 USD to help us complete Centration and make it the roaring success that the game, and all of you, deserve. 

Anything you can contribute towards our budget is most welcome, be it as little as $1.00 USD, your contribution will be remembered forever.

Here's a run-down on what we've used our current budget for, and what we need the rest for.

Of the $20,000 we've raised, we've been able to purchase various Unity Pro licences for our team, we've been able to purchase and set up the required back-end equipment and servers to run the core multiplayer requirements of Centration and lastly we've put money into ensuring the project can at least continue at a slow pace should our funding goal not be reached.

The $40,000 we're asking for will go towards helping our team push Centration into beta on Steam by Summer 2014. Here's what we'll be using it for:

Equipment 
Every team needs to stay on top of the trend and make sure their games run perfectly on both low-end and high-end machines. Some of us are still working on our personal machines that are simply not up to standard and it's slowing the project down immensely as a result.

Asset-Creation
The core of every game is its code, followed very closely by the art, 3D and sound assets. The creation of these assets is a lengthy and costly process, our modellers are kind enough to do this for free at the moment but free time is in short supply and the ability to offset their expenses, pay for licencing, etc. will mean a steady flow of assets for Centration.

Additional Licencing
We're planning on bringing in a lot of technology that's been proven and tested, but that comes at a cost - voice communication in-game, proven networking tools, powerful UI elements, and an amazing sound technology engine. All of these costs real money to licence and use, and we'll be using the money raised with this campaign to offset those costs.

Expenses
Electricity, heating, server costs, repairs to equipment, coffee... all these expenses are real problems with the creation of a project like Centration, and the ability to handle those expenses without our budget being reached.

Additional Funding
If our goal is exceeded, we've got a lot of other things we'd love to include in Centration. We've listed a few below to get you salivating:

  • Motion Capture
  • Oculus Rift platform release
  • More objectives, events, and maps
  • More scientific features (chemistry, biomedical, astrophysics)
  • Lots more assets to play with
  • More features, sooner.


Our team is made up of industry-experienced, entry level and passionate creative, hard-working and loyal people. We've tapped into passionate developers from universities and we've got a group of hard-working individuals who are determined to make a real difference.

Aaron is 26 years old and lives in Paris, France. He has had a passion for games ever since he was old enough to use a computer, with particular interest in survival and action games. His experience stems from working with the original team on Space Station 13 - a semi popular tile-based survival game of which served as a primary inspiration for the concept behind Centration.

Michael is 19 and comes from Milton Keynes, United Kingdom. He is a passionate gamer and has a unique way of viewing the world. Michael met Aaron online, and have been friends for years before they came together to make Centration a reality. Michael currently attends university and has a high working technical knowledge of games and their creation. 

Ian is the lead-developer for Centration, focusing mainly on man-handling all of those code-monkeys, ensuring they're well fed and keep working diligently. He has a high professional experience in leading a team of programmers and this experience is translating very well on this project.

We found Nelson at a game-artists expo in the USA, showing off some of his space-ships. We knew there and then we wanted him on the team and so pitched the idea to him. He was thrilled by the idea and even brought his brother on board too. Nelson has a high working knowledge of 3D modelling and this experience is vital to leading our team of artists.

Katy is a legend. The concept art you see here, the concept art we have on our site, it's mostly her work. She has been instrumental in helping our vision come to life before our eyes with her amazing artwork. She's a gamer with extraordinary talent, and we're damned lucky to have her on board.

His past experience in composing for indie games notwithstanding, Cory is by far one of the most amazing composers we could have imagined. We wouldn't swap him for Hans Zimmer, and that's saying something. Katy helped us see our vision first. Cory helped us hear it first. We almost cried with joy.

The rewards for backing Centration are designed to give you awesome goodies for your pledge. From the classics such as t-shirts and hoodies to really unique gifts such as our collectors edition 3D printed models and USB sticks! 

The idea is giving you value for your pledge, so you get something back that's worth the pledge!

Check out the perks on the right and see what you can get for your buck! 


Every single pledge helps us. The support and loyalty to the project that our community has shown us is what has kept us going so far, and your support on this campaign will help us keep going for many months yet.

If you can't pledge to the project, that's fine! But please share and spread the word so that others can pitch in and get in on this awesome project early on, and help us make Centration a reality.

What happens if we don't meet our goal?
We've opted for a flexible campaign. This is because we can use every single cent give to us to help create this experience. If we don't meet the goal, however, things will take a lot longer than we would like them to, the project may stall or have to be shelved for a period of time while we work on other avenues of funding. 

Working on a game like Centration is a big commitment and a lot of our team are taking a lot of their free time and putting it straight into the project - the funding will help us accomplish our goals within our set time frame, deliver an amazing experience and most importantly, survive while doing so! 

Thank you all. <3

But enough of the analogies; let's get into what we're asking.How are we releasing Centration?Centration is a commercial one-off fee project with two main types of membership:BasicBasic membership implies full ownership of the core game on release. This is aimed at giving those who do not wish to purchase the entire game a chance to try it out before backing us completely.PremiumPremium membership implies full ownership of the entire game, all future updates and content free of charge, along with early access to new information, exclusive access to areas of our website and forums and special goodies that are just for you guys. This is by far the most popular option.We do not believe in subscription fees and we do not believe in charging for content updates (DLC). Once you own Centration, you own Centration, you do not have to put another penny into the game to get the most enjoyment from it.Centration is made with the Unity engine - a powerful 3D engine that has been used for many popular games such as Kerbal Space Program, Wasteland 2, Endless Space and more. We plan on making the best use of the features available to us with Unity 3D Pro, which also gives us the ability to launch on the following platforms:
PC - Windows
PC - Linux
PC - MAC
Oculus Rift Support
Steam DistributionThanks to Steam Greenlight, we've been greenlit on Steam by the community and approved by the awesome ladies and gentlemen over at Valve for distribution via Steam.Our primary distribution platform is Steam. We've got a digital distribution agreement in place with Steam which allows us to release, sell and distribute Centration via the biggest game distribution platform in the world. Centration is an ambitious project. It aims to bring some of the best kinds of gameplay mechanics together along with simulation mechanics to create an experience that can be enjoyed for hours, days, weeks, even months on end - no game will be the same, none will have the same outcome or the same sequence of events; and the realism we're focusing on will make for one hell of an entertaining project.Our primary budget for Centration is $60,000 USD. So far, we've raised $20,000 USD towards that budget. We're here now, to ask for the remaining $40,000 USD to help us complete Centration and make it the roaring success that the game, and all of you, deserve. Anything you can contribute towards our budget is most welcome, be it as little as $1.00 USD, your contribution will be remembered forever.Here's a run-down on what we've used our current budget for, and what we need the rest for.Of the $20,000 we've raised, we've been able to purchase various Unity Pro licences for our team, we've been able to purchase and set up the required back-end equipment and servers to run the core multiplayer requirements of Centration and lastly we've put money into ensuring the project can at least continue at a slow pace should our funding goal not be reached.The $40,000 we're asking for will go towards helping our team push Centration into beta on Steam by Summer 2014. Here's what we'll be using it for:Equipment Every team needs to stay on top of the trend and make sure their games run perfectly on both low-end and high-end machines. Some of us are still working on our personal machines that are simply not up to standard and it's slowing the project down immensely as a result.Asset-CreationThe core of every game is its code, followed very closely by the art, 3D and sound assets. The creation of these assets is a lengthy and costly process, our modellers are kind enough to do this for free at the moment but free time is in short supply and the ability to offset their expenses, pay for licencing, etc. will mean a steady flow of assets for Centration.Additional LicencingWe're planning on bringing in a lot of technology that's been proven and tested, but that comes at a cost - voice communication in-game, proven networking tools, powerful UI elements, and an amazing sound technology engine. All of these costs real money to licence and use, and we'll be using the money raised with this campaign to offset those costs.ExpensesElectricity, heating, server costs, repairs to equipment, coffee... all these expenses are real problems with the creation of a project like Centration, and the ability to handle those expenses without our budget being reached.Additional FundingIf our goal is exceeded, we've got a lot of other things we'd love to include in Centration. We've listed a few below to get you salivating:
Motion Capture
Oculus Rift platform release
More objectives, events, and maps
More scientific features (chemistry, biomedical, astrophysics)
Lots more assets to play with
More features, sooner.
Our team is made up of industry-experienced, entry level and passionate creative, hard-working and loyal people. We've tapped into passionate developers from universities and we've got a group of hard-working individuals who are determined to make a real difference.Aaron is 26 years old and lives in Paris, France. He has had a passion for games ever since he was old enough to use a computer, with particular interest in survival and action games. His experience stems from working with the original team on Space Station 13 - a semi popular tile-based survival game of which served as a primary inspiration for the concept behind Centration.Michael is 19 and comes from Milton Keynes, United Kingdom. He is a passionate gamer and has a unique way of viewing the world. Michael met Aaron online, and have been friends for years before they came together to make Centration a reality. Michael currently attends university and has a high working technical knowledge of games and their creation. Ian is the lead-developer for Centration, focusing mainly on man-handling all of those code-monkeys, ensuring they're well fed and keep working diligently. He has a high professional experience in leading a team of programmers and this experience is translating very well on this project.We found Nelson at a game-artists expo in the USA, showing off some of his space-ships. We knew there and then we wanted him on the team and so pitched the idea to him. He was thrilled by the idea and even brought his brother on board too. Nelson has a high working knowledge of 3D modelling and this experience is vital to leading our team of artists.Katy is a legend. The concept art you see here, the concept art we have on our site, it's mostly her work. She has been instrumental in helping our vision come to life before our eyes with her amazing artwork. She's a gamer with extraordinary talent, and we're damned lucky to have her on board.His past experience in composing for indie games notwithstanding, Cory is by far one of the most amazing composers we could have imagined. We wouldn't swap him for Hans Zimmer, and that's saying something. Katy helped us see our vision first. Cory helped us hear it first. We almost cried with joy.The rewards for backing Centration are designed to give you awesome goodies for your pledge. From the classics such as t-shirts and hoodies to really unique gifts such as our collectors edition 3D printed models and USB sticks! The idea is giving you value for your pledge, so you get something back that's worth the pledge!Check out the perks on the right and see what you can get for your buck! Every single pledge helps us. The support and loyalty to the project that our community has shown us is what has kept us going so far, and your support on this campaign will help us keep going for many months yet.If you can't pledge to the project, that's fine! But please share and spread the word so that others can pitch in and get in on this awesome project early on, and help us make Centration a reality.What happens if we don't meet our goal?We've opted for a flexible campaign. This is because we can use every single cent give to us to help create this experience. If we don't meet the goal, however, things will take a lot longer than we would like them to, the project may stall or have to be shelved for a period of time while we work on other avenues of funding. Working on a game like Centration is a big commitment and a lot of our team are taking a lot of their free time and putting it straight into the project - the funding will help us accomplish our goals within our set time frame, deliver an amazing experience and most importantly, survive while doing so! Thank you all. <3

story:
My Story

Most respectfully, I draw your kind attention to the fact that I am ANWESHA MISHRA  from INDIA (State of ODISHA) a ten years old girl and an Internationally rated Chess Player. I started playing chess in the year 2008 at the age of 6. After a short period, I made my debut in the Under-7 State Championship in the year 2009 and stood 2nd and qualified for the National Under-7 Championship 2009 where I stood 10th in the merit list. Last year, I participated in the KIIT Cup International Grandmaster Chess Championship 2011 and made a remarkable performance by playing 11 rounds against rated opponents and achieving my Elo rating of 1583 in one go, which was the highest in the country in my age group. I was also awarded the best Under-9 girl participant from the State in the KIIT Cup. During 2011, I also became Champion in the Under-9 State Championship leaving behind some of the renowned players like the Asian and World Under-8 silver medallists who had also participated. By virtue of this State Championship, I qualified to participate in the Under-9 National Chess Championship 2011. In the Under-9 National Chess Championship 2011, I was the Top Seed in the tournament. I came out with flying colours by becoming the Runners-Up (2nd) in the Under-9 National Chess Championship 2011 by beating renowned players of Andhra Pradesh, Tamil Nadu, Maharastra & Goa. All these achievements have been garnered by me from a very early stage of my life.

                        Unfortunately, a player of my calibre has only participated in not more than 8 major tournaments in my entire career. In the few tournaments that I have played, I have achieved astounding results, some of which have been mentioned above. Despite my financial hardship and limited resources that was provided to me by my parents, I have made the best use of my talent and has come out with flying colours without any professional coaching. I require skilled and specialized training and regular tournament exposure in India and abroad. Though there are professional GM trainers in India and abroad, their fees are far too expensive. GM trainer in India charges a sum of around Rs 4,000 INR per day. Further, the entry fee for the norm tournaments in India are near about Rs 10,000 INR and expenditures are even more when played outside India as it includes airfare and boarding and an expensive entry fee.

                        Further it is pertinent to mention that I have been selected automatically being the runners up of National Under – 9, 2011 to represent India in the Asian Youth Championship at Sri Lanka during June, 2012 and World Youth Championship at Slovenia during November, 2012 from Odisha. It is very vital to mention here that I have participated in the recently concluded ASIAN YOUTH CHESS CHAMPIONSHIP 2012 AT SRILANKA (24th June to 2nd July, 2012) and AWARDED WITH A GOLD MEDAL FOR INDIA.THIS IS ONE OF MY BIGGEST ACHIEVEMENT IN CHESS (Copy of All Details Uploaded). Now I am preparing hard myself for the WORLD YOUTH CHESS CHAMPIONSHIP, 2012 AT MARIBOR, SLOVENIA FROM 07TH NOV. 2012 TO 19TH NOV. 2012. It is humbly submitted that most of the talented players have sponsors behind them. I have none to back me up for these prestigious Championships.

Below are the estimated expenditure details:

  • Rs 3.50 LAKHS INR(6,278 USD)  - Towards Participation in World Youth Chess, 2012 at Slovenia which includes reg.fee,entry fee,visa charges,air fares,transportation,boarding and lodging etc.for me and one accompanying person. From 4.11 2012 to 22.11.2012.
  • Rs 3 LAKHS INR(5,381 USD) -  Towards Coaching which includes online coaching, personal coaching, and group coaching throughout the whole year by top level chess Grand Masters and coaching centres to realize my dream.

Arrangement of fund details by my father:

  • Rs 80000 INR (1435 USD) from his own savings and some amount from relatives. It is pertinent to mention that he had taken me to SRILANKA for Asian Youth Chess Championship, 2012(June21st to July, 2012) recently and almost exhausted his savings. Two costly trips within same year is actually beyond his capacity as a single earning member of the family.
  • Rs 70000 INR (1256 USD) through local sponsors and good wishers.                       

What We Need & What You Get

It is humbly requested that a minimum fund of 7000 USD (Rs 3.9 Lakhs approx.) in form of financial aid is indispensable for the above enumerated purpose. It is to bring to your kind notice that this huge amount is beyond the capacity for me and my family to gather.

This much needed fund will certainly help me in sharpening my chess acumen, understanding, skill, strategy and most importantly providing me with the much needed experience and exposure. I envisage a bright future and am sure to excel in the national and the international arena and bring glory to my country. Hence, I sincerely appeal here for Financial Help to make it possible for me to represent India in World Youth Chess Championship, 2012 and to achieve my long cherished dream as well as goal.

Apart from giving ‘A Big THANK YOU’, this small child will make a sincere effort to distribute online posters containing important and memorable snaps captured by me and my family. Further during and after my trip to Slovenia, to the extent possible, I wish to share my experiences with all of my supporters by maintaining a blog. Beyond that, I hope all will get the rich satisfaction of knowing they are supporting a child talent and helping her in their life to realize a child’s dream.

The Impact

I have a dream to become the youngest International Master in Chess from India. For this I have to succeed in World Youth Chess, 2012 where in I will get Women Fide Master (WFM) or Women Candidate Master (WCM) if I would be among the top three. Most importantly my achievement as a minor girl child of India will certainly encourage other talented children of my country to see dreams and succeed in their life. Your contributions shall certainly help me to pursue my ambitions and aspirations.

Lastly your kind contributions/financial handholding will certainly help me to achieve my goals to bring glory to my country at a very early age.

“Pranam” and A most sincere "Thank You".

Other Ways You Can Help

Contribution is not the only way you can help:

  • Share this campaign with all your colleagues and friends.

Your contributions shall certainly help me to pursue my ambitions and aspirations.

“Pranam” and A most sincere "Thank You".
Other Ways You Can Help
Contribution is not the only way you can help:

story:
Introduction

Sword & Board Games was founded in 2011 by a group of experienced gamers that have played numerous card, board and miniature games over the years and know what makes an enjoyable game.

 

The Game

Set on the fantasy world of Lumria, RUNE is a 28mm scale tabletop skirmish game for 2 or more players. Players take control of a warband of different fantasy creatures that fight over a variety of terrain locales. Models in your warband gain skills, improve their abilities and find awesome equipment during games and special encounters.

Unlike some fantasy games, Rune's individual factions are made up of warriors from different fantasy races. For example your warband may comprise of a Human, an Elf, a Halfling, an Orc, an Ogre and a Goblin. Each having different skills and abilities. 

Our rules system is clear and easy to understand for both new and veteran gamers alike.

Concept Art & Work in Progress

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Costs


Our target of $2500 will enable us to produce our first faction box of seven white metal miniatures, create a clockwork construct miniature for the Geniocracy of Toth faction, help us to print the Rune rule book and also produce a limited edition character model Ser Ronald Ashworthy. 

We will be assisted in our endeavour by the talented team at Flytrap Factory who will be helping us create our sculpts and moulds.

The funding goal goes directly to pay sculptors who will be sculpting the miniatures, making the master moulds, as well as all of the other production costs like casting, packaging and various other expenses that go into making a finished product.

We have our ideas, now we need your help to turn our ideas into reality. With five years ( that's right FIVE years) of products planned for this game we need to get started right away.

 

Campaign Goals

 

As mentioned above our goal for this campaign is to raise the funds needed to create our first faction box of 7 miniatures, create a clockwork construct miniature for the faction, print the rule book and produce a Ltd Ed character miniature.

However we would like to achieve as many of the following stretch goals as possible.

$2500= Our campaign goal REACHED!!!!! of the Geniocracy of Toth faction box of seven white metal miniatures create a clockwork construct miniature for the Geniocracy of Toth faction, printing of the Rune rule book and Ltd edition Halfling character miniature Ser Ronald Ashworthy.


$4500=Shadow Hold Faction Box. A faction ruled by powerful Rune Casters who brainwash warriors to do their bidding for them. (Concept art for this faction can be found on the gallery page.


$6500= Third Faction Box (Faction Name, details and concept art unlocked when we reach our first stretch goal.

$8500= Fourth Faction Box ( Faction Name, details and concept art unlocked when we reach our second stretch goal.

$11,000 = First Faction Blisters (6 new miniatures) 

$13,500 = Second Faction Blisters ( 6 new miniatures)

$16,000 = Third Faction Blisters ( 6 new miniatures)

$18,500 = Fourth Faction Blisters ( 6 new miniatures)

$20,500 = Fifth Faction Box ( Faction Name, details and concept art unlocked when we reach our second stretch goal.

$23,000 = Sixth Faction Box ( Faction Name, details and concept art unlocked when we reach our second stretch goal.

$25,500 = Seventh Faction Box ( Faction Name, details and concept art unlocked when we reach our second stretch goal.

$28,000 = Eighth Faction Box ( Faction Name, details and concept art unlocked when we reach our second stretch goal.

$30,000 = Fifth Faction Blisters ( 6 new miniatures)

$32,500 = Sixth Faction Blisters ( 6 new miniatures)

$35,000 = Seventh Faction Blisters ( 6 new miniatures)

$37,500 = Eighth Faction Blisters ( 6 new miniatures)

$41,000 = 6 Character Models

 

MORE TO UNLOCK!!!!!!

 

Perks

If we raise more than our initial target we will be adding some new perks as well as adding to some existing ones.

 


Important notice: All miniatures supplied unpainted and may require some assembly. (Unless otherwise stated.) Depending on the goals reached production time may take longer for the additional stretch goal achievements. All main goal items are estimated to be shipped to recipients in March 2013. Note that the faction box may be distributed in a blister pack.

 

*The Master Caster perk "a character designed to your specifications"  specifications are chosen from a list provided by us upon completion of this campaign. (dont worry, there will be a lot of options)
