story:
Hey everybody!

Rowdy Apps Games here, Debbie & T.G. Over the past few months, we've begun writing and coding the first steps towards what will be a fantastic, dream inspired adventure game for the iPad and iPhone with the sort of sweet, tight gameplay that we feel these devices are worthy of. Right now we're basically a team of 2 - Debbie Ray and T.G. Robinson - and we're making an indie ios game, tentatively called, "Flying Critters" for the iPhone & iPad.

In December & January we released some basic information about the game to a few of our game developer peers and a few close friends that led to some interesting comments and generally positive feedback about our game.

Since that time we've had several people asking us about when the game will be ready and also about the possibility for us to open the game up to pre-orders, make the game available on multiple devices and a lot more. The amount of positive feedback from our family, friends and peers has been simply amazing.

Opening up pre-orders for the game could be one way to go about this, but instead we want to make things a lot more interactive and interesting and also to allow the ios community and gamers of all kinds a chance to participate in actually shaping how the game finally ends up. Not to mention giving all our investors a place to appear in our final game credits. Because if you take the chance to fund us here today, that's exactly what we'd consider you, our partner!


About Flying Critters

Flying Critters is a simple flying, fantasy and action arcade type game about flying, critters, dreams, coins and hoping to get set on fire. Yeah, in this game that's a good thing.

Think Doctor Doolittle meets The Flying Nun. Add a lot of airtime, multiple dream lands, all sorts of fantastic and happy little critters, imaginative objectives and you've got our game.

Your wild adventure is to personally help these normally land locked animals live up to their high flying dreams. Sometimes you'll do good, sometimes not so much, sometimes you'll get some coins, sometimes you might catch on fire! Flame on!

But when you do play our game you will get the opportunity to experience a simple game that is both easy to play, yet hard to master at the same time. A fine line for sure.


Why We Need Your Money and Help

Well, for one thing, we want to know that the ios community and all of you out there are on our side by supporting a couple of dreamers in making our dream game a reality. Secondly, with your help and support, we hope to release a game that fully exceeds all our expectations and yours too.

The online community takes a huge role in exactly what makes or breaks an indie game project. And the more people who take the time here to pledge, the bigger, better and more incredible Flying Critters will be. If our entire 100% goal is met, you can definitely expect to see this  game come out on Apple's iPad, iPod Touch & iPhone too. And if we go way beyond our goal, think Android baby!

Right now we have some basic stuff done, we've already got a lot of art and music, a basic demo, and a lot of ideas. However our dream of making this wonderful little game a reality needs your help. Our game is going to involve a lot of hours of intense animation and level design - and it's extremely important to us that our coders and artists continue to be paid for their work, and our own limited resources are dwindling. Plus, we've got really cool prizes for all our backers!

What the Money Will Be Used For

100% of the requested funding will be used to:

    â€¢    Increase production values (add better visuals, sounds, MORE FUN OBJECTIVES - you name it)

    â€¢    Bring the complete game to the iOS (iPad, iPod Touch & iPhone)

    â€¢    Marketing

Everything over 100% will contribute to:

    â€¢    Acquire one more Apple computer to work on

    â€¢    Marketing 

    â€¢    Acquire a years membership to Corona (all platforms)

    â€¢    Bring the complete game to the Android Marketplace


Other Ways You Can Help

We invite you to open your hearts (wallets), and give the gift of your love (money) and time (send a tweet or leave a FB update about us) to help create a new, incredible Flying Critters gaming experience! We need your help to make this a success!

If you are unable to donate money, we completely understand, but there is still way you can help. Word of mouth is an incredibly powerful tool. If you have a moment please spread the word about our campaign. Tell your friends, send a few tweets or maybe even make a post on your Facebook page about us.

The more people see our campaign, the better chance we have to make this work out exactly as we want it to work! Thank you for any and all support. We know that with your help we can make the best flying critters iphone, ipad (and maybe even android too) game the world has ever seen!

The amount of positive feedback from our family, friends and peers has been simply amazing. 
Opening up pre-orders for the game could be one way to go about this, but instead we want to make things a lot more interactive and interesting and also to allow the ios community and gamers of all kinds a chance to participate in actually shaping how the game finally ends up. Not to mention giving all our investors a place to appear in our final game credits. Because if you take the chance to fund us here today, that's exactly what we'd consider you, our partner!


About Flying Critters
Flying Critters is a simple flying, fantasy and action arcade type game about flying, critters, dreams, coins and hoping to get set on fire. Yeah, in this game that's a good thing. 
Think Doctor Doolittle meets The Flying Nun. Add a lot of airtime, multiple dream lands, all sorts of fantastic and happy little critters, imaginative objectives and you've got our game. 
Your wild adventure is to personally help these normally land locked animals live up to their high flying dreams. Sometimes you'll do good, sometimes not so much, sometimes you'll get some coins, sometimes you might catch on fire! Flame on! 
But when you do play our game you will get the opportunity to experience a simple game that is both easy to play, yet hard to master at the same time. A fine line for sure.


Why We Need Your Money and Help

Well, for one thing, we want to know that the ios community and all of you out there are on our side by supporting a couple of dreamers in making our dream game a reality. Secondly, with your help and support, we hope to release a game that fully exceeds all our expectations and yours too.
The online community takes a huge role in exactly what makes or breaks an indie game project. And the more people who take the time here to pledge, the bigger, better and more incredible Flying Critters will be. If our entire 100% goal is met, you can definitely expect to see this  game come out on Apple's iPad, iPod Touch & iPhone too. And if we go way beyond our goal, think Android baby! 
Right now we have some basic stuff done, we've already got a lot of art and music, a basic demo, and a lot of ideas. However our dream of making this wonderful little game a reality needs your help. Our game is going to involve a lot of hours of intense animation and level design - and it's extremely important to us that our coders and artists continue to be paid for their work, and our own limited resources are dwindling. Plus, we've got really cool prizes for all our backers!

What the Money Will Be Used For
100% of the requested funding will be used to:
    â€¢    Increase production values (add better visuals, sounds, MORE FUN OBJECTIVES - you name it)
    â€¢    Bring the complete game to the iOS (iPad, iPod Touch & iPhone)
    â€¢    MarketingEverything over 100% will contribute to:
    â€¢    Acquire one more Apple computer to work on
    â€¢    Marketing  
    â€¢    Acquire a years membership to Corona (all platforms)
    â€¢    Bring the complete game to the Android Marketplace


Other Ways You Can Help
We invite you to open your hearts (wallets), and give the gift of your love (money) and time (send a tweet or leave a FB update about us) to help create a new, incredible Flying Critters gaming experience! We need your help to make this a success! If you are unable to donate money, we completely understand, but there is still way you can help. Word of mouth is an incredibly powerful tool. If you have a moment please spread the word about our campaign. Tell your friends, send a few tweets or maybe even make a post on your Facebook page about us. The more people see our campaign, the better chance we have to make this work out exactly as we want it to work! Thank you for any and all support. We know that with your help we can make the best flying critters iphone, ipad (and maybe even android too) game the world has ever seen!

story:
The Game

Can you imagine what it would be like to be part of a huge medieval online world, where there were no NPCs and no quests, but where all the day in and day out tasks and socializing and battling were planned and carried out by real people? This is the essence of Thrones of Valorâ„¢

In the world of Thrones of Valor, there are 6 Realms, each with a castle, a King or Queen, and many Knights of Valor.

In each realm, surrounding the palace, are 24 villages. Each village has a Lord with a castle, a Steward working for the Lord, a Tavern, Mercantile Shops run by proprietors, and citizens who own Manors, Cottages, Hovels and Travel wagons.

All real people, 100% Pure Meat!


The game of Thrones of Valor is about realm versus realm battling. It's about winning or losing territory. It's about forming guilds and raid parties and having sophisticated ways of holding secret meetings to plan strategy. It's about bartering, trading goods, abilities, equipment, and gold. And it's about socializing, forming relationships with your fellow citizens, forming diplomatic relationships with other realms, and even spying on and collecting intelligence on other realms.

The thread that holds all of this together, is our philosophy of offering the community brilliant graphics, immersive music and sound effects, powerful communication tools such as video, audio and text chat, flexible systems for trading, and ways to constantly improve your characters, yet leaving the "how" to you. You have the world and the tools, yet you will have to decide along with your fellow citizens of the realm, how you will conduct yourselves and play the game.

Will the natural leaders you elect, lead you to ruthless battle, or to pursue diplomatic solutions? Will you spend your time in Thrones of Valor fighting to keep your village from being swept into another realm, or will you spend your time hanging out with friends, trading items, and going to the tavern to enjoy some ale? Again, the play is up to you.

The Technology

When you back Thrones of Valor, you're backing a game with 80% of the technology already built and customer-tested during the past 3 years. Thrones of Valor is being built into our popular Virtual Tabletop software iTabletop. iTabletop, written in Microsoft Silverlight and which runs on PC and Mac, has over 7,000 customers in its community, and is a platform built for creating media-rich immersive worlds and compelling RPG games.

The iTabletop platform already has support for external top-down scrollable maps, customizable avatars (called tokens,) interior high-definition room graphics, music playlists, sound effects, live streaming video and audio for group video and audio chat, and much more.

To build Thrones of Valor, the iTabletop code base will be expanded and improved to handle the new type of game play we're designing for the game. While the current iTabletop is focused on providing tools for gamers to build their own online, webcam-enabled paper & pen style RPG games, Thrones of Valor, on the other hand, is designed to be a huge pre-built MMORTS, with many new features added so that players have an exciting daily play experience.

To keep costs lower and speed development, we have designed Thrones of Valor to take advantage of all that iTabletop currently has to offer.

Thrones of Valor technology will include:

  • Large, top-down 3D maps of all 144 villages. We call these "Exterior" maps.
  • Animated character avatars with the ability to engage in bubble-text chat while walking through the exterior village maps. While hanging out in the exterior village maps, you can socialize, trade items, battle other real players, raid villages, and generally get to where you want to go.
  • Medieval dwellings represented on the exterior village maps that have hot-links to enter their richly-rendered 3D interior spaces. These are dwellings such as cottages, manors, taverns, the great hall, the lord's castle, the Palace as well as many others.
  • Security settings so that dwellings can be open to everyone, to all the players on your friends list, to guild members, to specific players, or even just by invitation only.
  • An invitation system to invite all your friends, guilds, or specific players into the interior of your dwelling for a full-on social experience including video, voice and text chat.
  • Fully customizable interior spaces where you can add your own music, sound effects, graphics, streaming videos, and even documents to share with other players. You make your interior spaces your own, and express yourself the way you want to.
  • A powerful whiteboard system for planning raids or even just goofing off with friends.
  • Email and text notifications for meetings and get-togethers. Imagine receiving an email or text reminding you of a pending raid you've planned to attend. Or notifying you that your village or a neighboring village is being attacked so you can jump online and help defend her with all your might.
  • An inventory trading system used for everything from friendly trading on up to running your own mercantile business.
  • A combat and action resolution system where you pit your stats, abilities, and equipment against your opponent's to see who is victorious. The combat system has similarities to that of a trading card game (TCG), with random digital packs you purchase to keep your character advancing in strength, ability and coolness.
  • An in-game store to purchase costume upgrades, buff-packs, homes, taverns, and other items to constantly improve your game experience.
  • And much more.

 

Noteworthy technology already built into iTabletop:

  • iTabletop is 100% in the cloud using Amazon EC2 (Elastic Cloud Compute), Amazon S3 (Simple Storage Service), and Amazon CloudFront. This means that all graphics, music, SFX, streaming videos and documents in-game are pulled from the Amazon cloud and are cached in every major city around the world. So if you're playing the game from Singapore, all the media loads from Singapore. If you're playing from London, all your media loads from London. This adds up to an extremely fast graphics, audio and media experience in Thrones of Valor.
  • A big part of Thrones of Valor is the experience of being face-to-face with your friends and fellow citizens. iTabletop currently has live webcam streaming servers in the US, the EU and Asia Pacific. This results in low latency for your video chat, perfectly synchronized voice-to-video, and a better overall social experience.
  • iTabletop runs on both PC and Mac due to its Silverlight platform. Also because iTabletop relies on pre-rendered high-definition 3D graphics and sprites instead of real time 3D, it can be played on legacy PCs and Macs, and avoids the motion sickness that real time 3D systems cause in some people.
  • Scalability of systems is paramount for an MMO. With all our servers virtualized in the Amazon EC2 cloud, we can spin up new servers in a matter of minutes and tie everything together through the Amazon Elastic Load Balancer, and take advantage of edge and origin server architecture. While these terms may be foreign to you, just be assured we can swiftly grow as our player base grows.


 

The Pay Model

Thrones of Valor is free to play. Gamesabi will make money selling in-game digital content such as character and costume upgrades, in-game real estate, buff-packs, etc., none of which are necessary to play and have fun. This is a popular trend used by many MMOs such as LOTRO, D&D Online, and others. Players have the ability to jump in and play as much and as often as they like, and only purchase those things that will really impact their own play experience.
 

The Impact

We at Gamesabi feel passionately about building a large online community that has powerful tools to play, and yet has the choice to play the way they desire to play.

We believe in games that foster the maximum in emergent behavior, so that you, the players, end up coming up with ways to play that we never imagined. 

And we look forward to the many real-life new relationships that are formed within the Thrones of Valor community, be they friendship, romance, camaraderie, or even business related.

It's a powerful thing to create a new community of people having fun and being challenged and creating social connections, and we take this commitment and responsibility seriously. We desire to make this a reality, just as we made iTabletop a reality and continue to expand and improve it on a regular basis.

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking to raise $30,000 to make Thrones of Valor a reality. The money you provide will go toward:

  • Expanding and improving the iTabletop game platform. And since all Thrones of Valor perks include a lifetime membership to iTabletop you can start using right now, this will directly impact you beginning immediately.
  • Detailing and refining the Thrones of Valor game design, so we end up with a game that is thrilling and unique to play.
  • Purchasing 3D modeling and rendering assets, in-game music and sound effects licensing, and all the other assets that make up a graphical video game.
  • Composing and rendering 24 exterior village maps. Each of the 6 realms will use these maps.
  • Rendering and constructing interior spaces for each type of medieval dwelling.
  • Covering the monthly costs of the game development. We work to keep this low by working virtually from our home offices and not having to pay for an office lease, but we do pay for our server infrastructure through Amazon.com, our business-level Internet connections, and other development necessities.
  • Eventual use of marketing funds. We strive to keep this low as well, first by opting to use this crowdfunding system at IndieGoGo where we can simultaneously raise funding while at the same time build up our initial player base through the perks we offer. We also work to keep marketing funding needs low by building the game to be more viral, whereby it becomes more fun to play when your friends play, so you naturally tell friends about the game and invite them to play for free.

 

What you get are fun perks that give you something you can do right now, in the form of lifetime memberships to iTabletop.com for use in gaming and creating unique worlds to use for video chat and hanging out with friends and family, and perks that give you something you'll do later when Thrones of Valor is complete. You'll see the perks give you ownership of medieval dwellings, special titles in the game, special abilities and duties, from home owners through Knights of Valor and even on up to King and Queen of the Realm. Perks can even give you the ability to name your village or name your realm.

 

What if we Don't Raise the Entire Goal Amount?

One thing to keep in mind. We as a company have a track record of successfully bootstrapping a commercial gaming product. iTabletop was developed with our own sweat, our own money, and real revenue from customers purchasing lifetime memberships and other special promotions. When you contribute to this campaign, you'll be directly helping us make Thrones of Valor a reality, and yet at the same time if we don't reach our financial goal, we will still continue bootstrapping this game and it will become a reality because we're passionate about it. It will just take a good deal longer! We say this just to help alleviate any concerns that if we don't reach our requested funding goal your contribution will be for nothing. To the contrary, every dollar we receive from this campaign will greatly help move Thrones of Valor and iTabletop forward and won't be wasted.

 

As another safety net, we're giving contributors the iTabletop Lifetime Accounts so that you're getting something of real value right up front. With iTabletop you can play paper/pen RPGs and other board games face to face with your group of friends. You can even use it as a very cool, customizable group video chat application.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Of course spread the word to your friends! Help us find contributors! Make sure that when you play Thrones of Valor, your friends are also there playing. As an encouragement to seek out your friends for contributing to this campaign, at this early stage we can and will accommodate when you request a group of you to be in the same realm and village. Later when released, to keep the game balanced, these kinds of requests will be more difficult or even possibly unavailable. But again, please help spread the word and seek out contributors with whom you want to play the game!

 

Thank you so much for your time and for your considering contributing to this unique and fun game. Please be sure to check the Thrones of Valor website for more information on the game, and the iTabletop website for more information on the technology and community we have built there.

 

Sincerely,

 

KnightErrant (James Auld)

Ranger (Ed Blumberg)

*Common Backer Perks

All backers of Thrones of Valor will receive these perks:

  • Access to Thrones of Valor design forums, with video-chat access to designers and developers to help shape the game experience and begin creating a fun community right away
  • At least one character costume upgrade
  • At least two free additional character buff packs, each containing abilities, equipment and stat buffs
  • Permanent title of "Thrones of Valor Founder" attached to your characters
  • Own your own medieval dwelling, be it a Hovel, Travel Wagon, Cottage, Manor, Tavern, Great Hall, Castle, or Palace! The higher your contribution, the larger and more elaborate the dwelling. Your dwelling will link to a richly-rendered 3D interior where you can meet other players by webcam and/or voice, and where you can add your own graphics, music, sound effects, streaming video, and PDF documents. Your personal dwelling is a private place where you can hang out with friends or hold strategy meetings before a raid.
  • Access to unique founder-related decorations, music, sound effects, videos and other rich-media you can place in your owned dwelling interior. Only campaign contributors will ever have access to this content. 
  • A number of extremely rare TCG stat buffs, abilities and equipment that only campaign contributors can possess

 

Acknowledgements:


Some images copyright DAZ Productions, Inc., dba DAZ 3D. We proudly choose DAZ Studio 4 for our rendering software and DAZ 3D as our source of 3D models, textures and additional content.

Thrones of Valorâ„¢ trademark Gamesabi, Inc. Thrones of Valor game design copyright (c) 2012 Gamesabi, Inc.

story:
What is it?

Initially planned to be released for the iPhone, It is a unique and innovative puzzle mobile game coming soon to iPhone, iPad, Android, Windows Phone and Facebook. Unique and compelling, not only does it educates players, but it also helps them have a great time too. Consequences are a big part of the game, and the learning experience that players gain is a major factor.

Within the game we have tried to ensure that players gain much more than just another gaming experience. This game is so much more than a simple gaming title, and we are proud of this.

In the game, players are required to answer up to 45 questions in each level. For each question that they answer correctly, a tile is unlocked. Behind these tiles is a hidden image. To the complete the level, players must guess this hidden image.

To get a high score from each level, players must guess the hidden image correctly with the least amount of unlocked tiles. In addition, players are also able to earn special reward points by obtaining the best score for each level. These points can be redeemed in our online store to win physical items.

Intriguingly, the player has five lives in the game for each level. Losing all of these lives will make the player lose the level (as well as their level score). However, this can be prevented by purchasing In-App purchase gems which can then be used to access helpful gameplay features such as obtaining a hint for the hidden image and unlocking a tile without having to answer the current question.

Why?

This game is different. Rather than just offer the standard mobile gaming experience, we have delivered a title that has deep and complex themes. Players will find themselves making decisions that affect their gaming ‘life’ in dramatic ways. These decisions reflect their knowledge, so players gain an insight into the challenges that test their knowledge.

Our goal is simple. We expect one million players to download this mobile app and get involved in the adventure. We expect players to reflect on their own behavior in the real world after playing this game.

Who am I?

My name is Ramnath Suthakar, and I am the Managing Director of Codeexceptional Ltd. I am very passionate about the gaming industry. My ambition is to make my company an exceptional mobile game development and publisher company.

I am also an upcoming short movie and video song artist in the UK. However, I have also gained a good education alongside these performing arts qualifications, progressing to gain a degree. My vision is to create more jobs for aspiring graduates while doing something I love.

Whilst at University I studied Computer Game Programming. I attended Staffordshire University where I gained a BEng (Hons) in Computer Game Programming. In 2010, Staffordshire University awarded me first prize for my final year project.

Why Indiegogo?

We're using Indiegogo because we see it as an incredible opportunity to get gamers involved in the development of the game right from the beginning. This gives us a better understanding of what they want. Gamers get to see behind the scenes, feel an ownership of the game, and be a part of the development process.

Since my teenage years, it has been my ambition and dream to develop my own game. My self, my brother and another 2 individuals who have worked on this game on a daily basis. To develop this game we have done everything on our own, including designing, developing, research, and funding.

At this stage almost 50% of the game development is complete for iPhone, with further work needed on the UI, Themes, Music and Development. In addition, we are required to hire a freelancer to help us develop for other platforms.

We want to add more modes, more levels, more questions, more hidden images, better UI, and possibly multiplayer. In order for us to achieve all these objectives, we need your help and funding, freeing up financial resources that will enable us to hire freelancers for the musical and creative aspects of development.

With funding, we aim to complete and release the iPhone version. By achieving our stretch goal we will then start working on iPad, Android, Windows Phone, Tablet, PC, Mac and Linux.

Why do we need your help?

We have already begun development, but our budget is currently limited. We want this game to be one of the best puzzle games with a better playing experience. In addition to that, our main focus is to achieve 2 goals with this game.

1.) Having an enjoyable playing experience.

2.) Improve the player's general knowledge and/or educating the player.

Creating such a game requires significant levels of funding.

We're making good progress on the game already, but need to complete on the following aspects:

  • 10 music tracks
  • Sound effects
  • Fonts, Additional Graphic and GUI Design
  • Development-software licenses, compatibility-testing services and more.
  • Hiring a freelancer to help speed up the process and to develop for other platforms.

Our stretch goals are listed at the bottom of the page.

Stretch Goals

£5,000 - In addition to the iPhone platform, we will also release the game on iPad.

£7500 - In addition to the iOS platform, we will also release the game for Windows Phone.

£10000 - In addition to the iOS platform and Windows Phone, we will also release the game for Android devices.

£12,500 - In addition to the iOS platform, Android and Windows Phone, we will also release the game for Facebook.

£25,000 - In addition to the iOS platform, Android, Windows Phone and Facebook we will also release the game for PC, Mac and Linux.

£40,000 - We will create multiplayer capability for all platforms.

What is your money going toward?

Producing Music/Sounds: The game theme, winning, losing, the game theme music, other music and sounds need to be produced. we personally do not have experience in producing music and we require financial support to hire freelancers to help me produce this.

Software Licenses: Since we just started the game, we are missing a lot of software that we need to make this game. Funding is required to facilitate appropriate use of effective software.

Server client development/Hosting: Game API, which will be handling the user interface from a server. We own a server, which can handle a limited number of players.

For the future growth of the project, we need to have 2-8 more servers. Based on the heavy load already experienced on our servers, we want to prepare for future large-scale growth.

This is also the first time that we've worked on server client handling events. When we reach a large-scale impact, the current server will not be able to handle the load, so we want to spend the appropriate amounts of time and effort to get it right.

Art : We want to contract a concept artist to help us with creating a story board, the background images, the in-game UI look and feel and more items exclusively designed for the game.

Polishing: Any funding in excess of our goal will be invested into refining the game even further with more resources, increased functionality, more levels, more items, more challenges and much more.

Budget Breakdown

20% Coding: Game mechanics, AI, influence system, etc.
15% Graphical content; the concept art, GUI and texturing.
25% Music and sound design.
15% Backer rewards.
12% Software license.
5% Marketing.
8% Indiegogo fee & Third-party payment fee


Rewards

[ £1 + ] Thank you Via Email & Wallpaper.
Thank you Via Email & Exclusive wallpaper.

[ £2 + ] Your question & Wallpaper.
A question of your choice will be added to the game (Terms and Conditions Apply) & Exclusive wallpaper.

[ £3 + ] Your question, Wallpaper & Thank you postcard.
A question of your choice will be added to the game (Terms and Conditions Apply), Exclusive wallpaper & Thank you postcard via post

[ £5 + ] Torches/Flashlights, Your question & Thank you via Post
Torches/Flashlights, A question of your choice will be added to the game (Terms applied) & Thank you letter via post with signature of a developer(s) and my self.

[ £10 + ] The Soundtrack
Download the high-quality version of the game’s music tracks. 

[ £15 + ] Grocery Tote & Soundtrack
Customized Grocery Tote & Download the high-quality version of the game’s music tracks.

[ £20 + ] Print
A signed, high quality A2 Indiegogo backer exclusive limited-edition print.

[ £25 + ] iPhone Case & Soundtrack
Customized iPhone case & Download the high-quality version of the game’s music tracks.

[ £35 + ] The Soundtrack & T-Shirt
Download the maximum-quality version of the game music tracks.

T-shirt: The T-shirt will be like the print- a limited run Indiegogo backer exclusive. We hope you will wear it proudly.



[£100 +] Game credit
You name will be added to the in-game credits with special thanks.

Download the maximum-quality version of the game music tracks.

Print: A signed, high quality A2 Indiegogo backer exclusive limited-edition print. 

T-shirt: The T-shirt will be like the print- a limited run Indiegogo backer exclusive. We hope you will wear it proudly.

[£250 +] Game Sponsor and Credit
You name will be added to the in-game credits with special thanks.

You name will be added to in-game sponsor list

Download the maximum-quality version of the game music tracks.

Print: A signed, high quality A2 inch Indiegogo backer exclusive limited-edition print. 

T-shirt: The T-shirt will be like the print- a limited run Indiegogo backer exclusive. We hope you will wear it proudly.

Thank you for supporting us and pledging on our project

If you want to help but can't provide funding, you can definitely make a difference by publicizing Indiegogo to your friends and other places on the Internet. Thanks again for your support.

Your sincerely,

Ramnath Suthakar

Where to find us:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/SmartQ45

Twitter: https://twitter.com/SmartQ45

Web: http://www.smartq45.com


Risks and challenges

We’ll only release once it’s the fantastic game we know it can be. And we want to get it into the hands of players in mid September 2013. The game is going to be powerful, unique and rather wonderful, with the added incentive of being educational too.

We've already finished the framework of the game and are confident that it will ship in 2013.

Having shipped some apps in the App Store already, and having worked on several others for other publishers, we know that device compatibility and performance is always a challenge. We are currently targeting all iPhone & iPod devices from 2010 onward (which specifically leaves out iPhone 3GS or earlier), and iOS 5.1 and above. Depending on what Apple does with iOS, we may have to trim our list of supported devices and versions.

Android devices have an even broader range of performance than iOS devices. Our current minimum Android version is 2.3, but even within 2.3, some devices with older graphics chips or lower RAM may not be supportable.

Before releasing the game, it has to be tested and perfected. Balancing and bug-testing the game will also take time.
story_txt:
What is it?
Initially planned to be released for the iPhone, It is a unique and innovative puzzle mobile game coming soon to iPhone, iPad, Android, Windows Phone and Facebook. Unique and compelling, not only does it educates players, but it also helps them have a great time too. Consequences are a big part of the game, and the learning experience that players gain is a major factor.
Within the game we have tried to ensure that players gain much more than just another gaming experience. This game is so much more than a simple gaming title, and we are proud of this.
In the game, players are required to answer up to 45 questions in each level. For each question that they answer correctly, a tile is unlocked. Behind these tiles is a hidden image. To the complete the level, players must guess this hidden image.
To get a high score from each level, players must guess the hidden image correctly with the least amount of unlocked tiles. In addition, players are also able to earn special reward points by obtaining the best score for each level. These points can be redeemed in our online store to win physical items.
Intriguingly, the player has five lives in the game for each level. Losing all of these lives will make the player lose the level (as well as their level score). However, this can be prevented by purchasing In-App purchase gems which can then be used to access helpful gameplay features such as obtaining a hint for the hidden image and unlocking a tile without having to answer the current question.


Why?
This game is different. Rather than just offer the standard mobile gaming experience, we have delivered a title that has deep and complex themes. Players will find themselves making decisions that affect their gaming ‘life’ in dramatic ways. story:
Short Summary

GeekGamer.TV was created on the foundation of creating engaging, fun and interactive content from an authentic perspective for Geeks and Gamers alike.

Minecraft Me is the show from GGTV that covers everything about the awesome game from Mojang called Minecraft.  Once started as a show that showed the "noob" how to play, it has now evolved to a show that covers news, creations, packs and much, much more.

This campaign is geared to send the show about Minecraft to the ultimate convention about Minecraft.....Minecon!

We feel it's important to have an authentic perspective in covering this awesome event and we believe we are NOTHING without community.  That being said, we ask for your support in helping us get our crew to Florida to cover this global event!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have a crew of four people for coverage of events on the road.  We have 1 cameraman, 1 support person and of course the two hosts of the show, Chase and Joe.   In our planning, we have estimated that we will need $5,000.00 to cover travel, food, lodging, equipment costs, etc.

This is to cover the costs of getting to and staying in Florida for the event.  It does not cover the hours of editing, post production, interviewing, planning, etc.   As we stated in the video, we do this as a passion.  We are not making anything from this, other then the awesome gratitude our community gives us! :)

To get you involved in our project, we have some awesome perks we have brainstormed and come up with!  Some of those highlights that we especally love include:

  • An all expenses paid trip for you (if you live in the USA, to hang with us for Minecon!  Includes Airfare, Hotel, Food and you hang with the GGTV crew at Minecon!
  • A special episode of GGTV.  Chase and Joe will play ANY GAME LIVE STREAMED for One Hour!
  • Prime Real Estate near Spawn Manor on our Community Server
  • And many, many more!

If we don't make our goal, the funds will still be used for coverage of the event, either via remote coverage (correspondents), phone calls, or some other method.  All funds generated will be used towards improving content for Minecraft Me and GGTV.

 

The Impact

We feel that we can provide unique coverage of Minecon, Mojang and Minecraft for those who can't make it to the event.

While this is our first major fundraising project, we are well experienced in the creation of awesome media and coverage of big events.  Some of our highlights include:

  • E3 2012
  • PAX Prime 2012
  • Apple and CES Events
  • Unboxings, Game Reviews and Much More!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help....it's okay!  :)  We understand completely!  So there are plenty of free things you could do to help us!

  • Use the indiegogo tools and share it!
  • Twitter, Facebook, Google+, Orkut.....any social media. 
  • Tell your friends, neighbors, creepers....ssssssss
  • Join our server and just build with us!

 

Thank you for supporting our project!  If you have any questions, please don't hesitiate to ask!

- Chase and Joe

story:
What is Terra: Formations ?

In Terra: Formations, players have the freedom to select their preferred style of game play, ranging from intense action First-Person Shooter to more strategic RTS planning in an online multi-player universe.

As a player in Terra: Formations, you join the ranks of an elite military force with the objective of reshaping the environments of inhospitable worlds. You control the evolution of a developing planet (Europa Moon), and take command to become humanities only hope for survival in an epic struggle for control of the solar system. Four classes of characters offer different insight to the chaotic world, each providing a unique blend of interaction and gameplay perspectives.

The key concepts of Terra can be summarized by the conflicting species, player classes, life forms, technology, locations, and gameplay that are designed to make a genre hybrid, player driven world possible.

Terra: Formations main features:

  • Rich, highly detailed, atmospheric and wonderful alien enviroments

  • Changing environments reflecting your terraforming progress, becoming more habitable and supportive of your species requirements. Tug of War gameplay.

  • Permanent changes in environments - terraforming levels will remember your changes.

  • Groundbreaking genre crossing gameplay, combining First Person Shooter with Real-Time Strategy.

  • Highly detailed player characters, with customizable appearances

  • RTS online gameplay where you give real players control commands.

  • Advanced AI Droids for FPS defending & RTS resource play. 

  • 4 distinct classes of characters; Soldier (FPS), Commander (RTS), Builder (FPS+RTS), and Medic (FPS).

  • Hi Tech Weaponry & Several Ground / Air Vehicles

  • Commander Special Attacks such as air-strikes, cloaking, superweapons.

  • Aliens have the ability to turn Humans by infestation into fellow Aliens.

  • Global online points & stats system.

  • Open Mod System allowing map makers to create new worlds.

Who is behind the game?

We are an indie games development studio called Starcave Entertainment, located in the west of Ireland. Our development office is within the Innovation Center of the National University of Ireland Galway. 

Founded by Keith Killilea, I enjoy creating stories & worlds that can capture people's imagination, attention and excitement. Since 1994 I have been creating video games on the Commodore 64 to PC / Consoles. Money is not a driving force for myself but to just see even one person having fun playing one of my creations!

It's about the stories, the user engagement within that fictional universe that is creative, fun & for a brief time you can leave your reality behind.

There is a few (six) of us involved here in the team that have 20+ years of games development experience. The Irish have a reputation of quality story-telling and entertainment - we will take this to a new level with Terra if you can kindly support us. 

See our company website for more information. 

Why Crowdfunding & Indiegogo?

To develop a game like Terra: Formations it requires some really big bucks to get it done and only Publishers can support such projects. This can limit the direction of a game, involve plenty of politics in relations during the development that can reduce the creativity involved to deliver a game that the developers really want to fully make. 

Also the doors of what happens in games development is quite closed off but we are here to open them up to you as we move through the whole development cycle. Let us give you a window into our world here and help us to get Terra: Formations funded. 

With crowdfunding and Indiegogo we have a chance here to bring you our vision of Terra: Formations. We want to keep you involved with us, give you updates as we make the game and value your support all the way.

Even if you can't contribute funding but like what we are doing, please share this page with all your friends and even that will help us out in a great way!

Has Terra: Formations been out before?

The game was announced back in 2006 for all major platforms from PC to Consoles and the screenshots you see in the Gallery tab at the top of this page is the playable demo from back then! We spared no expense to create "AAA" class graphics, code, game-play and pulled all-nighters with barely no lives at all. 

To develop the whole game we needed a publisher and in the end Terra needed to be put on hold - until now! Terra brings together the best gaming genres in one unique way.

Now is the time to relaunch this fantastic genre-reaching project, and we need your support to make it onto your gaming platforms!

So how will all this work? 

You can pick one of rewards and tell your friends to join in too. We have spent over $100,000 in the past on Terra: Formations and alot of our art-assets are still in good shape as we begin to convert them with the latest feature sets to our new "AAA" industry leading games engine. 

To make sure the game gets completed and on time, we need to all think realistic here and we have set out the lowest budget we can to make the first tier incarnation of Terra. The game will have full FPS & RTS elements with full on online multi-player game-play. With your support and we can exceed the funding goal, we will be able to add more levels, gameplay features, full single-player, and most of all.. the big one, the MMO side!! 

Even creating a small Xbox downloadable game can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars, a "AAA" game is in the millions and this is due to the amount of people involved with time to build, build and build. We are a small team but we have designed Terra to be a scalable game, and will be created and released in several stages, allowing us to get the game out there with whatever budget we secure. We can expand and step up production as funding permits. I am very proud of our small experienced team who know what they doing and work very, very hard. We are passionate about this game, and are determined to see it out there, giving all our players endless entertainment with our fantastic universe and revolutionary gameplay.

Some of us are working on other jobs but with your help on reaching the target - we can 100% focus on Terra: Formations all the way to end. 

When will Terra: Formations be completed?

Based on our funding target, we would expect to nail the deadline for Beta Release in late 2013. We know exactly what we are doing, and as Terra has been many years in the making, we are confident in our deadlines! We will keep you in the loop with our development at all times, and give you a look into the process and progress we are making.

Just how ground breaking will Terra: Formations be?

Terra is going to invent a new style of game-play by blending the genres of FPS & RTS, With your help, we can exceed the funding target and and include the second tier of development, which is to incorporate the MMO side with RPG Adventure elements!! Even if we just hit the target, you can be sure Terra is going to be something special in gameplay, with unique alien environments and back story. 

We have been wanting to fully create Terra for over six years, it is you as gamers who have kept the name alive, the interest out there for it and we hear you. 

Example of how amazing Terra will be, your playing on the multi-player level and the world around not just changes due to the terra-forming but stays changed even when you return later to it! We want to bring you an experience of game-play not done before and a dynamic living world you would expect to be on.

Join us on a our wild ride to create this blockbuster game!

If you’ve always wanted to watch, experience and influence the game design process from start to finish, then this is your chance. We are holding nothing back with the title and having your input will help us make sure we cover every aspect in fine detail. 

We are incredibly excited to work on Terra that will bring something new, fresh and innovative to gamers. Our storyline will simply keep you on the edge of your seat, our environments will leave you in wonder and awe, and the game-play is going to give wow you like the first time you played any new genre style. 

This is an opportunity to help bring one special game to it's completion and be part of our extended team to making it happen!

Want more? Here is a taste of the story.

By the year 2157, mankind had depleted the resources of planet earth with his lust for power, technological advancements and greed. Ironically, the very machines that played a role in mankind's irrevocable position were the only chance of survival!

After several years of uncertainty, hope was reborn with the efforts of the Global Military Alliance to Terraform one of earth's celestial neighbors, Jupiter's moon called 'Europa'. It wasn't until the excavation of the satellite's icy crust that mankind learned the truth; he was not alone and something, somewhere, was waiting, watching, learning and preparing for battle!

We are also looking to get this game onto Steam, why not view our Greenlight page over at it and vote for us as well ! 

Terra: Formations on Steam
story_txt:
What is Terra: Formations ?
In Terra: Formations, players have the freedom to select their preferred style of game play, ranging from intense action First-Person Shooter to more strategic RTS planning in an online multi-player universe.
As a player in Terra: Formations, you join the ranks of an elite military force with the objective of reshaping the environments of inhospitable worlds. You control the evolution of a developing planet (Europa Moon), and take command to become humanities only hope for survival in an epic struggle for control of the solar system. Four classes of characters offer different insight to the chaotic world, each providing a unique blend of interaction and gameplay perspectives.
The key concepts of Terra can be summarized by the conflicting species, player classes, life forms, technology, locations, and gameplay that are designed to make a genre hybrid, player driven world possible.

Terra: Formations main features:

Rich, highly detailed, atmospheric and wonderful alien enviroments

Changing environments reflecting your terraforming progress, becoming more habitable and supportive of your species requirements. Tug of War gameplay.

Permanent changes in environments - terraforming levels will remember your changes.

Groundbreaking genre crossing gameplay, combining First Person Shooter with Real-Time Strategy.

Highly detailed player characters, with customizable appearances

RTS online gameplay where you give real players control commands.

Advanced AI Droids for FPS defending & RTS resource play. 

4 distinct classes of characters; Soldier (FPS), Commander (RTS), Builder (FPS+RTS), and Medic (FPS).

Hi Tech Weaponry & Several Ground / Air Vehicles

Commander Special Attacks such as air-strikes, cloaking, superweapons.

Aliens have the ability to turn Humans by infestation into fellow Aliens.

Global online points & stats system.

Open Mod System allowing map makers to create new worlds.
Who is behind the game?
We are an indie games development studio called Starcave Entertainment, located in the west of Ireland. Our development office is within the Innovation Center of the National University of Ireland Galway. 
Founded by Keith Killilea, I enjoy creating stories & worlds that can capture people's imagination, attention and excitement. Since 1994 I have been creating video games on the Commodore 64 to PC / Consoles. Money is not a driving force for myself but to just see even one person having fun playing one of my creations!
It's about the stories, the user engagement within that fictional universe that is creative, fun & for a brief time you can leave your reality behind.
There is a few (six) of us involved here in the team that have 20+ years of games development experience. The Irish have a reputation of quality story-telling and entertainment - we will take this to a new level with Terra if you can kindly support us. 
See our company website for more information. 
Why Crowdfunding & Indiegogo?

To develop a game like Terra: Formations it requires some really big bucks to get it done and only Publishers can support such projects. This can limit the direction of a game, involve plenty of politics in relations during the development that can reduce the creativity involved to deliver a game that the developers really want to fully make. 
Also the doors of what happens in games development is quite closed off but we are here to open them up to you as we move through the whole development cycle. Let us give you a window into our world here and help us to get Terra: Formations funded. 
With crowdfunding and Indiegogo we have a chance here to bring you our vision of Terra: Formations. We want to keep you involved with us, give you updates as we make the game and value your support all the way.
Even if you can't contribute funding but like what we are doing, please share this page with all your friends and even that will help us out in a great way!
Has Terra: Formations been out before?

The game was announced back in 2006 for all major platforms from PC to Consoles and the screenshots you see in the Gallery tab at the top of this page is the playable demo from back then! We spared no expense to create "AAA" class graphics, code, game-play and pulled all-nighters with barely no lives at all. 
To develop the whole game we needed a publisher and in the end Terra needed to be put on hold - until now! Terra brings together the best gaming genres in one unique way.
Now is the time to relaunch this fantastic genre-reaching project, and we need your support to make it onto your gaming platforms!
So how will all this work? 

You can pick one of rewards and tell your friends to join in too. We have spent over $100,000 in the past on Terra: Formations and alot of our art-assets are still in good shape as we begin to convert them with the latest feature sets to our new "AAA" industry leading games engine. 
To make sure the game gets completed and on time, we need to all think realistic here and we have set out the lowest budget we can to make the first tier incarnation of Terra. The game will have full FPS & RTS elements with full on online multi-player game-play. With your support and we can exceed the funding goal, we will be able to add more levels, gameplay features, full single-player, and most of all.. the big one, the MMO side!! 
Even creating a small Xbox downloadable game can cost hundreds of thousands of dollars, a "AAA" game is in the millions and this is due to the amount of people involved with time to build, build and build. We are a small team but we have designed Terra to be a scalable game, and will be created and released in several stages, allowing us to get the game out there with whatever budget we secure. We can expand and step up production as funding permits. I am very proud of our small experienced team who know what they doing and work very, very hard. We are passionate about this game, and are determined to see it out there, giving all our players endless entertainment with our fantastic universe and revolutionary gameplay.
Some of us are working on other jobs but with your help on reaching the target - we can 100% focus on Terra: Formations all the way to end. 
When will Terra: Formations be completed?
Based on our funding target, we would expect to nail the deadline for Beta Release in late 2013. We know exactly what we are doing, and as Terra has been many years in the making, we are confident in our deadlines! We will keep you in the loop with our development at all times, and give you a look into the process and progress we are making.
Just how ground breaking will Terra: Formations be?

Terra is going to invent a new style of game-play by blending the genres of FPS & RTS, With your help, we can exceed the funding target and and include the second tier of development, which is to incorporate the MMO side with RPG Adventure elements!! Even if we just hit the target, you can be sure Terra is going to be something special in gameplay, with unique alien environments and back story. 
We have been wanting to fully create Terra for over six years, it is you as gamers who have kept the name alive, the interest out there for it and we hear you. 
Example of how amazing Terra will be, your playing on the multi-player level and the world around not just changes due to the terra-forming but stays changed even when you return later to it! We want to bring you an experience of game-play not done before and a dynamic living world you would expect to be on.
Join us on a our wild ride to create this blockbuster game!

If you’ve always wanted to watch, experience and influence the game design process from start to finish, then this is your chance. We are holding nothing back with the title and having your input will help us make sure we cover every aspect in fine detail. 
We are incredibly excited to work on Terra that will bring something new, fresh and innovative to gamers. Our storyline will simply keep you on the edge of your seat, our environments will leave you in wonder and awe, and the game-play is going to give wow you like the first time you played any new genre style. 
This is an opportunity to help bring one special game to it's completion and be part of our extended team to making it happen!
Want more? Here is a taste of the story.
By the year 2157, mankind had depleted the resources of planet earth with his lust for power, technological advancements and greed. Ironically, the very machines that played a role in mankind's irrevocable position were the only chance of survival! 
After several years of uncertainty, hope was reborn with the efforts of the Global Military Alliance to Terraform one of earth's celestial neighbors, Jupiter's moon called 'Europa'. It wasn't until the excavation of the satellite's icy crust that mankind learned the truth; he was not alone and something, somewhere, was waiting, watching, learning and preparing for battle!

Terra: Formations on Steam

story:
DOWNLOAD THE DEMO 

(not compatible with Windows 10 yet)


(Descrizione in Italiano a fondo pagina)


                                     







Fearful Symmetry is a dynamic 2D pixelated puzzle game in which the player controls two characters at the same time.


It’s a tough game, with puzzles somewhat reminiscent of old Zelda games. It’s conceived to challenge a variety of abilities including reflection and abstraction skills, coordination, memory, timing, and others.

The game will include:

  • 20 levels set in 3 different environments
  • 12 unique and fully animated traps
  • Emergent gameplay allowing creative problem-solving
  • Roughly 8 hours of gameplay (depending on player’s skills)
  • Progress auto-saving feature


I’m a Game Design student, and I’ve always been keen on developing videogames.

Someone may remember me for being game designer of Team Summit, student team semi-finalist at Make Something Unreal Live contest 2013 with the game Beings (http://www.bit-tech.net/gaming/pc/2013/04/05/make-something-unreal-live-2013-contestants/1).


Fearful Symmetry is the first completed game I’m supposed to publish. It started as one of the many prototypes I usually develop for my own sake, but at some point I saw the potential behind it, and I decided that I should complete it, and share it with the world.

The game is not particularly big, but despite that I'm struggling to find the time to develop and polish the remaining assets. This leads to the next point...


As I said, I’m a student, and Fearful Symmetry is a project that I started on my own, in my spare time.

I don't have the possibility to continue working full-time on developing the game, so my plan is to share the remaining workload with a talented friend of mine, Simone Onorato. Most of the budget will be used to hire him, so that he can stop looking for part-time jobs for a while, and focus on the game.

I’m also planning to release the game on Steam, so part of the budget will be used to pay the 100 $ Greenlight fee.


1300 $ is the bare minimum we need to complete the game as I imagined it. However, the scope of the game is not 100% defined, and with more funds we would be able to develop some more bonus levels to include in the regular version of the game.

To be more specific:

-If the campaign reaches 1500 $ we would add 2 more bonus levels

-If the campaign reaches 1700 $ we would add 1 more (aside from the previous 2 bonus levels)



There are also a number of interesting perks available for you:

  • Fearful Friend - 1 $

           -Our gratitude : )


  • Early Bird (limited) - 3 $

            -DRM-FREE DIGITAL COPY OF THE GAME (when available)

            -Credited as a backer in-game

 

  • Fearful Believer - 8 $

           -Our gratitude :)

           -Credited as a backer in game

           -DRM-free digital copy of the game (when available)


  • Symmetry Master - 15 $

           -Our gratitude :)

           -Credited as a backer in game

           -DRM-free digital copy of the game (when ready)

           -Special Indiegogo version of the game featuring an exclusive bonus level


  • The one who gives the names (limited) - 20 $

           All the above +

           -You can choose the name of one level (no swear words or profanities accepted, sorry)

           -You will be credited with special thanks in-game


  • Level Designer of Symmetry (limited) - 160 $

           All the above (excluding the "names perk") +

           -You can create a bonus level that will be featured in the game using the already existing assets

           -You will be credited as the Level Designer of that level in-game




Visit STEAM page











Descrizione in italiano qui sotto



   

Il gioco

Fearful Symmetry è un gioco in 2D con grafica in pixel basato su enigmi e trabocchetti, in cui il giocatore comanda due personaggi contemporaneamente.


Il gioco è concepito per essere molto difficile e proporre sfide sempre nuove, aggiungendo anche un pizzico di nostalgia e allusioni a giochi classici come i vecchi Zelda. Il gioco mette alla prova la capacità di astrazione, di riflessione logica, di coordinazione, la memoria, i riflessi e anche altro. 

Il gioco includerà:

  • 20 livelli ambientati in 3 scenari differenti
  • 12 trappole dalle caratteristiche uniche, dettagliatamente animate
  • Gameplay emergente, e occasioni per esprimere la propria creatività nel problem-solving
  • Longevità di circa 8 ore (dipendente dalle abilità del giocatore)
  • Salvataggio automatico

Lo sviluppatore e il progetto

Sono uno studente di videogame design, e ho sempre avuto la passione del creare giochi.

Qualcuno potrebbe ricordarmi per il progetto a cui ho preso parte in occasione del concorso Make Something Unreal Live 2013, a cui ho partecipato come designer della squadra Team Summit, con il gioco Beings (http://www.bit-tech.net/gaming/pc/2013/04/05/make-something-unreal-live-2013-contestants/1).      


Fearful Symmetry è il primo gioco che ho in progetto di pubblicare. Il progetto ha avuto inizio come tanti altri prototipi che mi capita di creare, ma ho visto del potenziale in questo, e ho deciso di provvedere per completarlo e condividerlo col mondo.

Il gioco non è particolarmente grande, ma, nonostante ciò, trovare il tempo necessario per completarlo non è facile. Questo ci porta al prossimo punto...


Quello che ci serve e quello che avrai in cambio

Come ho detto prima, sono uno studente, e Fearful Symmetry e un progetto che ho cominciato da solo, nel mio tempo libero.

Non ho la possibilità di continuare a lavorare a tempo pieno al gioco, quindi ho deciso di ingaggiare un mio talentuoso amico, Simone Onorato, per aiutarmi col lavoro rimanente. La maggior parte del budget richiesto sarà destinato a lui, per evitare che per un po' sia impegnato coi lavori part-time, così potrà anche lui concentrarsi sullo sviluppo del gioco.

Progetto anche di rilasciare il gioco su Steam, quindi parte del budget sarà usato per la tassa di 100 $ del Greenlight di Steam.

1300 $ è il minimo di cui abbiamo bisogno per completare il gioco così come lo avevo immaginato. Tuttavia, se ricevessimo ancora più contributi potremmo sviluppare qualche altro livello che abbiamo dovuto eliminare dal progetto per problemi di tempo.

Per essere più precisi:

-Se la campagna di raccolta fondi raggiunge i 1500 $ svilupperemo 2 livelli bonus 

-Se la campagna di raccolta fondi raggiunge i 1700 $ ne svilupperemo un ulteriore altro (a parte i precedenti 2)

Contribuendo sarà anche possibile aggiudicarsi una o più delle seguenti ricompense:

  • Fearful Friend - 1 $

           -La nostra gratitudine : )

  • Early Bird (limitato) - 3 $

            -COPIA DIGITALE (DRM-FREE) DEL GIOCO (quando sarà disponibile)

            -Il tuo nome apparirà nella pagine dei crediti del gioco tra i contribuenti

 

  • Fearful Believer - 8 $

           -La nostra gratitudine : )

           -Il tuo nome apparirà nella pagine dei crediti del gioco tra i contribuenti

           -Copia digitale (drm-free) del gioco (quando sarà disponibile)

  • Symmetry Master - 15 $

           -La nostra gratitudine : )

           -Il tuo nome apparirà nella pagine dei crediti del gioco tra i contribuenti

           -Copia digitale (drm-free) del gioco (quando sarà disponibile)

           -Versione speciale del gioco di Indiegogo contenente un livello bonus

  • The one who gives the names (limitato) - 20 $

           Tutto quanto riportato sopra +

           -Puoi scegliere il nome di uno dei livelli 

           -Il tuo nome sarà menzionato nei "ringraziamenti speciali" nel gioco


  • Level Designer of Symmetry (limitato) - 160 $

           Tutto quanto riportato sopra (esclusa la ricompensa dei "nomi") +

           -Puoi progettare un livello bonus che apparirà nel gioco usando gli elementi già esistenti negli altri livelli

           -Sarai citato come "Level Designer" di quel livello nella pagina dei crediti



Visita la pagina di STEAM

story:
ABOUT US


We’re TaKeTV – a production company for online content in the market of eSports / gaming. TaKeTV has been established in 2010 by former WarCraft III pro gamer and ESL / GIGA host Dennis „TaKe“ Gehlen and what once started as a one-man company in a 55 sqm flat has quickly become one of the most prestigious broadcasters for international tournaments in StarCraft II, CS:GO, Heroes of the Storm and Hearthstone as well as daily coverage of all important tournaments.


With more than 10 million unique viewers per annum and 83 million total clicks on the live channel TaKeTV is a constantly growing brand that will move into a brand new 2,000 smq location in 2015 to provide the community with even more events and content in the future.


We‘re internationally well-known for hosting our very own tournaments and leagues such as Acer TeamStory Cup or SeatStory Cup.


The most famous TaKeTV tournament, however, is HomeStory Cup that today belongs to the most popular StarCraft II tournaments around the globe; it takes place twice a year.

In 2014, HomeStory Cup celebrated its 10th edition with almost 1.5 million unique live views and 4,000 viewers on location.

Now we’re planning another edition of HSC – and we need YOUR help to make it happen!


Visit us on www.TaKeTV.net for more information about us as well as on www.PimpTheHouse.net to learn more about our new location where even more events will take place in the future.



HOMESTORY CUP XI – WHY WE’RE HERE


Many of you have been asking about our plans for the upcoming HomeStory Cup XI lately and you’re right – it’s definitely time for another HSC soon!


However, the truth is that every tournament – especially HSC – costs a lot of money to provide you with a great show and awesome players and it is obvious that we cannot bring up this huge amount of money without enough sponsors.


In the past we always gave our best to put all our cards on the table and that’s exactly what we’re doing now. We have been planning HSC XI for some time now but besides the huge prize pool of 25,000$ there a lot of other costs that have to be taken into account: $2,500 will be needed to cover beverages and food, for $2,000 we will have a huge party on Saturday as always (open for everyone), staff (incl. casters) will cost $15,000, $3,000 will be needed for the trophy, fuel etc. and flights as well as the accommodation for players will cost around $7,500 - it all adds up to at least $55,000!


In the past we always managed to cover this huge amount of money with the great help of our sponsors but this time the total budget provided by our sponsors MIFcom, NEEDforSEAT®, Kinguin and EIZO will be covering 42,500 $ - which is great, but still 12,500 $ are missing to make HomeStory Cup XI come to life.


It wasn’t an easy decision for us but instead of cancelling HSC XI and thanks to your encouragement we’re now asking you to help us make HSC XI happen from July 2 – 5 2015.


Every little amount can help to get one step closer to HSC XI – become a part of our biggest StarCraft II event!



YOUR ADVANTAGES


Besides the obvious advantage that HomeStory Cup XI will take place if we manage to collect (almost) enough money to cover the costs there will of course be another public screening of the event in the pub below the studio in Krefeld, Germany, once again where you can meet your favourite SC2 players live & in colour.

Also you’re supporting eSports and StarCraft II so let’s prove all the sceptics wrong and show them how big the StarCraft II community is and that it isn’t a dead game at all – it’s quite vivid instead!

Also we’d like to reward you with the following perks on the right depending on the donation amount and the stretch goals that you can see below.

The amount you want to donate totally depends on you – everything is possible, nothing is compulsory. However, every donation – no matter how small it seems – helps us to make our most favourite event come to life once again!


MILESTONES

12,500$ - Mission accomplished!

This is our main goal to make HSC XI happen in the first place - let's go!

15,000$ - Scarlett will be back!

It might have become a bit quiet on her lately but we will change this! If we reach 15,000$ we will invite Sasha "Scarlett" Hostyn as one of our hosts for HSC XI!

17,500$ - B-Stream by BasetradeTV

If we manage to reach the milestone of 17,500$, we will invite the guys from BasetradeTV and they'll provide the English B-stream for HSC XI on location!

20,000$ - Poker Action

We will set up a poker stream during the event to show you what's happening 'back stage'!

22,500$ - Behind the scenes

Ever wondered what it looks like when the crew is preparing a huge event like HSC? We will set up a stream behind the scenes that shows you the madness that's going on from Monday till Wednesday before HSC.

25,000$ - Broodwar / Legacy Tournament

For 25,000$ we will host a four-man tournament where competitors have to switch between Broodwar and Legacy of the Void after each map.

100,000$ - Let's go to Mallorca!

If you are crazy, so are we. We don't really plan on reaching this goal but if we do we will invite eight players to Mallorca, Spain, and hold a tournament there in addition to HSC XI - just because we can.


SPREAD THE WORD


Not everyone is able to donate a big amount of money – but that’s totally fine! However, it would be much appreciated if you told your friends about this project – it only needs a minute of your time!



Thanks for supporting HSC XI and TaKeTV!
story_txt:
ABOUT USWe’re TaKeTV – a production company for online content in the market of eSports / gaming. TaKeTV has been established in 2010 by former WarCraft III pro gamer and ESL / GIGA host Dennis „TaKe“ Gehlen and what once started as a one-man company in a 55 sqm flat has quickly become one of the most prestigious broadcasters for international tournaments in StarCraft II, CS:GO, Heroes of the Storm and Hearthstone as well as daily coverage of all important tournaments. With more than 10 million unique viewers per annum and 83 million total clicks on the live channel TaKeTV is a constantly growing brand that will move into a brand new 2,000 smq location in 2015 to provide the community with even more events and content in the future.We‘re internationally well-known for hosting our very own tournaments and leagues such as Acer TeamStory Cup or SeatStory Cup.The most famous TaKeTV tournament, however, is HomeStory Cup that today belongs to the most popular StarCraft II tournaments around the globe; it takes place twice a year. In 2014, HomeStory Cup celebrated its 10th edition with almost 1.5 million unique live views and 4,000 viewers on location. Now we’re planning another edition of HSC – and we need YOUR help to make it happen!Visit us on www.TaKeTV.net for more information about us as well as on www.PimpTheHouse.net to learn more about our new location where even more events will take place in the future.HOMESTORY CUP XI – WHY WE’RE HEREMany of you have been asking about our plans for the upcoming HomeStory Cup XI lately and you’re right – it’s definitely time for another HSC soon!However, the truth is that every tournament – especially HSC – costs a lot of money to provide you with a great show and awesome players and it is obvious that we cannot bring up this huge amount of money without enough sponsors.In the past we always gave our best to put all our cards on the table and that’s exactly what we’re doing now. story:
Short Summary

My name is Hugh Holmes Jr I'm a young, black entrepreneur and CEO of a new indie game studio called Game Shift. I'm a 2017 graduate of Becker College with a BA in game design. I have big dreams of becoming the next successful AAA game studio. I want to make impactful and legendary games like "The Last of Us," "Sly Cooper," "Batman Arkham City," and "Horizon Zero Dawn." Game Shift is the name of my studio and we have been working very hard working on our first game. Game shift has been working very hard since May working on our demo in hopes that we may be able to participate in next years conventions such as PAX East and GDC.  Please lend us your support so that we may accomplish our dreams and bring new and exciting games to the industry.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are asking for $3000 for expenses(food for late nights, traveling expenses), game assets(models, software, environments), and vendor fees(PAX East 2021, GDC 2021) 
  • If we are unable to reach our goals the funds will still go towards all of the same intentions.
  • If you donate $20 you will receive a "Game Shift" wristband as a token of appreciation. We also have Game Shift Trucker Hats, blue and white and all black. Donate $30 to receive one, hats will be shipped out in September. 

The Impact

  • As a black owned business Game Shift will help bring diversity to the industry as only 3% of game developers are black. Financial support is the most powerful way to support creators of a small margin.
  • The game we're creating is filling a void that has been missing from the game industry for a long time.
  • To see our progress and stay updated on how the game is coming you can follow our instagram @wearegameshift.

Risks & Challenges

  • There is a risk that our game may not get selected to participate as vendors in the aforementioned conventions. We are working everyday to keep that from happening.
  • I know for a fact that our team has the drive, passion, determination, and hustle to make sure our demo is beyond good enough to be a part of next years conventions.
  • If we are not selected to participate in PAX or GDC we will use the funding to participate at other conventions or conferences; MAG fest is one example.   

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to donate please share this campaign and get the word out.
  • You can follow the brand on instagram @wearegameshift and subscribe to our YouTube channel https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMKobGlIZS57Ss...
