story:
"Working at Castle Nystul has been a rewarding experience. There's been 30% fewer beatings here. And the water cooler actually has water in it."
Ross Isaacs - Project Manager
 
A Pathfinder adventure by way of Mad Libs?
Indie games you may not be able to get anywhere else?
Personal posessions of an old (school) designer?
Lucky dice?
 
We have it all and more just for helping some nice guys keep thier newborn game company afloat and help them raise enough to pay some bills and maybe go to a convention or three!

Howdy y'all!

My name is Mike Nystul. I have been a professional game designer since I was in high school. That was a long time ago. Since then I have worked as a freelancer for something like thirty years. I worked in house as a developer for Mayfair Games, TSR and FASA. I spent some time away from the industry but came back last year, inspired by my kids to get back into gaming and back into the biz. Things have changed. The biggest change is that the market is even harder to break into but the good news was that there is a thriving audience for independents that use crowd sourcing to reach a wider audience eager for ingteresting work. 

What happened?

Here's the thing - I like to think I'm good at what I do, but what I'm not as good at as I would like to be is business. I stand by all of my design decisions but not all of my business decisions have been good ones. For example, rather than allow my new enterprise to grow slowly while I maintained a day job, I went "all in", set up a product line like I would have at FASA and hired top notch people like Jeff Laubenstein and Ross Issacs to help me realize my dreams. I also set up a convention without the cash in hand to pull it off. The up side is I now have a thriving studio with several lines about to launch and several more products in development. On that level, I accomplished what I set out to do. Unfortunately my appriach means I'm overextended and struggling to get everything out. We have a plan but we need the time and resources to implement it. 

What we have accomplished

This adventure began with one man (me) deciding to get back into writing and designing. All cool. Simple. As things progressed, I discovered there was a market and an audience so I set about building a company. We now have things we needed from day 1 like productions schedules and workflows. We are in a position to kick ass and take names. So far we have - 

Nystul's Infinite Dungeon: A Megadungeon that will be released one volume at a time with. I'm doing print buying for Volume 1: The Blighted Isle.  

Cairn: Fuzzy Fantasy with art by Jeff Laubenstein. Adventures with Lemur Archers and Badger Warriors that explore a world beset with discord and corruption. In layout and final art. This is a fun game and will be a beautoful book. Check out some art and updates HERE

Axes and Anvils: Dwarven Roleplaying. All dwarves all the time. Play as members of a Clan whose adventures not only provide fortune and glory but can offer prosperity and influence to the Clan itself. The only game I know of that requires a Dwarven toast to qualify a critical hit! Check out our progress HERE

We have several projects in the works for each product line and something like 4 board and card games in development as well as a few new rpg properties. 

What do we need?

Essentially, a war chest. I ran three successful Kickstarters but as many pundits have pointed out, success carries it's own burdens. I brought on more overhead than I should have, it took longer to deliver than it should have and there have been and continue to be endless hidden costs that gnaw away at us. I have read that something like 40% of all funded RPG projects never deliver and most of those never even offer refunds. Because of this climate and how long it has taken us to deliver on our initial offerings we are facing fears of vaporware. I will not allow anything like that to happen.

How can you help?

Donate to the Build the Castle fund. We will use anything collected to pay bills and get things done. You will be helping us keep the balls in the air and the wolves at the door long enough to get everything to market and the cash flow flowing. Everyone I am working with is very excited about the work we are doing and we want to keep doing what we do together. 

Spread the word. Not everone is in a position to help financially. No problem. Help us to find those who willing and able. With the new Facebook regulations being what they are this is now harder than ever and requires some grass roots help to get the word out.

If you are a designer or artist - volunteer to contribute to the Corwdsourced Adventure. This will be a wild ride. The less it costs us, the better and the better it is - the better for everyone!

What's in it for you?

I have set up some premiums to say "thank you" to anyone who helps out. Amoung these are copies of our first three games, all of which are poised to launch on RPG Now and as physical copies to the backers of the original projects. I have added some fun stuff because this is gaming dammit and it should be fun first and foremost!  

The Crowdsourced Adventure

A key part of this fund (fun?) raiser is an off the wall Pathfinder adventure that will be designed around a crowdsourced introduction. We will try to add designers and artists as we go. The result should be a bizarre 8 page one shot that everyone will get in PDF form. If response is good we may have to go higher : ) 

More than [AMOUNT OF TIME] ago the [NAME OF GROUP] arrived on the shores of [NAME OF COUNTRY]. They arived in search of [GOAL] but met with [INITIAL CONFLICT]. Thier leader, [NAME OF LEADER] sent the [HEROIC TRAIT] hero [HERO NAME] on a quest for [QUEST GOAL]. During his quest he obtained the [MAGIC ITEM] which he used to free his people of the threat but he ws laid low and the wonderous item was lost. It has fallen to you and your party to brave the [DANGEROUS TERRAIN], defeat the [MONSTER], survive the [CURSE] and retrive the item to defend the realm from a reborn foe with an insatiable lust for vengeance!

Designers: Mike Nystul, Ross Isaacs

Artists: Jeff Laubenstein

story:
Bonjour à tous,

Je m'appelle Alain Truffier (Alias Angelstar) et je suis le créateur de plusieurs jeux en ligne dont 650km.com et Druidik.com.

Ce projet de financement INDIEGOGO permet de maintenir 650km.com en tant que jeu gratuit en ligne sans abonnement et sans blocage de niveau.

Cette page INDIEGOGO vous permet de faire vos contributions en toute sécurité et de recevoir vos KM-POINTS sous 48 heures après le crédit des achats sur le compte de 650KM

Je vous invite à mettre à jour vos informations personnelles dans 650km.Com afin que je puisse faire la liaison entre le contributeur INDIEGOGO et le joueur de 650km!

Grâce à ces fonds il me sera possible de maintenir le jeu en ligne et de m'assurer que les serveurs soient toujours opérationnels.

Il est désormais possible d'utiliser vos cartes de crédits ainsi que vos comptes Paypal pour obtenir des KM-POINTS!

Alain Truffier / Angelstar

story:
Short Summary

I plan to start to explore the mobile gaming industry by developing game app for iPhone and Android. After self studying online for almost a year, still can't build my first game app. I found that it is difficult for someone with totally ZERO programming background to build a game app. I have struggle for few months to search for a solution for it.

Finally, I found out that a game development academy, Game Academy have launch a drag and drop game builder for those without programming to start create game app for different platform. After going through all the information and walkthrough in their website (www.gameacademy.com/buildbox), I'm 100% sure I want to get this software to help me in mobile gaming development industry.

This software cost USD2,675 to buy it.

What I Need & What You Get

I need your help to get the funds to buy the game builder software. As you will see on this campaign, I have create certain unique perks for different amounts that you can donate. If you so choose, you can claim a appreciation bonus along with your donation.

With your contribution, I'm sure that I can start to developing game app in a shorter of time. If I successfully funded this campaign, I will donate portion of my game development income every half-yearly to World Vision Charity Organisation (http://www.wvi.org).

For those contribute higher amount, I will build game app for you free. All the  income generated from advertisement monetization inside the app will go back to your Paypal account monthly. So, you can start to earn passive income from it.

If you contribution to my campaign, you are actually doing some charity for community in the long run. I will email you all the donation proof receipt each time money is donated.

*Game Development Income - refer to earning from providing game development service for others and advertisement monetization income inside app.

*Advertisement Monetization Income - refer to earning from advertisement monetization channel such as Admob, Chartboost, Revmob, iAds and more.


My Goals

Here's what I'm promise to do on each level of contribution achieve:

$2,675 (cost to buy the game builder software)
When reach $2,675 in funding, I will donate 10% of my game development income every half-yearly to World Vision Charity Organisation for the period of 1 year.

$5,000 (cost to get macbook for AppStore publishing and some graphic resources pack for game development)
When reach $5,000 in funding, I will donate 15% of my game development income every half-yearly to World Vision Charity Organisation for the period of 2 year.

$15,000 (employ one staff to develop game)
When reach $15,000 in funding, I will donate 20% of my game development income every half-yearly to World Vision Charity Organisation for the period of 3 year.

$30,000 (start my game development business)
When reach $30,000 in funding, i will start my own game developing in bigger scale, employ more staff to build more game app in shorter time. For this, I will donate 30% of my game development income every half-yearly to World Vision Charity Organisation for the period of 5 year.


Risks & Challenges

If funding is successful, I need 1 to 2 months to familiar with this software. Most probably I can start publish game app to store after the first month. Monetization income will probably come in 3rd  or 4th month.

For those contribute higher amount and get a free game app, please do allow me to delivery within 3 to 6 months time after the campaign is successfully funded.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. You can help me by:

    • Tell your friends or family member about this campaign.
    • Share this campaign in your social media wall.

    Thanks for you times reading my campaign page. Thank you in advance for your contribution.
story_txt:
Short SummaryI plan to start to explore the mobile gaming industry by developing game app for iPhone and Android. After self studying online for almost a year, still can't build my first game app. I found that it is difficult for someone with totally ZERO programming background to build a game app. I have struggle for few months to search for a solution for it.
Finally, I found out that a game development academy, Game Academy have launch a drag and drop game builder for those without programming to start create game app for different platform. After going through all the information and walkthrough in their website (www.gameacademy.com/buildbox), I'm 100% sure I want to get this software to help me in mobile gaming development industry.

This software cost USD2,675 to buy it. 
  What I Need & What You Get I need your help to get the funds to buy the game builder software. As you will see
 on this campaign, I have create certain unique perks for different amounts that you
 can donate. If you so choose, you can claim a appreciation bonus along with your 
donation.
With your contribution, I'm sure that I can start to developing game app in a shorter of time. If I successfully funded this campaign, I will donate portion of my game development income every half-yearly to World Vision Charity Organisation (http://www.wvi.org).
For those contribute higher amount, I will build game app for you free. All the  income generated from advertisement monetization inside the app will go back to your Paypal account monthly. So, you can start to earn passive income from it.
If you contribution to my campaign, you are actually doing some charity for community in the long run. I will email you all the donation proof receipt each time money is donated.

*Game Development Income - refer to earning from providing game development service for others and advertisement monetization income inside app.

*Advertisement Monetization Income - refer to earning from advertisement monetization channel such as Admob, Chartboost, Revmob, iAds and more.


My Goals

Here's what I'm promise to do on each level of contribution achieve:
$2,675 (cost to buy the game builder software)When reach $2,675 in funding, I will donate 10% of my game development income every half-yearly to World Vision Charity Organisation for the period of 1 year.
$5,000 (cost to get macbook for AppStore publishing and some graphic resources pack for game development)When reach $5,000 in funding, I will donate 15% of my game development income every half-yearly to World Vision Charity Organisation for the period of 2 year.
$15,000 (employ one staff to develop game)When
 reach $15,000 in funding, I will donate 20% of my game development 
income every half-yearly to World Vision Charity Organisation for the 
period of 3 year.

$30,000 (start my game development business)When
 reach $30,000 in funding, i will start my own game developing in bigger scale, employ more staff to build more game app in shorter time. For this, I will donate 30% of my game development 
income every half-yearly to World Vision Charity Organisation for the 
period of 5 year.

 Risks & ChallengesIf funding is successful, I need 1 to 2 months to familiar with this software. Most probably I can start publish game app to store after the first month. Monetization income will probably come in 3rd  or 4th month.For those contribute higher amount and get a free game app, please do allow me to delivery within 3 to 6 months time after the campaign is successfully funded.
  Other Ways You Can Help If you can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help. You can help me by: 
Tell your friends or family member about this campaign. Share this campaign in your social media wall.
 
Thanks for you times reading my campaign page. Thank you in advance for your contribution.

story:
Monsterhearts is a story game about the messy lives of teenage monsters.

Monsterhearts lets you and your friends create stories about sexy monsters, creeping horror, messy love triangles, and teenage angst. When you play, you explore the terror and confusion that comes both with growing up and, say, being a undead flesh-eater. Or bartering with demonic forces. Or being an unstable werewolf.


The game runs on the Apocalypse World engine, designed by Vincent Baker. As a result, the two games share similarities in play style: emergent story, messy relationship webs, mechanics that give players hard choices to make, and a structured MC role.


It's designed to evoke stories like True Blood, Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Ginger Snaps or The Twilight Saga. If you like supernatural romances, or stories of monstrosity and personal horror, or if you just like watching sexy people ruin their lives, then you'll love this game.


Want a teaser? See this example of play, taken from the book.


Pre-order the game!

This is a pre-order campaign. At all contribution levels beyond PAWN OF DARK FORCES, you're pre-ordering a copy of the finished game in PDF or print format.


All contributors receive an IndieGoGo exclusive: The Hollow (see below).


The book is half-letter sized, and is 30,000 words long. It features about 15 pieces of art throughout the book & printable materials. The interior art is all b&w art like that seen above, created by myself from stock photography.


All reward levels have North American shipping costs factored in. If you live outside North America, I humbly ask that you add $5 to your contribution to help offset international shipping costs.


(For additional notes on some perk levels, see the first update.)


The Skins & The Hollow

There are 10 Skins that provide the starting-point for your characters: The Vampire, The Werewolf, The Mortal, The Witch, The Fae, The Chosen, The Ghoul, The Ghost, The Infernal, The Queen. Each player (other than the MC) starts the game by choosing the booklet for one of these Skins. Their art and snippets of their flavour text are included in the video.


If you contribute to the IndieGoGo campaign, at any level, you'll also receive The Hollow. This Skin is being given out exclusively to contributors. The Hollow is an artificial creation - something alive but not real. It's inspired by Dawn (from Buffy the Vampire Slayer) and Frankenstein, and it's got a touch of Carrie in it too. The Hollow is one of my favourite Skins, playing on themes of trans body identity and existential doubt.


Additional Goal Levels!


Success! Monsterhearts reached $5000, so Jackson Tegu will release an awesome Skin that he's been working on: The Selkie. The Selkie is a creature caught between kingdoms. When she removes her pelt she appears human and can walk the land as humans do. When she dons her pelt she resembles a seal and can return to the ocean kingdom. Except, if she returns to that ocean kingdom, she can't leave again. The Selkie explores what it means to be a stranger in a strange land (much like The Hollow explores what it means to be a stranger in a strange body). Her moves evoke homesickness and draw elemental power from bodies of water.


Success! Monsterhearts reached $8000, so 5% of everything raised (after credit card processing deductions) will be donated to Egale Canada (or more accurately, their Human Rights Trust), an organization that provides advocacy and outreach for LGBT (lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender) youth. The ECHRT's projects include a "End Homophobic Violence, Period" campaign, as well as MyGSA. Monsterhearts tells stories about teen sexuality and isolation, and this milestone makes sure that it does something to help support real teenagers who are struggling with these issues.


Success! Monsterhearts reached $10,000, so I'll send two additional PDF games to all backers. The first is Gun Thief, a little game about hyperviolence and what masculinity demands of men. It's a scrappy little game, suitable for an hour of high-octane fun. The second is Perfect Unrevised, a story game about crime in a steampunk dystopia. Perfect Unrevised is 160 pages (roughly the same as Monsterhearts), and it's a product I'm really really proud of.


Success! Monsterhearts reached $11,000, so I'll develop and release another Skin: The Angel. The Angel is about dealing with the fact that you've been cast out of heaven. Do you work to redeem yourself, or to punish the folly and impurity of those around you? Is it better to do the lord's work or follow the lord's rules? Mechanically, the Angel will introduce new thinking about: the significance of highlighted stats, access to moves, alternatives to sex moves. Also, everyone who's getting stuff shipped to them will get a dope-ass sticker.


If Monsterhearts reaches $12,000, I'll get a tattoo of some Monsterhearts art.


Where Does the Money Go?

The money is going to be spent on the following:


  • IndieGoGo & credit card companies take up to 7% of whatever we raise.
  • 5% of what remains after that is being donated to Egale Canada's Human Rights Trust.
  • Editing costs (estimated at $250-350) and art costs (estimated at $200-250).
  • Printing and shipping the books.
  • Printing and shipping the postcards, posters, folders & print-outs, etc.
  • Crafting supplies for making the zines & CDs (and shipping costs).

It is important to note that this is a for-profit venture, in which it is my goal to sell a product and make some money doing so.

The Timeline

No plan ever works out perfectly, but here's my projected timeline for completion:
  • Receive the finalized text from the editor by mid-February.
  • Finish laying out the game by early March.
  • Send the PDF version to customers by early March.
  • Receive proofs and order the print run by late March.
  • Ship books to TEENAGE MONSTER contributors by early-to-mid April.
  • Ship packages to contributors above TEENAGE MONSTER starting in mid April.

The layout stage of this timeline is quite short, because the layout has already been templated and tested out in recent playtest editions of the game. The big creative decisions are already made and tested.

story:
We are happy to invite you to take part in admirable and interesting adventure, the game development of Driving Kids. Driving Kids is a safe and creative MMO game for preschool and early-school kids. Driving Kids MMO was designed in the edutainment genre and is full of mini-games and activities that introduce kids to the interactive World of Learning.

  • We are, developers of Driving Kids, now looking for your help.
  • Our aim is to rise funds to port the game to popular mobile platforms (Android, iOS, Blackberry) and make this game free for all kids around the world.
  • Your help is essential for us and for all kids who play and who like it.

Some useful links:

  • The original MMO Game: http://www.drivingkids.com/
  • Game in 42 slides: http://www.slideshare.net/drivingkid/driving-kids-mmo-gameplay


Our Team

Albymedia company design and produce edutainment software and browser-based games. Our edutainment and learning games series for children of pre-school and elementary school age are published and distributed worldwide.


Your Help

There are 3 different ways to help us continue development of the game:

  • You can fund some money;
  • You can play our game and tell us how to improve it and what would you expect in new version of this game that will be available on mobile platforms (any suggestions, comments and critique from parents and kids are welcome);
  • You can tell about our needs in your blogs, fb, twitter etc and help us to find people who will be interested in funding this project.


Our Plan

Right now we plan to port our game to the most popular mobile platforms. With your help we can release full version of Driving Kids on Android and iOS and make it free to everyone for a period of 12 months. It means that all features of this game will be available for all kids who use smart-phones and tablet PCs.




Thank you!

story:
WELCOME TO INRADIUS!

A brand new creative and innovative application that connects you to everything you need based on your current location. This app makes running errands, dining out, and traveling convenient, easy, and all within the touch of a button. With a GPS feature that always knows where you are, you no longer have to scour the internet or local yellow pages to do the most basic things like making reservations at your favorite restaurant, scheduling a hair or nail appointment, finding a barbershop for “your style” haircut, or even getting cab service when you most need it.  Now you simply login and all of these services are at your fingertips, LITERALLY! 


WHAT MAKES US UNIQUE? 

Our two-way communication and feedback system between vendor and user is the central core of our app. The individual times, such as seating, ordering, delivery, appointment booking, and arrival, are all updated by that participating vendor. This ensures that our users have the latest up-to-date info for planning purposes. This unique feature differentiates InRadius from other apps.

 

SERVICES

Gas Station: Locates and ranks nearest stations by gas prices.

Medical & Dental Offices: Locates local offices and identifies insurance type accepted. Also features the ability to complete and submit non-sensitive sections of the patient registration form ahead of your appointment.

Pet Grooming: Locates and reserve local pet grooming services.

Restaurant: Locates and ranks nearest restaurants by service times (Delivery, Pickup, or Seating) and allow users to reserve seating or order from menu.

Nail Salon: Locates the nearest salon and ranks according to next open reservation time.

Hair Care: Users can find local barber or hair salon and directly reserve an appointment.

Taxi: This feature allows direct taxi contact through map or list mode. GPS feature allows taxi to accept fare and guided pickup.

LANGUAGE SELECTION

Users can select from 7 major languages of their choice.

VENDOR AWARDS

Vendors will be allowed to provide special discounts to compensate for higher service times (Delivery, Pickup, and Seating).


TIMELINE

The development and testing process for InRadius is expected to take 7 months to complete. The beta version should be available for qualified users within 5 months of funding. Both beta and completed versions will be available for download across iOS and Android platforms.

RESTAURANT FEATURE

With our restaurant tab, you can search local restaurants, check out the menu, and make reservations based on three vendor-updated times: Seating, Pickup, and Delivery. You can even enable the countdown timer, with alert, that enables absolute control of your time. For those looking to pick up and go, or simply want the luxury of having it delivered, each restaurant will have their menu uploaded for your review. You can go over the menu, choose your favorite dish or explore new cuisine, and add to your checkout cart. Your dish comes with an estimated prep time, and once approved, simply check out, review your cart, and pay.

COUNTDOWN FEATURE

Yes, there is also the countdown timer for this as well. That's correct, no more waiting in line or phone orders with bad reception that always seems to end in a wrong order. With this quick easy to use tool, your order is 100% correct, just the way you deserve it.

TAXICAB FEATURE

And that’s not all, if you’re like me, I like to frequent a bar from time to time, to socialize and have a good time. Of course, we all know the kind of safety issues this can pose if you drink and drive. And we also know that after last call, it’s time to head home. We spend additional time trying to locate a cab through endless calls and wait times, just to hear “I’m sorry, we have nothing in the area, our closest cab can get to you within 45 minutes.” Now you’re stuck outside the bar waiting for a safe ride home. WELL, NO MORE! With our Hail a Cab tab, finding a ride home or to the next party destination has never been easier.

     

Through our attractive map and list views, you will see ALL of the cabs, and I do mean the actual cab closest to you, that are available from numerous companies that are InRadius of your location, and for more convenience they will be color coded by company. The taxi service will automatically know where you are, utilizing our vendor version of InRadius. You can then “hail it” and even pay through the app once you have arrived safely to you destination.  Just like our other services, there will be a timer that lets you know just when your cab will arrive.

  

OTHER FEATURED SERVICES

Included will be the ability to search for local professional Pet Grooming, Nail Salon, Hair Care, Medical and Dental offices, and also Gas Stations in your radius. And stay tuned, there are many more services available.

Similar to the previously mentioned features, the hair care tab allows the user to locate local barbershops and hair salons. The user can review shops and salons by style, prices, and customer reviews. This feature also provides current available appointment slots for individual stylists. Once a stylist from a particular location is chosen, an appointment is booked with a minimal deposited amount agreed upon by the vendor (will be deducted from total cost of service) to ensure seating at the user's convenience.

PAYMENT & SECURITY

Secure account setup and payment is verified by integrating security into our application development process. Users can pay securely using major credit cards and through PayPal.

PRODUCTION COSTS

iOS & Android Development: $35,000

Back-end Development: $15,000

INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY

With understanding that with the implementation of the American Invents Act (AIA), the USPTO has moved to a first to file system. Our team is working diligently under the advice of a patent attorney to file, at a minimum, a provisional patent application for obtaining a priority date and for protecting the novel features of our mobile and web-based software application.

THANK YOU!

Thank you for allowing us to share this amazing app with you. We would love for you to be a part of making life more convenient.

InRadius: Life Made Easy!

story:
HALFLING?¡ Are you Sure?¡¡
The real Halfling player knows the defeat as a matter of fact, every draw is felt as a Win 
and every victory is going to be EPIC.
 
 

About us

Willy Miniatures is a small company which produce high quality miniatures for fantasy football and other miniature games. We offer alternative designs to the ones existing and we provide the players with a wide variety of miniatures to help them complete their teams. To achieve this we always work with the most talented sculptors.
You can see our full catalogue and contact us here
http://willy-miniatures.blogspot.com.es/
You can see our succeed Chaos Campaign
http://igg.me/p/281384/x/2362463
 
 
 

Why crowdfunding... again?

we had an amazing experience with our late campaign, shorten the time to cast former team in a incredible way. So we could go on producing some miniatures at a time, but with your help we can speed up the whole process again. Using Indiegogo as a platform to rise funds helps us a lot since we can finance new miniatures, obtain feedback from our customers and it gives us confidence to keep working on.
 

Ladies and Gentlemen, the Ultimates Haflings...

This team will be casted on metal.

PERKS

 
 

REWARDS

 

Size Comparison

 

Estimated delivery: November 15th 2013 (except LEVEL 11 which depends on the painter)

 

And in case you want more Halflings
Check at
http://igg.me/at/WMimperialhalfling/x/1791030
story_txt:
HALFLING?¡ Are you Sure?¡¡
The real Halfling player knows the defeat as a matter of fact, every draw is felt as a Win 
and every victory is going to be EPIC.
 
 
About us

Willy Miniatures is a small company which produce high quality miniatures for fantasy football and other miniature games. We offer alternative designs to the ones existing and we provide the players with a wide variety of miniatures to help them complete their teams. To achieve this we always work with the most talented sculptors.
You can see our full catalogue and contact us here
http://willy-miniatures.blogspot.com.es/
You can see our succeed Chaos Campaign
http://igg.me/p/281384/x/2362463
 
 
 
Why crowdfunding... again?
we had an amazing experience with our late campaign, shorten the time to cast former team in a incredible way. So we could go on producing some miniatures at a time, but with your help we can speed up the whole process again. Using Indiegogo as a platform to rise funds helps us a lot since we can finance new miniatures, obtain feedback from our customers and it gives us confidence to keep working on.
 
Ladies and Gentlemen, the Ultimates Haflings...

This team will be casted on metal.
PERKS

 
 
REWARDS
 
Size Comparison

 
Estimated delivery: November 15th 2013 (except LEVEL 11 which depends on the painter)
 
And in case you want more HalflingsCheck at http://igg.me/at/WMimperialhalfling/x/1791030

story:
Who are we, and what is this game?

We are ZebraLightning Studios, and we have been making mobile games for two years now. We have 6 games thus far on the Google Play market, and would like to bring you another one! Our team for this project now has the opportunity to bring you a lighthearted, super fun game!

We who are working on this project have recently gotten an opportunity to start developing our craziest game yet! Since normally, business "stuff" keeps us from being able to blaze through and have as much fun as possible, we would love to spill our hearts to make a game just for you. With this opportunity, we can make a game that we think everyone can enjoy, while polishing the snot out of it!

But what exactly do you do in Squirrely Diver? Well, if you've played Temple Run, or One Epic Knight, it's pretty similar to those, except we're going with a top-down 2D style with it. It's an endless runner type of game, where you just keep going collecting items and such, trying to get a high score, until you die. We plan on having items and such to pick up as you're going, so look forward to an action packed run through the game!

With your generosity, you can help us finish this game and provide a great time for everybody! With the resources we can get with the funding, we can make the funniest, squirrel parodied, endless runner, thing of ALL TIME!

SQUIRRELLYYY DIVEEEERRRRR! YYYYEEEEEEAAAAAAHHHHHH!

What We Need & What You Get

The $3500 for the funding we need is to finish the game entirely, within the next month and polish it to the best of our abilities. Unfortunately, in order for the three of us to focus on this game, we are needing the funding to complete it.

If we do manage to get triple the amount we're asking for, we can go beyond what we're trying to do, and take this into a 3D environment! This could include better levels, added objectives, and more Squirrely Diver ACTION!
Of course, any funding in between our initial goal and the 3D upgrade goal will go towards getting more levels for a story mode, costumes for Squirrely, songs for the soundtrack, and the best laughs for all!
And for the bad news part, if we don't get to the goal... If we don't get all the way to the goal, it doesn't mean the end of the world. It'll just take a bit longer to get the game done. We will still be working on it, and making sure everything goes as smooth as possible, while still trying to balance the business responsibilities that will inevitably start pressuring us.

For the first few perks we have, we will provide basic things like being in the Special Thanks, song downloads, wallpapers, and unlocking the costumes we have planned for Squirrely. Higher perks include things like physical soundtracks, signed art, and even our stuffed tiger!

The Impact

What this project contributes to the world is something we feel is underrated... Laughter. When all the world's problems are solved there will still be a need for laughter. Although this isn't the end all be all of tear-jerking comedy, it sure had us in tears coming up with the idea! We just want to give everyone something to laugh about, while enjoying a great game at the same time.

Every project we have started here at ZebraLightning we have finished, and although they are not triple A game titles, Squirrely Diver is well within the project scope of what we have already completed.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't worry if your short on cash! If you would still like to help, check us out on the Android Google Play market. We have a bunch of free games for you all to enjoy! Also stay tuned to our website, zebralightning.com, for updates of upcoming titles and updates to release on IOS.

Also feel free to friend us on facebook, or subscribe to our Youtube Channnel!

story:
What?

I figured out that I really enjoy making cardboard electronic toys, and I have returned to dabbling in amateur video game design. Empowered with the likes of the MaKey MaKey and Scratch, I have set on a mission to create DIY cardboard toys that are also video game controllers for custom mini games.

I call this mission the "Cardboard Entertainment System."

8-Bit joke, OK we get it. But are you a Certified Cardboard Video Game Engineer?

I am not, due to there being no such thing. Don't be a silly person. I have worked in specialty electronics in previous jobs and have been dabbling in programming and game design since ~high school. I'm having a blast and I know these games are going to be great perks for my sponsors.

I am going to be putting special personal touches into each order, and that's where the real magic happens.

I am an enthusiastic tinkerer and a member of my local Makerspace/Hackerspace at Knox Makers where I have been further pursuing my interests.

What got you started on this wild endeavor?

I learned about MaKey MaKey from MAKE and about Scratch in a Learning Creative Learning open public MOOC put on by MIT. I figured out how to make a MaKey MaKey version of the classic video game Pong (see More Resources below) and have been branching out to test my own twists on some of my other favorite video game genres and game mechanics. 

I decided to make a unique video game experience for a friend's birthday using the MaKey MaKey, Scratch, some basic electronic supplies, and cardboard. They were entirely blown away, I thoroughly enjoyed it, and I was left with a strong drive to do this same thing for random strangers across the globe.

If anyone can do it, why is this on Indiegogo?

In fact, a first goal is to get enough funding so that I can develop and release the free open source instructions for all of the cardboard video game controllers that work with the free online video games I will be producing in Scratch.

These controllers/toys will be designed in ways that require little or no experience, and full kits cost $100 each for early adopters (plus shipping and handling for international orders), and much less if the user already has a MaKey MaKey. I am also including a package for just a personalized video game, no controller included. $1 donations are also accepted, which comes with a very grateful thank-you e-mail. Also, expect secret perks that appear in the wild temporarily (unless unlocked permanently by getting purchased before they disappear).

This is a unique project that aims to work hard to reward adopters with personalized video game experiences, and I'm diving in headfirst to tackle all the extra content and features I can.

That's why I think this belongs on Indiegogo.

So what exactly are you trying to fund?

I am including packages to cover these areas (described in more detail below):

  • Free mini-games for all
  • Free DIY instructions and extra content in digital format for all
  • Free video game background songs for all
  • Pre-made unassembled kits including wires, conductive materials, LEDs, and other components (with 1 MaKey MaKey)
  • Pre-made unassembled kits (without MaKey MaKey)
  • Custom personalized mini game experience
  • Secret perks that appear in the wild..

Why sell kits without the MaKey MaKey core?

It's important to me that I stay open to people who already own a MaKey MaKey or want to use an alternative Arduino or other microcontroller, and that I release the plans for free so that anyone can build or hack the design.

Alternative microcontrollers, you say?

Armed with as little as 1 MaKey MaKey or microcontroller running the MK sketch file and a few basic electronic components, anyone can have their own custom Cardboard Entertainment System with a virtually limitless and costless sea of peripheral possibilities. You won't have to order MaKey MaKey from me, and you won't even have to order any MaKey MaKeys at all. If you want, you can try putting the MK sketch on your own compatible microcontroller and hack one of my designs for a custom video game controller that works with all the games (or even invent your own), without ever paying me a dime. That's great! Sharing's what MK and Scratch are all about, but this project doesn't even skim the surface of either's potential. I encourage hacking any of this project, as much as I love and vastly appreciate my supporters. Enjoy and have fun tinkering!

Additionally, for the mini Flash games, the main thing will be the keyboard signals that the controller can send to a computer via USB. The actual design can wildly vary from what I initially come up with, so you can reinvent your custom controller however you want as many times as you like.

And since all the games will be using the same controls, you can even play all the other games that get made in this project with your controller, too. Results may vary as some games will be oriented with specific controllers in mind.

Didn't some kid already do cardboard games and get flashmobbed?

I want to donate 10 percent of the total funds raised to Imagination Foundation on behalf of Caine's Arcade. This is important to me because Caine is an inspiring kid hero of cardboard games and I like what the Imagination Foundation does and is about. Caine's Arcade helped pave the way for cardboard game inventors all across the world.

I'd say that's a noble feat more worthy of being in the pages of our history books than some things out there these days, and definitely worth donating 10 percent of the funds I raise.

What's the scope of this project and how does it scale out?

I might make a few controllers and games in this project, I might make a hundred. I'm prepared to scale up or down as needed, but even at a maximum cap of what I can do in a day by myself I quickly run into time constraints if things get out of hand. If this project becomes too big for me to do alone and get everyone's rewards to them in a timely manner, I'll recruit friends and fellow tinkerers and turn it into a larger scale production. I already have several types of game genres and basic game mechanics already mapped out and created, and each mini-game will vary in a unique and substantive way from one of the basic game types.

For instance, one game type is a basic and short RPG. Using my RPG game mechanics template, I can make several different custom stories with unique sprites and maps all from the same starting template. This will help reduce my time and let me get a lot more quality creative planning done for each order without anything coming out unfinished or like it came off of a cheap assembly line.

Ideal funding goal?

I am not too worried about how successful this will be, only that I complete the orders that I get with special personal touches for each. It is important to me that I try and infuse each controller and game with a little something personal, so I will ask each donor with such a package a few questions to try and make a very custom experience for them.

This also makes excellent opportunities to have a custom video game experience dedicated to a loved one for their birthday or other special time. I will accept photos to incorporate such as pictures of pets, pictures of your home and favorite places, pictures of friends and family, custom sounds and voiceovers, and other media that may help make the experience more personal for you.*

What Do You Need & What Do I Get?

I need MaKey MaKeys, lots of electronic components and supplies (LEDs, servo motors, buzzers, wires, conductive adhesive copper tape, knobs, buttons, etc.), art supplies, and cardboard.

You get access to DIY plans and all the mini games I can publish live (I need a permission/waiver from anyone included in any submitted photos). Even if I only make a few projects, everyone will have access to all open source and Creative Commons content.

I will be producing unique electronic music for each game. I will also include other content and features that everyone will have access to.

If you order a toy and game, you will have the pleasure of a unique and custom experience designed just for you. You will be able to do things like choose character and monster names, invent items that will appear in the game, and help shape what your cardboard toy ends up looking like.

What happens if you fail?

If I don't get the full $1000.00 funded, it only means I have to scale back my order of MaKey MaKeys and other supplies, which wouldn't affect my costs enough to sink the project. I can do as little as $1, as I already have one MK and supplies and can at least make something to show and provide digital DIY instructions about. I'd like to get at least five orders for custom controllers and games, though.

Heck, I'll continue making my own video games and controllers even if I get $0.00 funded. It'd be cool to take some orders for others, however. I imagine making a silly fighting game for someone where they can select their pets as characters, or an RPG about someone's childhood experience.

I'm concerned about your realism.

I am trying to juggle a few things here. This is mostly a fun research project. My sponsors will be blown away, but this will mostly be due to personalization. Please don't expect a video game experience akin to the visual quality of next console gaming. Think retro gaming, with some modern twists. Again, personalized orders are paying for personalized experiences, not bleeding-edge gaming. This is going to reek of homebrew, but that's part of the appeal. If quirky but personalized ghetto cardboard video game controllers, weird music, and amateur retro gaming do not appeal to you, this might not be a good campaign for you to throw bones at. Fair warning, because that's the kind of stuff I live for!

Cool idea, but I'm strapped.

That's OK! Help out in other ways:

  • Share this project with others.
  • Indiegogo makes this easy with social sharing buttons. Do it!
  • Enjoy the free games when they come out.
  • Enjoy the final PDF and extra content when it comes out.
  • Stay tuned for awesome updates.

Minimum system requirements

There are a number of nominal system requirements to get your game and/or kit working. Nothing guaranteed on any OS or system not supported by MaKey MaKey and Scratch, but I will try to find best-available solutions for special needs. Some MAC users have experienced MaKey issues, and Scratch 2.0 may act funky or not work at all with some OS's and browsers (such as RaspPi, as Scratch 2.0 is Flash-based). We should be able to find a solution for you: using Windows, Mac, Ubuntu, and other Linux drops for your game; and using USB 2.0 and Windows/Mac/Ubuntu/Linux for your hardware kit.

If you are going to use your own Arduino or compatible microcontroller, start here: https://www.sparkfun.com/tutorials/388

A few notes about your finished product*

I will work hard to create something unique for any personalized perks, but I get final creative license. Further, all content will be released for free. If you choose a game or game and kit, you are paying for personal touches and the ability to help direct me through the game creation. I will use your feedback and submitted content as inspiration, but buying a package doesn't mean everything will be put in or that you get exclusive rights to the content. Since all the content will be CC-BY, it means that anyone will be able to use, remix, share, download, and distribute the content for their purposes. See more about CC-BY in More Resources below.

Also, I am going for ~G and ~PG rated experiences so that anyone can enjoy these experiences, and these will be shared with the community at large. I reserve the right to refuse some content or themes.

This shouldn't ever be an issue if your requests are reasonable considering these guidelines.

More Resources

smalltortoise games

  • MaKeyPong
  • OPERATION: WIRE LOOP

smalltortoise music

  • Cardboard Entertainment System: the Soundtrack, a growing album of noise, glitch, chiptune, weird, and all the background music to all the games.
  • son of a glitch, sliding scale EP

Cardboard Entertainment System links

  • CardboardEntertainmentSystem.com
  • Facebook
  • YouTube
  • Twitter

Other handy links

  • CC-BY 3.0
  • Arduino
  • MaKey MaKey
  • Scratch

*: If you want me to use content that involves people that are not you or property that is not yours, we will need permission from those involved. I can help you figure that part out. All content will be CC-BY and open source, so keep this in mind when placing your order.

Other Fun Facts & Disclaimers

  • Scratch is developed by the Lifelong Kindergarten Group at the MIT Media Lab. See http://scratch.mit.edu
  • MaKey MaKey's About and Derivative Use Policy: http://makeymakey.com/about.php and http://makeymakey.com/derivatives.php
  • Cardboard Entertainment System is not associated with Scratch or MaKey MaKey.
  • Cardboard Entertainment System is not a console, CES is a game developer in partnership with smalltortoise games and smalltortoise music. CES is a limited series of remixable video games for PC/Mac/Linux that use unique homebrew DIY open source and open hardware cardboard videogame controllers.
  • Idaho's name has a completely nonsensical origin based on the eccentric and erratic whims of the mining industry.
  • In 2011, approximately 98 million 8-bit sprites were lost due to inadequate save files. Please, think of the sprites. Save early, save often.
  • Despite claims otherwise, Cardboard Entertainment System has never purchased and is not currently involved in the purchase of a large private cardboard island.

MaKeyPong

son of a glitch, sliding scale EP

Cardboard Entertainment System links

CardboardEntertainmentSystem.com
Facebook
YouTube
Twitter

Other handy links

Arduino
MaKey MaKey

*: If you want me to use content that involves people that are not you or property that is not yours, we will need permission from those involved. I can help you figure that part out. All content will be CC-BY and open source, so keep this in mind when placing your order.
Other Fun Facts & Disclaimers

Scratch is developed by the Lifelong Kindergarten Group at the MIT Media Lab. See http://scratch.mit.edu

MaKey MaKey's About and Derivative Use Policy: http://makeymakey.com/about.php and http://makeymakey.com/derivatives.php

Cardboard Entertainment System is not associated with Scratch or MaKey MaKey.
Cardboard Entertainment System is not a console, CES is a game developer in partnership with smalltortoise games and smalltortoise music. CES is a limited series of remixable video games for PC/Mac/Linux that use unique homebrew DIY open source and open hardware cardboard videogame controllers.
Idaho's name has a completely nonsensical origin based on the eccentric and erratic whims of the mining industry.
In 2011, approximately 98 million 8-bit sprites were lost due to inadequate save files. Please, think of the sprites. Save early, save often.
Despite claims otherwise, Cardboard Entertainment System has never purchased and is not currently involved in the purchase of a large private cardboard island.

story:
About me:

I am known as Bluestrike, a level designer who created a load of levels for the Goldsource and Source  engines (Counter-strike source, Halflife 2) including the popular Insurgency Mod and my own singleplayer campaign Half-Life 2 : Awakening.

 

About Spheritis:

Spheritis is a 3D ball puzzle game. Its goal is to activate the exit and travel to a next level. You control a physics driver sphere, you can change its type (wood, stone, metal , ...) and equip the ball with a single special enhancement at a time (Jump, Boost, ...).

The game has been in development for over 3 years and its single player component is almost completed.

The single play campaign features 7 different ball types and 7 special enhancements, 4 difficulty levels (easy, normal, hard and Challenge Mode) and leader boards.

The game used the Unity 3D engine and will run on PC, Mac and Linux.

 

What this project needs:

As you can see in the videos the game is near the end of production for the single player campaign. But its not done yet and I am out of funds.
While I am not sure if I even am going to make break even on this game I still want to go on and finish the game in a proper manner.

So where will the funds go?

  • Music for the game.
  • Polishing of the game, buying additional assets and tools form Unity's asset store.
  • Completion of the last single player levels.
  • Achievements.
  • Translations.
  • Linux and Mac implementation.
  • Save game support.
  • ...

 

And if I raise more then the project its goal?

  • Gamepad controller support.
  • Multi play experiments.
  • ...

 

What you get:

Since this game is this far done I can guarantee you will get at least something in return.  The game in its current form will keep you busy for quite some time already.

The perks:

  • Fan
  • Early Bird
  • Digital Game
  • Early Access
  • Symbol Reward
  • Future
  • Corporate
  • Guardian Angel

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You like my game and like to help in other ways as well?
You can do this by:

  • Voting for Spheritis at Steam Greenlight, especially if you prefer steam keys :).
  • Spread the word about this game to your friends by liking it on Facebook or following me on twitter.
  • Mention the game to any friends in the game media :)

 

 

FAQ

How far is the game a long?

Its single player component is almost completed.
Connecting multiple players works but is hardy in alpha stage.

 

How many levels are in the singleplayer campaign?

I plan to release with 18 levels.
The first levels can be finished rather quick and are intended to learn new abilities.

 

When is the game ready for release?

Since I work only half-time in order to get by, development time is hard to predict.
It is possible I release a single player version first and multiplayer as free DLC after. 

 

Why are there no physical rewards like hats, t-shirts or figurines?

I rather use the money people contribute for my game.

  

What happens if you do not reach the funding goal?

I am running a dynamic campaign what means I get any money that is contributed even if I miss the goal.
Since Spheritis is already so far done you will have the game reward.
But it will not be the way I prefer to release it, probably missing some of the items that I run this campaign for. And most likely a later release.

 

Thank you!

Kurt "Bluestrike"  Stassen

story:
The Play Kit is a fun educational toy that bridges the best of digital and physical play to offer an entertaining and immersive learning experience for children.

Story driven games are at the core of this app, and our unique learning methodology of interaction, practice and production helps children develop their language, numeric, artistic, social and cognitive skills.

  

The AppyKids Interactive Play Kit is designed for children ages 3+ and is comprised of:

  1. One lovable Appy: a toy that is versatile enough to be a buddy and a stand for your device!

  2. The Play Kit app: Loaded with tons of story based games that are constantly updated so your child is engaged and challenged!

  3. Smart flash cards: Point these at the app and follow the interaction for some learning magic!
 


We saw a lot of apps that focussed on one aspect of learning and were assessment based, but children, at this age especially, learn through story, song, game play and interaction with characters they love.


We’ve built a unique methodology that uses story and play to take a child through the different stages of learning. Children are encouraged to practice at their own pace and are rewarded at every stage of play.

  

Our family of lovable Appies serve as guides through the app, making the whole experience a lot of fun. 

The seamless interaction of the flashcards with the app is what kids really can’t get enough of. They get immediate feedback, making game play physical and exciting. 

The Play Kit app will be available to download for free on the Apple App Store and Google Play Store.


We have worked with Apple Distinguished Educators and Education Technologists to craft a unique learning methodology. Each step within the journey is carefully designed and developed so that a child progresses incrementally.

  

This approach is used throughout our Play Kit app to help children learn in an exciting and engaging manner.

Children and parents can enjoy the Play Kit app together which helps to develop a child's social interaction. The flashcards create an environment of tactile reinforcement.


In order to ensure that screen time is meaningful, the Interactive Play Kit comes with a handy companion app for parents which allows them to track their child’s engagement and progress from their own devices. 

  

The Interactive Play Kit has been designed to grow with your child. We have an extensive roadmap of expansion packs that range from fun thematic topics to learning languages. 


We are enthusiastic partners of your child’s learning journey and are keen to see them build a strong foundation in these important early years.

We have self financed all the development to date and have been working hard to perfect the Play Kit.

Design, packaging, product samples, prototyping and app development is done and we are eager to proceed to manufacturing, which is why we need your help.

We have identified a reputed manufacturer with over 35 years experience in the toy industry and have finalised the manufacturing process.

With your help we can commence final sampling, safety certification and manufacturing.

With support from someone like you - who appreciates big ideas with a lot of heart, we can get his product into the hands of kids as soon as possible!

Please Support Us and claim a Perk!

Q: What age group is the Play Kit intended for?

A: The Play Kit is built for ages 3+. 

Q: What platforms do you support?

A: iOS - Devices with iOS version 7.0+

Android - HDPI devices with Android 4.4+ with a front-facing camera. Devices should have a capable CPU (armv7a and NEON support). Example: Samsung Galaxy S3 or above.

Q: Since the product is designed for kids, is it safe and compliant with international toy standards?

A: Once the hand sampling and tooling is done, we will work towards the safety inspection tests. We have designed the product to ensure that it complies with the Business Social Compliance Initiative (BSCI) safety standards and the product will undergo several tests to ensure that it is safe for use by children above the ages of three.

Q: Can I become a beta tester?

A: We have a small group of beta testers that we will contact when we are close to finalising the app. We will reach out to early backers who have an iPad and ask them to help out in the testing of the product. 

Q: Why do you need $25,000?

A: We need to order a minimum number of units for the manufacturer to take on the project. This will help us to go through the tooling, sampling, safety testing and certification, pilot runs and final production of the product. We also plan on spending time on the ground in the production run phase to ensure that the product meets our requirements and we have no developmental issues or delays.

Q: Is money the only obstacle you have or are there more obstacles? Is raising funds for this product the only challenge you’re facing?

A: Design, packaging, product samples, prototyping and app development is all done. We have engaged a toy manufacturer who has over 35 years experience in the industry and are using their expertise to help guide us in the development process. We’re now ready and eager to go into manufacturing which is why we need your help.

Raising money for a product that hasn’t been validated by the market is always a challenge for anyone. We’re confident of the product we’ve made, based on the initial testing we have done with children and parents, we believe that we have created something truly unique. Validation from our community will definitely make the road toward greater investment easier.

Q: How do I claim a perk?

A: Click on the ‘Get This Perk’ button to pre-select your perk and continue with the contribution check out process. Alternatively, you may click on the ‘Select A Perk’ button at the end of our campaign page to choose a perk and provide your contribution details.

Q: Can I claim a perk with Paypal?

A: Yes, we do support payment with Paypal.

Q: What forms of payment do you accept?

A: We accept credit and debit card payments. International cards are fine too.

Q: Can I cancel my perk?

A:By claiming a perk, you are committing to support our project; we know that you will be happy with the Play Kit. But, if you must cancel you may request a refund before the end of our funding campaign.

Q: How may I request a refund?

A: To request a refund, please write to us at hello@appykids.com. Refunds will be issued based on the payment method used to make the contribution, and may take three to five business days to appear on your statement.

Q: Can I change my perk?

A: Each contribution made is recorded as a separate contribution with a separate perk. If you would like to receive a new perk, you can do this in a separate contribution. If you'd like to upgrade your existing perk or select a different perk, please contact us at hello@appykids.com

Q: Can I claim multiple perks?

A: It's exciting to hear that you've found multiple perks you are interested in claiming! We may not be able to add multiple perks in a single transaction. However, if you'd like to claim multiple perks, please make a new contribution for each perk.

Q: Who do I contact if I have a question about my contribution?

A: If you have a question about a perk, shipping address or need to provide additional information for your contribution, contact us at hello@appykids.com

Q: If anyone has ideas for pledge rewards or stretch goals, would you consider them and if so, how can I write to you?

A: Couldn’t have asked for more! We are glad that you wish to contribute to our project. Please write to us at hello@appykids.com.

Q: How will you get my info to deliver the rewards?

A:Once we are ready to deliver the rewards, we will send you an email survey to request any info we might need such as your mailing address or other details. If you think you might have missed a survey email, please log in to your account to check. You’ll see a notification at the top of the site for any missed surveys.

Q: How do I know when my rewards will be delivered? 

A: We will keep you updated throughout the manufacturing process and once we are ready to ship we will contact you with the tracking code.

We are on schedule with our timelines shared on the project page. However, although we are in close proximity to our manufacturer, the city may remain closed for a large part during Chinese New Year. We encourage you to check the project's updates or comments to see when we plan to deliver the rewards. In case of any queries, feel free to write to us at hello@appykids.com.

Q: I am not receiving the email updates from your project.

A: Kindly check if you have added our email address to your contacts list. Should you still miss our emails, please drop us a line at hello@appykids.com

Q: Will I be notified if the project succeeds?

A: Yes! An email will be sent to inform you if our project is successful or not.

Q: If the project fails, will I get my money back?

A: Even though this is a flexible funded project, if the project fails we endeavour to refund all money to our contributors less any fees that may have been charged during the crowdfunding process. 

Your support means the world to us, you are truly someone who appreciates big ideas with a lot of heart. Please spread the word and help other parents discover The AppyKids Interactive Play Kit.

The challenges and risks that are ahead of us as we finalise the development and delivery of the Play Kit are related to manufacturing and logistics.

  • There may be slight variations in the colours based on our transition from the prototypes used in the photos and video to the final manufactured product.
  • There may be changes to the final dimensions or specifications of some of the parts as we optimise the design for mass production and / or adhere to standards.
  • There is the possibility that the delivery of the product to our contributors may be delayed due to unforeseen product changes that require additional development or addition to the scope of our manufacturing time line.
  • There is the possibility that the delivery of the product to our contributors may be delayed due to unforeseen circumstances in international shipping and logistics.
  • Shipments may be subject to import duties and other local taxes.

If there are any changes to the Play Kit, we will communicate these changes to our contributors in a timely manner.

AppyKids, a brand of Growl Media Ltd., started in 2013, making apps for kids to teach language and cognitive skills. With more than 2.2 million downloads, and a monthly active user base of 350,000+, our apps have won awards and enjoy widespread use across 80+ schools in the region. We’ve built a reputation of creating great quality products for kids and our first animated series, “The Adventures of Zee” and its spinoffs have been viewed more than 8.5 million times on the internet.

The AppyKids Play kit combines this expertise we’ve gained in storytelling and gamification of educational concepts - which is why it is the future of play.

story:
What is a Board Game Cafe?

A Board Game Cafe is exactly like it sounds; a place where you can come in, get coffee, snacks, or maybe a sandwich, while at the same time perusing a library of hundreds of  board games that are available to play. The Castle is meant to be a  place where you can come and relax, put your feet up and have  a good  time!

What will the Castle Have to Offer?

  • A library of hundreds of games, available for $5/person a day for unlimited play
  • A positive space to interact one-on-one with friends and family
  • Light fare, from popcorn and pastries to paninis
  • Delicious beverages- we'll have a full coffee bar and are planning to have a beer and wine license for some casual adult beverages 
  • Game gurus on staff to suggest and teach new games- intimidated by our huge library?  Just have a quick chat with one of them and you'l be set up playing in no time

Why Do We Want to Open A Board Game Cafe

  • As Beverly residents, we love our town and see a lot of awesome things happening here.  We're excited to be a part of it all.
  • We think Beverly can use more places to hang out with friends and family.  With 5 colleges and 60,000 residents in the area, we see a need for more community oriented activities where you can really have fun and interact one on one.
  • We love the idea of creating a space where people can interact in person, having fun together without breaking the bank

Why We're Crowdfunding

  • Opening a cafe costs a LOT of money.  We're putting a lot of our own funds in and also getting investors on board, but we also wanted to give the community the opportunity to supplement our funds.  This will help us to ensure we are making The Castle the best place we possibly can
  • The $20,000 we're raising will help cover getting a lease, renovations, equipment (espresso machines are not cheap!), legal fees and of course, expanding our board game library. 
  • Be sure to check out our awesome perks- little ways for us to say "thank you!" for anything you might be able to contribute.

Risks & Challenges

Opening any small business is always risky.  We've been working on the early stages of opening The Castle for almost a year and have become accustomed to the fact that things will very seldom go as planned, there were always be one more thing to do and its important to be flexible.  However, we've also put in a ton of time and research and done every thing we can to meet with people who know better than us to make sure we've accounted for all the pieces we need to complete in order to successfully open in the Fall of 2015.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you aren't in a place to contribute right now, doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out- share our twitter (@thecastlebev), instagram (thecastlebeverly), and facebook page (facebook.com/thecastlebeverly)
  • Sign up for our email list by going to our website (thecastlebeverly.com)
  • Tell your friends!

Thank you, thank you, thank you!
story_txt:
What is a Board Game Cafe? 
A Board Game Cafe is exactly like it sounds; a place where you can come in, get coffee, snacks, or maybe a sandwich, while at the same time perusing a library of hundreds of  board games that are available to play. The Castle is meant to be a  place where you can come and relax, put your feet up and have  a good  time!

What will the Castle Have to Offer?

A library of hundreds of games, available for $5/person a day for unlimited play
A positive space to interact one-on-one with friends and family
Light fare, from popcorn and pastries to paninis
Delicious beverages- we'll have a full coffee bar and are planning to have a beer and wine license for some casual adult beverages 
Game gurus on staff to suggest and teach new games- intimidated by our huge library?  Just have a quick chat with one of them and you'l be set up playing in no time


Why Do We Want to Open A Board Game Cafe
  As Beverly residents, we love our town and see a lot of awesome things happening here.  We're excited to be a part of it all. We think Beverly can use more places to hang out with friends and family.  With 5 colleges and 60,000 residents in the area, we see a need for more community oriented activities where you can really have fun and interact one on one.
We love the idea of creating a space where people can interact in person, having fun together without breaking the bank
   Why We're Crowdfunding  Opening a cafe costs a LOT of money.  We're putting a lot of our own funds in and also getting investors on board, but we also wanted to give the community the opportunity to supplement our funds.  This will help us to ensure we are making The Castle the best place we possibly can The $20,000 we're raising will help cover getting a lease, renovations, equipment (espresso machines are not cheap!), legal fees and of course, expanding our board game library.  Be sure to check out our awesome perks- little ways for us to say "thank you!" for anything you might be able to contribute.


    Risks & Challenges  Opening any small business is always risky.  We've been working on the early stages of opening The Castle for almost a year and have become accustomed to the fact that things will very seldom go as planned, there were always be one more thing to do and its important to be flexible.  However, we've also put in a ton of time and research and done every thing we can to meet with people who know better than us to make sure we've accounted for all the pieces we need to complete in order to successfully open in the Fall of 2015.   Other Ways You Can Help Just because you aren't in a place to contribute right now, doesn't mean you can't help:  Get the word out- share our twitter (@thecastlebev), instagram (thecastlebeverly), and facebook page (facebook.com/thecastlebeverly) Sign up for our email list by going to our website (thecastlebeverly.com)
Tell your friends!   Thank you, thank you, thank you!

story:
We are a small start-up from Spain that was created with the purpose of games development. Until now, we published a lot of games on mobile platforms and we think the time has come to jump to the big scene and create something as close as possible to a AAA game. 


Nebula 2: Assault Squadron is a multiplayer space shooter that was created with a main design idea: to be playable in the maximum number of devices as possible. We designed the game with the aim to make possible to play a game between a group of friends which one of them is at home playing with its console, other is travelling by bus with his mobile phone, and another one is playing using his PC.


We created the campaign in order to get funds for the following:
-We need funds to buy the development kits necessary to release the game on the main platforms: Nintendo, Sony and Microsoft. We have funds to pay for part of the kits, however they are expensive and it's difficult to earn the money creating only free games like we do. The estimated amount to pay the rest of the development kits is 5000 USD.
Obviously, the graphics cannot have the same realism on every platform, so this project will include a big work of testing and setting the game in different devices. This is the main reason why we need to buy the development kits from the big platforms. We must do an intensive testing use of its network capabilities.
-We also need some support to start the physical distribution of our games for PC. The amount that we need for the mastering of the first edition is 3100 USD.
-We need to buy some 3D graphic assets from freelance designers (1200 USD).
-We need to pay the soundtrack for the game (500 USD).
The total amount we need to finish and publish the game in all the planned platforms  is 9800 USD. Once we get funds, we will be able to finish the whole game.



We hope you are interested in collaborating  with us during the start-up. Thank you very much for your support!!

story:
PERISH is a video game, an Action-RPG with permadeath & procedurally generated levels, also known as a roguelike-like.
  The Combat is deadly and deliberate, inspired by Dark Souls. Block, dodge and manoeuvre to get a good opening to damage your opponent, while making sure not to give the enemy an opening yourself. Levels are randomly generated, and the structure of the game as a whole is similar to Spelunky. A full play-through should take about an hour, but is so difficult that you will likely need to play many times to become good enough to reach the end.



The randomly generated levels also contain specific unique items and encounters that can be relied on to always occur at a specific level or world every time. Learn the patterns behind the apparant randomness to uncover secrets and unlock new areas and content.



 Journey into the unknown. Explore long-forgotten ruins and discover what was once lost to the world. Battle through the monsters, undead and the fallen heroes who came before you to reach the secrets that lie entombed within.



  PERISH is being created in Unity and will release on PC, MAC, LINUX later this year. It will support Keyboard & Mouse OR Gamepad controls.

  Key Features

  • Procedural levels. Every level you play is unique
  • Permadeath. There are stakes! It really matters how well you play because when you die, that's it. A new world is generated for you to start fresh.
  • Non-random entities are a part of the random genration so that you can still memorise & exploit patterns.
  • Classes that you can choose from to vary your play. Unlock new ones by finding secrets!
   



I need your help

I am a sole independant developer in Australia and I have been working on this game for over a year now. This project is primarily self-funded, which is why the goal is relatively modest. The current budget for the game doesn't quite match up with what I think i'll need to complete it so I'm coming first to you to try and close that gap.
  Because I've already invested so much of my own time and money into this, there's no chance of not going through with it. If the funding goal isn't met, i'll have to stop working on it full-time for a few months while I do freelance work to make up that money. I would VERY MUCH prefer to keep up the development momentum and stay working on this project full-time, though. I hope you will help me do that, so I can release this game to you all sooner rather than later.


Perks


  $10 The Game. You will receive a digital copy of the game (& STEAM key if it gets released there). Your name in the Credits under "Special Thanks"

  $25 Early Access. You will get access to the Beta version of the game when that is available. [+ all previous perks]

  $50 Be a Shopkeeper. Shopkeepers have random names, add yours to the pool they get drawn from. [+ all previous perks]

  $100 Name a crypt in the game. Crypts are special areas that contain mini-bosses or special items or unique encounters. [+ all previous perks]

  $150 I will work with you to create a monster or enemy of your design to be a rare encounter in the game. (spawns in your Crypt from the previous tier.) [+ all previous perks]

  $1000 "In association with ... " - your name / logo on a splashscreen at the start of the game. [+ all previous perks]



Social Media
  Even if you can't back this project you can still help! Get the word out about it and let people know.
