Hilda is the daughter of Lord von Wormheart, a man whose sometimes cruel treatment of his subjects rubs Hilda the wrong way. And even though he shows nothing but complete affection for her, she resents a ruler who would show favoritism to his family while throwing those who depend on his rule under the bus. But when his latest tirade has him marching an army against one of his own villages, she decides that is a line she will not let him cross, and so sets out to stop him.




                      

The core gameplay of This Just In! is bullethell horizontal shooting action, but with a twist. First of all, the three playable characters will have unique characteristics, governing their power, movement speed and other things. But these characters will be fully customizable with different equipment, costumes, and customizable skill trees.

 





Finding the game too difficult? Turn the difficulty slider down, or replay old levels to grind for experience. Or maybe it's too easy? Turn the difficulty slider up and enjoy more difficult bullet patterns, but also a better chance at finding more powerful, valuable loot. 



The choices are completely up to you. We want the game to reflect your personal playstyle and preferences as much as possible.

 
Or maybe you're the type of person who would like to compete for a high score in a completely controlled campaign free of RPG mechanics? Play through the arcade mode, a seperate experience with a simplified version of the story based on more traditional shooters, complete with high scores and continue credits.
 



But back to the main campaign mode. Each character will have her own side-scrolling hub town to explore in between levels. It is in this hub town that you will talk to NPCs, buy items to use on levels, buy and customize equipment and change skills.



And there are many more exciting details we will give in future updates, so please stay tuned!





                                                      
 
No Grapes Games is a group of three guys, and we all have day jobs. But making a game takes time, and making a quality game takes even more time. Which means that in order to make This Just In! the best game it can possibly be, and in a timely manner, we are going to have to take time off of our day jobs to make it happen. 

We hate DRM as much as the next people, and as a result, This Just In! will proudly be DRM free for Linux, Windows and Android platforms.

 
If this is the kind of game you would like to play, or if you know someone who would be interested in playing it, please spread the word! Your support is greatly appreciated!
 
                         Who are we?
We are No Grapes Games, a new three-man game development team formed with the express purpose of making This Just In! We're all friends who grew up playing horizontal and vertical shooters, role-playing games and adventure games. With great passion for these genres, we decided it would be fun and worthwhile to combine our favorite aspects of these experiences into what we are calling This Just In!

Nathan Caldwell - Programmer
Andrew Caldwell - Writer
Justin Raimey - Artist

Here is an example of a horizontal shooter, Boogie Wings

story:
Muddled Adventure VideoGame

Hi there! I am 32 years old, married, 2 children: son 1 1/2 years old and daughter 9 years old. 

 

I'd like to start a Indie VideoGame factory and as a first serious project I am in my way creating Muddled Adventure an adventure/maze type game for iPhone and iPad.

 

What I want to do?

1) Create 48 levels game for iPhone and iPad.

2) Start a new idie videogame small factory.

 

Where does your money go?

To cover the art, development, fees and hardware costs.

What happens if I get WAY too much money?

Extend the game for HTML5 , Android and Mac platforms.

Extend the levels quantity as much as possible.

 

What happens after that?

Start another game projects.

Create a video tutorial blog to help others to create games by their own from scratch, and help them to become their dreams real.

Rewards!

I hope you like them and of course I am open to new suggestions: www.mestoz.com

 

Thanks a lot everyone!

story:
We reached our main goal! So we're be fulfilling perks on the go! The same day that you pledge your contribution you'll get access to all the goodies.

We have a few more days to get to our stretch goals and collect founds for more languages so we still need your help.

 

Ba Ba Dum is a free HTML browser game that helps you memorize vocabulary in different languages. We've already coded the whole thing, created 1500 hand-drawn images and recorded 16 500 words read by a professional native voice actors. Actually you can even play it right now in your browser on a computer, tablet or phone.

Join thousands of people from all over the world. Compare your scores to others. Track statistics of most popular languages and games, the hardest and easiest words and check were the players are coming from.

What we want to do now is to ADD MORE LANGUAGES! That's why we need your help.

You can choose from four basic game modes plus two extra ones.

First one will check your basic word recognition.

Second is for testing reading skills:

Third is concentrating on your hearing and it's very similar to the first one but instead showing you the written word it gives you the ability to repeat the audio:

Fourth will test your spelling. This is the hardest one especially in languages that use non-Latin writing system like Greek, Japanese or Russian. Guessing is almost impossible. You just have to know the answer and for correct one you will get six points.

The fifth game is a shuffle mode that will randomly choose one of the four basic modes. This one is both the hardest and most enjoyable.

The last game is a little different and is for learning hiragana and katakana – a basic component of the Japanese writing system:

 

Currently you can learn words in 11 languages plus a shuffle mode that will throw at you random language after every given answer (in game just click the rainbow icon to try it yourself).

Also the interface is available in almost all of those languages except Japanese.

All of the illustrations are hand drawn on paper. We had to literally draw almost 4000 images just to select the right ones which were skaned and vectorised so they can be used as SVG files and look equally good on big and small screens and on screen with high pixel density like Retina Display on iPhones or iPads.

For most of our books we usually design dedicated typefaces. Very often we precisely know what we need. This means that if we can’t find any existing font that fits our specific idea, we have to create it.

For Ba Ba Dum we needed a narrow, sans serif, rounded and heavy letters with a very wide range of languages to support.

As usually we started with simple and fast sketches. Then we drew more precise shapes using font editor software. We did some sample prints, marked things that had to be changed, and went back to the editor.

After a few months of making constant changes asking our typographic friends for revision and advice we ended up with Mr Dum Dum. A OpenType font with two styles (one for regular shape and one for bulky shadow) that can be yours if you support this campaign.

 

Ba Ba Dum is a non-profit fun project. We wanted to combine our graphic design, illustration, type design and coding skills to create an educational experience that would be someplace in between our educational books and other fun project like pica-pic.com.

For building Ba Ba Dum we received a scholarship from the polish Ministry of Culture and National Heritage. We used it to build the game and prepare first languages. Thanks to the scholarship Ba Ba Dum is not only free but also advertisement free. We want it to stay that way and bring high quality learning experience to every one who is eager to get to know sound of different culture.

Now we need your help to add more languages.

All of the raised founds will go directly into translating and recording new language versions. A budget of $900 for single version is divided among five major costs like shown on a graph below.

By adding new language to the game we'll also add this language to the interface.

The $900 goal is to add one new language. The first one is Portuguese. But that one is already achieved! Every next $900 threshold is our next stretch goal and achieving that goal will enable adding one additional language to the game.

As you can see below we have a short list of upcoming languages. Some of them we'll be added sooner some later. But if you're a really big fan of any particular goal from that list you can become an exclusive sponsor on the whole language. You have to select one of the perks from the $900 Supporter group and voilà! Your favorite language will be added.

 

Special Thanks You will get ★ exclusive in game access to “My Progress” section (look below for visualization) ★ 10 wallpaper pack for variety of resolutions ★ your name in the Credits under “Special Thanks”.

Rookie Font Owner Everything from $5 reward plus Mr Dum Dum font (the one used in the game) with basic 95 characters with a commercial license for one desktop user (more about licenses below). Shadow style font is also included.

Font Owner Everything from $5 reward plus Mr Dum Dum font (the one used in the game) with over 700 characters with a commercial license for one desktop user. Shadow style font is also included.

Postcard owner Everything from $25 reward plus a hand drawn black and white postcard (A5 size) with a dedication to you, or anyone you want. This is not a print. Every postcard will be a drawing on paper. The image on the postcard can be a word from Ba Ba Dum or a character from our books.
See the example below.

Pro Font Owner Everything from $5 reward plus Mr Dum Dum font (the one used in the game) with over 700 characters with a commercial license for 5 desktop users license and unlimited pageviews webfont license plus any future update to the font (including adding new characters). Shadow style font is also included.

Word Contributor Everything from $50 reward plus we'll work with you to add one new word that will appear in all future languages and your name will appear in Credits under “Word Contributors” next to a image of a added word.

5 Words Contributor Everything from $50 reward plus we'll work with you to add five new words that will appear in all future languages and your name will appear in Credits under “Word Contributors” next to a images of a added words.

Language Supporter Everything from $150 reward plus “Language added thanks to (your name)” in the Credits section and a guarantee that your favorite language will be added to Ba Ba Dum.

My Progress

If you’re $5 or above supporter you’ll get exclusive access to “My Progress” section were you can keep track of your progress in every language/game configuration. The graphs will show the percentage of all the words in specific configuration that were answered correctly.

 

Wallpapers

We’ve prepared 11 wallpaper themes. Each in two versions (with and without text) and in 25 different resolutions to perfectly mach any device that you have. All supporters that pledged $5 and more will get access to a download page.

 

Postcards

Your postcard will be hand drawn just for you. This is not a print. Every single one will be a little black and white original made just for you. You can choose your favorite word from Ba Ba Dum or a character from one of our books (like Mamoko series or a image from Maps).

You can also decide what will be written on the postcard. Or if you don’t want to decide we’ll just choose something from Ba Ba Dum for you.

 

Font Licenses

Desktop font license is for use in desktop applications with a font menu and it fits most common uses both personal and professional. You can install the font on your Max OS X or Windows and use the font in Microsoft Word, Mac Pages, Adobe InDesign, Adobe Photoshop etc.

For example you can create and print documents or static images even if those images are used on the web.

The number of users is the maximum numbers of computers in which the font can be installed.

Webfont license is for use on you website or web application. It allows you to embed the font into your website so it can be displayed on browser. You can keep fonts on your server and link to them in CSS file.

Mr Dum Dum webfont can be used across multiple websites/domains with no pageviews limit as long as the websites/domains all belong to the single License Owner.

Aleksandra and Daniel Mizielińscy (Hipopotam Studio) We’re designers, writers, illustrators and programmers from Warsaw, Poland. We’re known for a variety of work that ranges from educational books for children (Maps, Mamoko series, H.O.U.S.E. series and almost twenty more) to headline typefaces to fun internet projects (Pica-pic, Bubole). Our books are published in over thirty countries.

Beside creating new project we love to share our knowledge. Daniel is teaching at Warsaw Academy of Fine Arts and we’re regular guests at design conferences.

story:
THE  PERFECT GAME FOR YOUR PARTIES!

Bota Abaixo* is an original and independent project born at the hands of four friends who share a love for illustration… and for drinking!

Thus they set on a quest to find the cure for boredom an  a way out of awkward silences on stuck-up events. And there it was, a way of turning the most monotonous of parties into a cascade of good vibe: creating a custom-made drinking game!

With this intent and pencils in hand they got down to work, and inspired by the most popular drinking games such as “Ring of Fire” and “Kings”, they adapted these games transforming them into a funny unique game, easier to play and fully illustrated: Bota Abaixo!

* in English, Bota Abaixo means something like “Bottoms up!”




This is our team and their essential information:

Bruno Rajão – if he was one of the Seven Dwarfs he would be Grumpy, always hated school but as a teacher he has no other choice. It’s a divine punishment for grumbling all the time. 

Patrícia Figueiredo – the star of the team, sacred international champion of hiccups.

Daniel Souto – he believes to be an alien adopted at birth by earthlings, unable to face the truth of being a mere earthling adopted by aliens.

Eduardo Porto – As a child he used to watch cartoons and ride a bicycle. Nowadays he rides a motorcycle to impress the ladies… and watches cartoons





Bota Abaixo is composed of 56 cards, each with its unique illustration. Divided in 4 suits – each from a different author, the game combines 14 rules into a near infinite amount of combinations of creativity, conviviality and all-round silliness.

Plus, the cards are larger than in a conventional deck. Think big right?

To make life easier for players, the rules are displayed on the custom-made cards in a size guaranteeing intelligible reading (may not apply in later rounds).



Piece of cake: you just mix the cards well and randomly scatter them with their back facing up. 

Then every player takes his turn clockwise in picking a card from the set, which will tell him what to do. To drink... or to order someone to drink!

There are also some special cards, and if you get the right one you can even impose your own ridiculous rules to your friends. But be careful! You might suffer the consequences of your crazy ideas yourself! 





Standard mode: You can play just to chill out with friends. In turn, each player takes a card until there are no more available cards in the set...or no more drinks to play with. Everybody wins.


Competition mode: You can compete with your friends; each player fills his glass once at the beginning of the game and follows the regular rules. The players are eliminated as their drinks finish, the last player with a drink in his glass wins. 



With this campaign we want to launch (and internationalize) a deluxe version of Bota Abaixo:

- With durable, more resistant cards (so you can even play on the beach);

- A more resistant and practical package, with new cool graphics;

- New special cards, designed by two invited illustrators;


An experimental test edition of Bota Abaixo already saved the lives of a small part of the world population. 

Our survey shows this game totally changed their lives: the subjects became friendlier and more productive, less dependent on technology and more on friends. They celebrate every day and contribute actively to a more cheerful society.

This calls for more. So have a toast with us and join us on this mission! Please back this project and help us to help you.  We want to take Bota Abaixo to every corner of the world, making it an overall better place.




















Our heartfelt thanks to all who contributed in any way to make our idea of Bota Abaixo a reality.

Thank you all, you’re the ones making us want to keep improving the game. 


Cheers!

The Bota Abaixo Team (Bruno, Daniel, Eduardo and Patrícia)

For more information about the game: http://bota-abaixo.com

Follow us: http://facebook.com/botaabaixojogo

                     https://twitter.com/bota_abaixo

Music: Royalty-free music from Bensound.




FAQ

Is there a minimum age for the game?

If you play with alcoholic drinks you should respect the minimum legal drinking age of your country. If not, the age range is from 5 to 150.

How many players does the game support?

From 2 to as many of your group of friends, there’s no limit as long as you can keep the game going. The only condition is to always have something to drink.

Can Bota Abaixo only be played with alcoholic drinks?

No, any kind of drink is suitable, alcoholic or not. We don’t promote the consumption of alcohol and when you do, we recommend to drink responsibly.

What matters is for you to have a good time with friends.


Have another question? If the information above doesn't help, you can ask the project creators directly.

botaabaixojogo@gmail.com

story:
Zone Reavers _Metamorphic Card Creatures:

Trading Cards that transform into 3D Action Figures. These original art toys are fun to build, cool to collect, and easy to get into.  Requiring no glue, tape, or sharp tools -they're an inexpensive, entertaining, alternative to electronic devices and tech-heavy gizmos.

Hi.  My name is Morgan Clark.  I'm an artist, and a dedicated father of two, born and raised in the San Francisco Bay Area.  I'm the owner of Butterflymachine, and the inventor of Metamorphic Card Creatures (MCCs).  MCCs are collectable trading cards that transform into three dimensional action figures.  The first line of these ground breaking toys are called, ZONE-REAVERS. 

Each MCC comes fully printed, cut, and ready to begin construction.  No scissors, glue, tape, paint, or tools are needed.  Intuitive, visual instructions make it easy to get started as soon as you open the box.

My hope is that, the combination of, high quality material and clever design will deliver a uniquely satisfying tactile experience, and a finished product that you’ll be proud to own.

 

Zone Reavers characters belong to a dark and mysterious universe filled with secret government technology, interdimensional portals, nefarious cartels, and terrifying monsters.  This alternate reality unfolds in a mini comic book included with each toy.  It tells the tale of how Zone Reavers were accidentally unleashed on the earth and how humanity fights back.   This rich setting lets your imagination run wild as you build, collect, and play.

 

The Game

The Zone Reavers Trading Card Game (TCG) brings a unique twist to the genre:  Your cards can transform into 3D action figures!  Each player marshals their own squad of three collectible Zone Reavers action figures to unleash new combinations of abilities and discover new strategies. Cards drawn from each player’s carefully constructed deck control how the Zone Reavers move across the board as well as how they target the opponent’s pieces to execute devastating attacks.  Positional tactics combined with deck building strategy deliver the next evolution of TCGs -  Zone Reavers Trading Card Game!

 

What We Need 

We are trying to raise $8650.00 to participate in the New York Toy Fair

Manufacturing of prototype Zone Reavers and packaging:  $2000

New York Toy Fair Fees and Booth:   $3500

PR materials: $600

Airfare:  $350 x 3 = $1050

Accommodations:  6 days x 250= $1500

 

What You Get

Here are some of the perks that you will get by helping us:

$20  - you will receive a Facebook thank you.

$50   - you will receive one Zone Reaver with folding instructions and the comic book.

$100  - you will receive three Zone Reaver with folding instructions and a signed comic book.

$300  - you will receive three Zone Reavers personally folded by Morgan mounted in a jewel display case, signed with a signed comic book printed at double size.

$1000 everything in the $300 package plus you get to design and name a character in the next run.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

we understand that many people just can't contribute, but you can still help

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.

 

The Team:
Morgan Clark is the owner of Butterflymachine and Lead Product Designer for Zone Reavers. He is an artist and inventor who brings years of professional experience in both digital graphic design and physical fabrication to the creation of Zone Reavers. When he’s not developing new products or corresponding with manufacturers regarding his latest order, Morgan delights in sharing family dinners with his wife Christine, their 3 year old daughter, Isa, and 1 year old son, Gabriel. To unwind he takes their dog, Penny, for walks along the shore of the San Francisco Bay.

Alex Burr is the Lead Game Designer for the Zone Reavers Trading Card Game. Alex has played Magic: The Gathering since Revised and is a Legend ranked Hearthstone player. He is obsessed with expanding the TCG design space by introducing elements of in-depth positional strategy. When he is not playing with his Zone Reavers action figures, Alex is serenading his beautiful wife Laurie (while she laughs at him!). He also enjoys learning the finer points of how garbage trucks work from their 2 year old son, James.

Selina Lewis is Morgan Clark's sister and Alex Burrʻs cousin. She is a film producer with over 20 years of experience and is bringing her project management skills to the team.

story:
Demo-  Alpha Game Demo

About the Game

With his son stolen away by all he fears, a father must face a nightmare to save his child.

Father and Son: Fear Never Dies has the player assume the role of a man placed into hellish environments on a quest to save his only son, who has become trapped in a world of fear and darkness.

Enemies vary from level to level, each stage based on a fear one must overcome. Enemies of various shapes and sizes threaten the father, as he attempts also to not fall victim to the unforgiving territory.  The player will need to use strategy and well-timed attacks to conquer each fear as it manifests itself.

The game takes the form of a 16-bit platformer, sure to bring all the fun of simple yet addictive gameplay, with an exciting and captivating story and mesmerizing music.

About Us

This project was started by a group of high school students to get a head start into this market. We started this project as a way to make a game that is easy to play, fun, competitive, and able to run on virtually an machine. When we started the project, we were in search of a way to get our names out there and to be able to have somewhat of a following on the internet and in the game making scene. We also would like to keep the community in mind for this project, as well as future projects, by making the game completely open source. This will allow anyone to create new characters, maps, or enemies just by dragging and dropping them in. We are excited to continue to work on this project, and with your help we know it can grow to something even more. 

                Featuring Our New Planned Art Style when we get new hardware


What We Need & What You Get

We are in search of $50,000 dollars so we can further the expansion of the game by the way of redoing the art style by the accommodation of new hardware. We also plan on launching a new website  that will accommodate all the news about this project, future projects, and best of all a leader board featuring the fastest times of the game. We want to be able to launch all this by the time the game is funded, and also be able to have the game finished and launched by the Summer of 2014. We would like to get this on Steam if possible via the greenlight program and continue to be part of the development community.

Project Goals

$50,000

-Game is made and finished by early summer 2014

-Features new art style because we get new hardware

-Features developer tools for mod makers


$60,000

-Game is made and finished by early summer 2014

-Features new art style because we get new hardware

-Features developer tools for mod makers

+Extended DLC is made and is free for everyone, with standalone ability

+Better Leaderboards system for ease of use with daily updates(web based)

+New game modes are made for arcade purposes


$70,000

-Game is made and finished by early summer 2014

-Features new art style because we get new hardware

-Features developer tools for mod makers

-Extended DLC is made and is free for everyone, with standalone ability

-Better Leaderboards system for ease of use with daily updates(web based)

-New game modes are made for arcade purposes

+We make a multiplayer client to run games with friends 

+We include better modding tools with every purchase so anyone can do it


$80,000

-Game is made and finished by early summer 2014

-Features new art style because we get new hardware

-Features developer tools for mod makers

-Extended DLC is made and is free for everyone, with standalone ability

-Better Leaderboards system for ease of use with daily updates(web based)

-New game modes are made for arcade purposes

-We make a multiplayer client to run games with friends 

-We include better modding tools with every purchase so anyone can do it

+New Game+ mode is added to the game

+Multiple language support


Though we would like to add all of these as of now, we need the funding to do so. Even if the goals are met, we cannot guarantee that everything will make it into the project due to our limited time line and release in early Summer of 2014. We will always try our best to bring you as many rewards as possible and to bring the best gaming experience.


Help Us Even More

-You can spread the word of the game to others and tell them about the free Demo available. 

-You can tell them of the campaign so they can learn about the project

-You can give us feedback about glitches, things you would like to see added or any changes, because we want the community to take charge


Tom Varughese- Lead Design


Ryan Berthoff- Story Design


Varun Gogineni- Programmer


Felipe Yoon- Art Design


Ward "Logan" Hale- Music Smith

story:
D20 Maps for Minis made easy!

I have been a tabletop gamer for the past fourteen years, often taking the roll of the dungeon master or story teller. As much as I enjoy getting to run campaigns there is always someone who gets lost or somehow manages to be at the perfect place to survive or attack no matter where they were previously.
 
With the innovation of roll up maps and minis things got a bit easier but it always took a while to setup rooms and if you didnt want the players to know ahead of time you could only setup the room once a player entered it, taking time away from the game.
 
With the modular map you will be able to setup your dungeon/map before you get to the game and bring rooms out only when you need them. Allowing for quicker transitions and less downtime for the players!
 
Each tile floor and most walls are a little bigger than 1x1", Half walls and single doors are 1x1/2" Each box will have an average ratio of 1:10 doors to floor pieces and 1:2.5 walls to floor. This will give an even distribution and make sure that you dont run out of vital pieces at the wrong time.
 
 
 

What we need to make this a reality!

The funding level for this project is $10,000 and for that we will be able to:

  • Purchase a 3D printer to make all the pieces for the modular system. Currently the 3D printer is going to be the Solidoodle 3D, 3rd Generation.
  • Plastic Filament: this is the material that the pieces will be printed out of.
  • Pay for nessicary creative work for the designs of the pieces.
  • Cover the cost and design of the packaging materials.

 

 

 

 

The Dungeons!

I bet you have been wondering what you get if you contribute! Well here it is. You get to be part of the dungeon! Currently perks above Floor Tile are only available in the continental US. I will be working to sort out what the costs will be to ship outside the US and I will update the project with that information soon.

 

  1. Floor Tile $15: You are one of the floor tiles. Often overlooked but never forgotten. You are the foundation of the dungeon and without you there would be no dungeon. At this level you will have our sincerest appreciation and your name will be printed in the instructions under Floor Tiles.
  2. Wall Tile $30: You hold up the dungeon. You keep the ceiling from falling in and give adventurers direction. This level gives you a copy of the small box. The small box comes with 90 pieces, enough to make one large dungeon room, one set of instructions which will have your name printed under Wall Tiles.
  3. Door Tile $65: The door is the gateway to adventure. Without the doors you would not be able to enter the dungeon. At this level you will get a medium box. At 220 pieces you will have enough to make two rooms and a hallway with plenty of spares and one set of instructions which will have your name printed under Door Tiles
  4. Dungeon Crawler $100: You are the adventurer! You run through and view the majesty that is created and slaughter the monsters. Without you, the world would be a very boring place. At this level you will get the 400 piece Dungeon Crawler Box! Four rooms and three hallways worth of tiles. Enough to make a small dungeon, one set of instructions which will have your name printed under Dungeon Crawlers, and one adventure from the Dungeon Makers.
  5. Dungeon Master $500: You are the ruler of all you survey. Worlds are created and extinguished at your whim. Without you there would be no dungeon and there would be no heroes. You are truely the soul of the game. This level will provide you with all the necessary parts to make a moderate to large dungeon, one set of instructions which will have your name printed under Dungeon Masters, and one copy of each of the Dungeon Maker adventures
  6. Dungeon Maker $1000: Congratulations! You are immortalized in the game world. You will get to design an adventure that will be included with the game. Our team will be available to work with you to create your adventure. Besides designing an adventure you will also receive a Dungeon Master Box of tiles and your name will be printed inside the front cover of the instructions as a Dungeon Maker as well as on the cover of your adventure.

 

If we dont make it:

  • If we manage to make it over $1000 all funding will go to fulfilling the donations that were made. 
  • If less than $1000 is made the funding will be placed into a savings account while prototyping continues. Once a better prototype is available this project will be re-submitted for funding.

 

Stretch Goals:

  1. $15,000: Entry Way! We will design special Dungeon tiles for the entrance to your adventure. New doors will be created so you can start the adventure before you enter the dungeon. Tiles will be added to Wall and above levels
  2. $25,000: Bases! At this level we will work on creating bases for youe tiles, something that will allow you to snap all your tiles into place. Bases will be four 12x12" panels, along with a cross section support that will prevent collapse and edging. This will provide a stand for your dungeon and give your dungeon more support. Bases will be added to Dungeon Crawler level and above.
  3. $35,000: The Sky is no longer the limit! Ceiling Tiles, We will create tiles to give your dungeon a ceiling. Like having a surprise? Keep your dungeon rooms a secret by covering your rooms with ceiling tiles. As your adventurers enter the room unveil the mystery that stands before them. This will also allow you to store the minatures for your encounters in the rooms. No more forcasting the fight to come by pulling out the monsters!
  4. Everything over $35,000 will go to future projects: Modern Tile sets, and Future tile sets. All tile sets will be inter connectable.

 

Change the landscape of gaming.

This project will open the door to making cheap and effective mapping tools for Game Masters, strategiests, and hobbiests. Funding of this project will allow for infinitly expandable game boards. A dungeon that is only limited by the size of your table/floor/workshop.
 
While the project goes on we will work on making varying textures for tiles so that you will have a bigger variety of pieces to play with. Beyond regular tiles we are looking at developing pilars, wells, treasure and special trap spaces.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Let your friends, local game shops, and local comic book shops know about this project!
  • Share this project on Twitter and Facebook. Get the word out to your friends and followers!

story:
Hello Indiegogo Family,

In July 2013 when 14 players walk out for the opening ceremony of the 19th Maccabiah games proudly wearing Canadian colors and marching behind the Canadian maple leaf flag, it will be for the first time in the history of the Maccabiah games that Canada would have sent a cricket team for the games. They will march along with 600 other Canadian athletes aspiring to make their country proud. There will be more than 8000 athletes from 65 countries competing for the honors.  

So what are the Maccabiah games?
“They are the world’s third largest multinational sports games. Only the Olympics and Pan Am games stand ahead.”

What we are doing.
“We have been practicing for months now, to improve our game and our fitness level so we can represent Canada as a great team. Our coach, Emmanuel Joseph has been trying for years to get Maccabiah to allow a Canadian cricket team. This year they finally said yes.” Coach Joseph said, “This is a unique opportunity for us to represent Canada at the Maccabiah Games. Although we have a long road ahead, and some intense commitment, dedication and perseverance to demonstrate, we have, for the first time, a chance to further promote a sport that has now started to grow and mature in Canada. I have complete confidence that we will put up a tremendous effort and surprise the cricket world that Canada is ready to take on any challenge that comes our way at the Maccabiah”.


Why we need the money.
"Unfortunately it is not cheap to attend these games. Between accommodation, food, entrance fees, flights, practice sessions and equipment we need to raise more than $9,000 per player. We have already raised $50,000 and plan to raise another $100,000 out of our other fundraising campaigns, which is why we are asking for $50,000.
What you get for funding.

We thought that it would be cool if we documented this whole process. We will film everything, from our practices, the flight there, walking into the stadium representing Canada with over 50,000 viewers, our games, all the way to the flight home. We would share this with you though our social media channels. If we raise enough money, we would create a short film about our trip and send a digital copy to you, our funders.
We are offering many other rewards for funders, from t-shirts to signed cricket balls and posters of the team.

We want to make this happen, not only for ourselves but for Canada, so please if you can’t help fund us, share this with your friends or family and help us present the Canadian Cricket to the world." Any amount will get the team get closer to our goal; your generosity is greatly appreciated.

In July 2013 when 14 players walk out for the opening ceremony of the 19th Maccabiah games proudly wearing Canadian colors and marching behind the Canadian maple leaf flag, it will be for the first time in the history of the Maccabiah games that Canada would have sent a cricket team for the games. They will march along with 600 other Canadian athletes aspiring to make their country proud. There will be more than 8000 athletes from 65 countries competing for the honors.  
So what are the Maccabiah games? “They are the world’s third largest multinational sports games. Only the Olympics and Pan Am games stand ahead.”
What we are doing. “We have been practicing for months now, to improve our game and our fitness level so we can represent Canada as a great team. Our coach, Emmanuel Joseph has been trying for years to get Maccabiah to allow a Canadian cricket team. This year they finally said yes.” Coach Joseph said, “This is a unique opportunity for us to represent Canada at the Maccabiah Games. Although we have a long road ahead, and some intense commitment, dedication and perseverance to demonstrate, we have, for the first time, a chance to further promote a sport that has now started to grow and mature in Canada. I have complete confidence that we will put up a tremendous effort and surprise the cricket world that Canada is ready to take on any challenge that comes our way at the Maccabiah”.Why we need the money."Unfortunately it is not cheap to attend these games. Between accommodation, food, entrance fees, flights, practice sessions and equipment we need to raise more than $9,000 per player. We have already raised $50,000 and plan to raise another $100,000 out of our other fundraising campaigns, which is why we are asking for $50,000.What you get for funding. 
We thought that it would be cool if we documented this whole process. We will film everything, from our practices, the flight there, walking into the stadium representing Canada with over 50,000 viewers, our games, all the way to the flight home. We would share this with you though our social media channels. If we raise enough money, we would create a short film about our trip and send a digital copy to you, our funders.We are offering many other rewards for funders, from t-shirts to signed cricket balls and posters of the team. 
We want to make this happen, not only for ourselves but for Canada, so please if you can’t help fund us, share this with your friends or family and help us present the Canadian Cricket to the world." Any amount will get the team get closer to our goal; your generosity is greatly appreciated.

story:
What We Are Doing~ Non Profit Documentary Funding Campaign

Simply put, we are raising money.  NON PROFIT DOCUMENTARY! We only need $125K to produce this, and all other funds will be donated!!!  WE NEED YOUR HELP!! 

There are too many athletes committing suicide due to CTE. Chronic traumatic encephalopathy (CTE) is a progressive degenerative disease, diagnosed post-mortem in individuals with a history of multiple concussions and other forms of head injury.  The NFL has chosen to ignore some of the plea's for help.  We need to make America aware that multiple concussions can cause severe long term problems, and children as young as 10 years old are getting concussions on the football field.  The NFL has made some significant changes for new players, but what about the retired players?  Brent Boyd, Rocky Selanders, Terry Owens, and other members of NFL group, "Dignity After Football" all have a story to tell.  What about the Hall Of Fame Athletes like Rayfield Wright, Walter Payton, Larry Little, Troy Aikman, and Steve Young?  Are they or have they suffered from this terrible disease that left Junior Seau DEAD by suicide at the young age of 43?  Seau would be the second former N.F.L. player to commit suicide in the past two weeks. Ray Easterling, a safety for the Atlanta Falcons in the 1970s and a plaintiff in a high-profile lawsuit against the N.F.L. over its handling of concussion-related injuries, died on April 19 of a self-inflicted gunshot wound. In February 2011, the former Chicago Bears star Dave Duerson shot himself in the chest, saying in a note that he wanted his brain donated to the study of football head injuries. THIS HAS GOT TO STOP!  We want to shoot this documentary, "A Head Of The Game", to educate America on the dangers of concussions via the NFL athletes that suffer from them every day.  We will hear from expert neurolgist's like Dr. Daniel Amen who is doing the largest study on CTE, and chronic brain disorders in NFL athletes. We also plan to donate a significant amount of money for research for ongoing studies that relate to all athletes and chronic brain injuries. This is a serious issue and I intend to showcase the severe issues past NFL players are having from chronic brain injuries.  Again, will be donating a portion of the funds collected to Dr. Daniel Amen's research project with NFL athletes and chronic concussions. 

WHY WE ARE DOING IT

The Sports Girls LLC is a new company designed to educate america on football via the athletes, coaches, and trainers that do it on a daily basis.  Our goal is to spend time with athletes, on and off the field and educate America on the game itself, the good, bad, and the ugly.  We decided to take a chance.  We are a young company that is trying to do the right thing.  The NFL is not helping some of these retired athletes like Brent Boyd, Rayfield Wright, and many more that you will hear from in this documentary.   These men are suffering on a daily basis.  They are not getting million dollar checks, nor did they ever!  Some NFL retired athletes cannot even get medical coverage from the NFL, and we are taLking about NFL LEGENDS!  This is an incredible story that can only be told by the players that have lived it.  It will open up the eyes of many Americans, and we cannot let another athlete die.  There is help, and hope out there and we are going to show other athletes, moms, teachers, high school football players, dads, lawyers, children, college and even NFL athletes what really happened to these NFL players.  Concussions are a serious condition, and we are going to show you the medical proof!  We will even give Roger Goodell, and the NFL a chance to let America know what positive improvements and methodlogies are being put into place for current NFL athletes.  We will see if the NFL responds.  WE need your help.  Check out Dignity After Football on Face Book as Well.

WHO IS UP STREAM MEDIA?~

Up-Stream Media, Inc. is a multi-generational family of video and  musical professionals. We are also sports fans as are so many others.Members of our team have participated in over  40 award winning productions (including four Emmy nominated pieces) but never  one with such a complicated subject matter.As a full service HD production company who primarily produces television  and radio commercials, we are extremely aware of the market value of popular  athletes.We weren’t aware however, of  the probable cause for the decline of so many ex-pro football players until the Sport’s Girls asked us to come on board this project. 

Up-Stream Media considers it an honor and privilege to participate  in the A-Head of the Game Documentary.As players become faster, stronger and more skilled there is no better  time than now, to aid those who have suffered such horrific repercussions  because of their commitments to greatness.Perhaps by becoming aware of the plight of past generations of football  players, we can not only help them, but present and future players as well.

We also will be using other media partners such as starlingproductions.com with their permission. 

We may use footage and other production needs from cantonfilms.com. 

~~FAQ~~

WHAT HAPPENS IF THE MONEY ISN'T RAISED IN TIME?~  We will use your funding.  If our production goal ($125,000) isn't met before the deadline we will have to make some changes to the production but the documentary should get made.  The worst case scenario would be we would donate ALL the raised money (minus Indiegogo fees and cost of campaign) to Dr. Daniel Amen's research on this issue.  The athletes involved will be very disappointed if we don't meet our goal. WE CANNOT LET THIS HAPPEN..  PLEASE HELP US.  We want to really show you what the NFL athletes are going through, and give the NFL a chance to let you know what improvements are being made.  We need to reach the goal, but will try to make this no matter what.  If we hit the $250K goal then over $100K will be donated to Dr. Daniel Amen and possibly one other concussion awareness study for non profit. 

CAN I INCREASE MY PLEDGE ONCE IT'S BEEN MADE?~  YES!! Once you donate to a campaign, you may want to change your incentive reward to a different one, or increase your pledge amount.  To do so, go to Indiegogo and sign in.  If you go to our campaign page, you can select your new donation package.   Please click it and you can enter a new amount, or choose a new incentive. 

CAN WE EXCEED THE GOAL?~  YES!!  That would be amazing as we are not a 501 (c)(3)  corporation, but want to help players suffering with CTE. We will not be able to shoot this documentary without your support.  All money will be used to produce this much needed documentary. However, as stated earlier we will DONATE all extra funds raised to Dr. Daniel Amen and possibly one other concussion awareness study for non profit.   

WHEN IS THE VIEWING PARTY?~  We cannot schedule the party until we have shot and edited the entire documentary.  We will first have to raise all of the funds in order to make that happen.  The viewing party will be prior to the documentary airing to the public and we will let you know way in advance.

HOW DO WE CONTACT YOU?~  So happy you asked me that.  Please send all inquiries to thesportsgirls@aol.com.  We will get back to you within one week. 

IF I DONATE, WHEN CAN I REDEEM THE INCENTIVE?~ All incentives big and small, will only happen if our goal is met.  If we do meet our goal, immediately after our deadline will will start to manufacture and ship all physical merchandise directly to you.  It will be our priority to schedule the more personal incentives as soon as possible.  You will be hearing from our Team.  WE NEED TO MAKE OUR GOAL!

WHERE DOES THE MONEY GO?~  Every penny (minus the fees for Indiegogo's involvement) will go directly to The Sports Girls LLC, Owner and Creator of A Head Of The Game to produce this documentary!!  Your money goes directly to the funding of this documentary.  We cannot do it without YOU!  ANY MONEY RAISED ABOVE OUR GOAL WILL BE DONATED TO NON PROFIT RESEARCH!

Please e-mail us with any other questions.  Please tell every person you know about this project!  We want to help save lives and show America the truth about concussions and the NFL.  

 PLEASE DONATE HERE TODAY**

story:
There's a flood of casual games for mobiles and tablets, but we noticed the lack of challenging and rewarding games. We decided to make a game we would like to play, one that would give us greater satisfaction than stretching a slingshot on screen. That's how we got the idea for the game Emilly In Darkness. It's an action-adventure with RPG elements and an amazing story. We've been working on the game since November 2011 and it's almost done.

 

  •  Great story
  •  Dark atmospheric world
  •  Addictive and challenging gameplay
  •  Use of simple RPG elements (NPCs, character development)
  •  Unique hand-drawn artwork
  •  Multiplatform (iOS, Android, Mac, W8)

 

 

     First and foremost, we're players. We like to play games and we don't like the direction mainstream games are going in. We started ME2 Studio because we want to make games that we would like to play. Games that are missing in the current market. 

     The game will be released in the next few months regardless of the collected funds. Collected funds will help us to work on the game faster, get better results, and add extra elements such as additional language versions or voiceovers.

story:
Be part of our marketing team




We’re just about done with the development of an awesome looking and fun to play game called Jumping Jupingo. Now we want to create an equally stunning marketing campaign and we want you to be a part of it.

We want to create oodles of entertainment stuff for you and others to share so everyone can get to know about the game. As part of the team you will not only be able to contribute ideas, follow our progress as we develop cartoons, animation and other fun goodies, and be the first to get your hands on all of this, but we will also keep you updated on how well the marketing is doing.


So, if you want to play a key part in a game’s success story then please read on …

 
 

It starts with a horrifying story ...

After messing up their moon’s climate a bunch of bug-eyed aliens come snooping around earth to abduct our baby spiders. The reason? They want the babies to work in their smelly factories to spin super strong silk for umbrellas. The umbrellas are for the hail stones that keep flattening the aliens. Disgusting, I know … about the babies.
 

In the game you help Jupingo, a little jumping spider, to rescue the babies from the aliens. Your task is made all the more difficult by the locals – a bunch of harebrained bugs, each with its own particular nastiness. You guide Jupingo around the forests, caves and swamps by directing his jumps, and spin elastic silk threads to bounce him onto out-of-reach areas. All that while catching aliens and bugs as well as avoiding acid blobs, storming lunatics, paranoid screamers and some really nasty plants. You can see some more about the game from our website. Click HERE

 

Grin, grin, grin …

OK, so we know you would have loved to help fund the game but the game is nothing without people knowing about it. You can still be part of what we hope will be a great success story. We are a small, independent game studio called WAKSTER and we have, over the past eight years, been developing lots and lots of games, characters and apps for our clients. We’ve worked on projects for companies such as Tropicana, Turner Broadcast, Ubisoft and Egmont Publishing. Like all highly creative teams we always wanted to create our own games so we started on Jumping Jupingo.

Jumping Jupingo and this marketing campaign is built on the team’s 25 years industry experience. It is a new phase for our company, moving from doing just client work to developing our own titles, and we hope you will be part of making this venture a success. 

 

You are a marketing expert and you don’t even know it!

We believe the fun and excitement of the game should be taken right into the marketing itself. Press releases and game reviews play an important part in promoting a game but the best marketing is done by YOU – it is YOU telling your friends about it.

Apart from the game we want to create loads of fun stuff for you to get excited about and share with your friends – that’s you being a marketing expert. The game has some great characters so we want to create animation, cartoons, posters and models for you to upload to your Facebook page, PInterest, Digg and wherever else you hang out.

 

Oh! The goodies!

Here’s what we want to do:

  • 3 cartoon animations
  • 20 cartoon strips
  • 5 awesome posters
  • 7 paper craft version of the game characters

So get this: you will be the first to know and share this stuff and what’s more, we will be asking for your ideas and opinions as we develop them. Got a great idea for one of the animations or cartoons then share it with us and you’ll get credited – e.g. in the animation credits it might say: Original story concept: Jimmy Johnson.

Here is an example of the type of posters we will be creating but again, you will be able to share your ideas and who knows, you might get your idea developed.



REWARDS, GIVE ME REWARDS!

Since we want you to help fund the marketing so we can give you loads of goodies to, well, help market the game by sharing all this wonderful stuff, we thought the rewards should be right in there with all the creativity, fun and shareable stuff. We want to give you something you won’t be able to get anywhere else and that is access to our creativity. Imagine this:

You as a paper craft character. Think of it: you can build hundreds of yourself and start a clone war in your bedroom.

What about a caricature poster of yourself as “The Bug Master” hanging in your office? You can have any title you want on the poster. Everyone will have a good chuckle when they see it and you can tell them how you helped make a fantastic game famous.

 

OK, so give it to me short and sweet.

So, in summary, this is an opportunity to play a key role in making Jumping Jupingo a success story by funding some awesome marketing material.  As part of this campaign you will have the opportunity to contribute to the creative process, you will be first in the queue to enjoy and share the animation, cartoons and posters with your friends and you can proudly say that you’ve helped create a success story. We will also keep you updated on how well the campaign is doing. If you help push us over our target amount we’ll just go on creating more and more fun stuff with the money available. If you’re happy and having fun then we’re happy and that’s the way to make it work.

Thank you very much for checking out this exciting project and thank you SOOOOOOOO much for your pledge! Oh, and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools to tell your friends to join the party.

story:
About FlexWorld

FlexWorld (Flexible World) is a game about playing in dynamic and interesting worlds. It has been in development for about 10 months now.

I think the best way of describing FlexWorld is to talk about the 4 facts of the tagline: "Play, Discover, Create, Develop"

Play

The first thing someone wants to do when getting a new game is - of course! - playing it. FlexWorld will come with a gamemode called Factions:

Your character joins the game as a young human in the wild. To survive you learn basic things like obtaining food, building a secure shelter and learning skills (mining, fishing, fighting, cooking etc.). You will also meet Luna, a friendly squirrel that answers your questions and gives you some basic tasks.

As your character's abilities advance, you will begin to explore the world. Luna already told you about three factions that live somewhere. So you visit each of them and depending on your personal likings you do tasks for them. Unfortunately the three factions are at enmity, so when you do something for one faction, the other two won't be happy about it.

However being successful in one faction also means your ranking will increase and sooner or later your goal will be gaining as much power as possible. Of course that also counts for the other factions, so the stronger you get, the stronger the others will get.

Playing takes place at one planet in the beginning. If you're successful, your faction will be the only one left, but the universe doesn't only consist of one planet, and another nation that you even haven't thought of is also interested in getting back its land...

So, does this sounds like an interesting singleplayer game? Wrong! FlexWorld is some kind of hybrid: It can always be turned into a multiplayer experience. Imagine you're just fighting for a faction and one of your friends comes online to support you - or defend his faction.

Technically FlexWorld does always run a server in the background. When starting a game (or loading a previous one), you can decide if others are allowed to join. Just make sure your computer is reachable from the internet.

Discover

FlexWorld doesn't force you to follow the "storyline". You can always stop your tasks and explore the world. Maybe there's something you haven't discovered yet? Like special flowers or animals. Maybe some items can even be combined with others to create new stuff?

The Factions gamemode will already include a lot of things that can be discovered, but FlexWorld won't stop here; please read on!

Create

While playing Factions, I highly bet you will also create interesting things, like buildings, farms, cities etc. Especially when playing with friends it's something that's quite fun.

However Factions isn't everything in FlexWorld, instead it's only one possible way of playing it. You can create complete new worlds, including planets, characters, items and even functionality.

So you just want a world where people can meet and chat? No problem, build it, remove all the Factions stuff and open the server for the public.

Want to bring it to an even higher level? Then you're probably a developer, and this is something where FlexWorld's biggest benefit kicks in:

Develop

As a developer (programmer, graphics artist, sound artist) you can use FlexWorld to create worlds completely from scratch. This includes graphics, sounds, music and scripts.

FlexWorld uses the Lua scripting language to provide logics - in all aspects. So with some little effort you can create new gamemodes or modify Factions.

FlexWorld has been designed to support custom assets from the beginning (as it is my personal goal: having a product that's not tied to one area). Let's do a little example: You always had that nice idea of a roleplay game. So you create a new world, create graphics and sounds (or use the ones from Factions) and provide the logics through Lua scripts. You feel it's fun and you decide it's quite more fun when others join your world. Just open your session for the public and your friends can enjoy your world together with you.

You can also launch a 24/7 dedicated server. It's as simple as starting a new game on your local computer.

Features

Here's an incomplete list of features FlexWorld will include:

  • Built-in gamemode Factions.
  • OpenGL 3D graphics engine capable of modifying the whole world.
  • Designed to be extended: Add/change graphics, sounds, music and scripts.
  • Lua scripting language for creating own logics.
  • Single- and multiplayer (hybrid).
  • Multi-platform: Programmed in modern and standard C++ to ensure it runs at least on the big three (Windows, Linux, Mac OS X).
  • Auto-update/-download of assets when joining other servers having assets that you don't have (via a resource hashing system).
  • No DRM, no restrictions: What you create is yours.

Status

FlexWorld has been in development for more than 10 months. Core features like the client, server, much of the 3D engine, resource management, scripting and much more are already done and are currently in a refactoring process to harden the source code.

However it's still too early to provide releases or demos. A lot of features are still being worked on. For example the Factions gamemode hasn't been started yet due to the development of the scripting engine and missing assets.

What we need & what you get

We're programmers, that means we're really bad at the creative things like graphics, 3D models etc. These things need to be bought from professional artists.

Also we'd like to program the project in full-time to fasten the development and being able to fully concentrate on it.

Of course there're tons of other things that need to be paid, like a website (+ server), legal stuff (trademark, taxes, sales, ...).

So every buck you invest into this project will greatly help its development in all areas. Keep in mind the campaign doesn't has to reach its goal. Every contribution helps!

Of course we're not only asking for your help but also want to give something back (besides the game itself). Checkout the perks for some special features.

Besides the perks we'd also like to offer you a special feature: Everyone who raises this campaign will get access to the (time-limited) pre-alpha release. It will be the first release ever made for the public, and you'll be able to try it out - for free!!

Contributions for those with a small wallet

We understand that a lot of people can't afford giving away money for something that hasn't even been completed. Therefore you can do other things if you like what we're doing.

Spread the word! Tell others of this project, blog/tweet about it, give us your ideas and suggestions. Do you like what you read? What didn't you like? Everything is helpful for us, so don't hesitate to drop your line.

And who knows, maybe we have something for you guys, too... ;-)
story_txt:
About FlexWorld
FlexWorld (Flexible World) is a game about playing in dynamic and interesting worlds. It has been in development for about 10 months now.

I think the best way of describing FlexWorld is to talk about the 4 facts of the tagline: "Play, Discover, Create, Develop"

Play
The first thing someone wants to do when getting a new game is - of course! - playing it. FlexWorld will come with a gamemode called Factions:


Your character joins the game as a young human in the wild. To survive you learn basic things like obtaining food, building a secure shelter and learning skills (mining, fishing, fighting, cooking etc.). You will also meet Luna, a friendly squirrel that answers your questions and gives you some basic tasks.

As your character's abilities advance, you will begin to explore the world. Luna already told you about three factions that live somewhere. So you visit each of them and depending on your personal likings you do tasks for them. Unfortunately the three factions are at enmity, so when you do something for one faction, the other two won't be happy about it.

Lua scripting language for creating own logics.
Single- and multiplayer (hybrid).
Multi-platform: Programmed in modern and standard C++ to ensure it runs at least on the big three (Windows, Linux, Mac OS X).
Auto-update/-download of assets when joining other servers having assets that you don't have (via a resource hashing system).
No DRM, no restrictions: What you create is yours.

However it's still too early to provide releases or demos. A lot of features are still being worked on. For example the Factions gamemode hasn't been started yet due to the development of the scripting engine and missing assets.

What we need & what you get
We're programmers, that means we're really bad at the creative things like graphics, 3D models etc. These things need to be bought from professional artists.

Also we'd like to program the project in full-time to fasten the development and being able to fully concentrate on it.

Of course there're tons of other things that need to be paid, like a website (+ server), legal stuff (trademark, taxes, sales, ...).

So every buck you invest into this project will greatly help its development in all areas. Keep in mind the campaign doesn't has to reach its goal. Every contribution helps!

story:
test.gacivs.info

Here comes the Golden Age of Civilizations, a semi turn-based MMO strategy game, inspired, but not followed by the classic games of the genre, such as Age of Empires, Civilization and Rise of Nations; mixed up with MMO capability and flavored with the best parts of other good online games.

Who am I?

My name is Gábor Auth, a Java developer, a Linux administrator, an IT architect, organizer of some meetups topic of Java and IT in Hungary and speaker of some IT conference. Here is my CV:

http://wiki.javaforum.hu/display/~auth.gabor/Curriculum+Vitae

What is it?

I have a dream: I'm going to create an MMO strategy game! :)

The players can move or act with their units on the map, build new cities and units, build and improve resources nearby their cities and facilities in their cities. The improved resource (farmland, forest, mine, ...) gives more production to the nearby city and the improved facilities (barrack, wall, court, ...) give more power to the player's units and cities.

The game is semi-turn-based, each unit type has a different time to next move or act after the previous action, so that (for example) you move your Settlers unit at 10pm if the last action has been performed at 8pm with this unit because of the Settlers unit has two hours per action "speed".

The players choose technologies to research to improve their cities and units and allow to build new units or facilities. You can earn technology points and you can improve your technology point income by improve facilities in your cities and improve resources nearby your cities.

The players can initiate negotiations with the neighborhoods, so that you have the decision to declare war, make peace, remain neutral or organize an empire with them. Each empire has a government type (despotism, monarchy, republic, ...), so that the suitable players will be officers in the government of own empire.

Would you like to try it?

https://test.gacivs.info
https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=info.gacivs.android.test

I have not finished yet, it runs only in browsers and Android cell phones. I want to release early and release often, so the current version is very simple: you can move with your units and build cities with your Settlers units only, but the feature set is growing week-to-week!

  • v0.0.4 (planned release 10/25/2014): city overview and train units in your cities
  • v0.0.5 (planned release 11/08/2014): limit movement of units
  • v0.0.6 (planned release 11/22/2014): attack enemy
  • ...
  • v0.1.0 (planned release 12/31/2014): start regular (two weeks long) games on the test server
  • ...
  • v1.0.0 (planned release 06/28/2015): go live (production servers)

What is it technically?

I started working on my game on spring of 2014. I researched the possibly best architecture based on cutting edge technologies and industrial best practices, it is scalable vertically (better and bigger hardware) and horizontally (more hardware).

I deployed it on DigitalOcean's cloud, I bought a domain name and SSL certifications, so I spent only a little more than $120 on this project, thanks a lot to open source and cloud technologies!

Some technology facts about the project:

  • Agile development
  • Open source (LGPL 2.1)
  • Based on Java, JavaEE and JavaScript
  • The primary target platform is HTML5 browser
  • The secondary target platform is Android
  • The third target platform is iOS (and/or Windows Phone)

What do I need?

So, this is my hobby project, I do not need your money for expensive hardware and software components, I will focus only the game development and hire subcontractors for artworks and other tasks that I can't do.

The first (and big) campaign was unsuccessfull:
https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/golden-age-of-civilizations-game/x/8052545

The goal of this campaign is much smaller: the first really playable release at the end of this year!

What do you get?

The game will go to production with freemium model, the players can join free and play free, but they can pay for features and benefits. What features and benefits? I don't know currently (really!). I've created five packages (from Bronze to Diamond) and the exact content of the packages will be revealed later during the tests and based on feedbacks, but the content will be comparable to the benefits!

And you can adopt a feature, a bug or an improvement!

So, I have a dream... one day I will publish this game... please help me! :)

Yes! You can help!

Please support it, donate it, test it, share it on social networks, share your opinions with me, discuss about the game with your friends... :)

Links

The public test: https://test.gacivs.info/
The Android test: https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=info.gacivs.android.test

Social

The Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/gacivs
The Twitter page: https://twitter.com/gacivs
The Google+ page: https://plus.google.com/+GacivsInfoSite/

story:
What is AdMedia?

A viable marketing alternative to print media.

My name is Ross Ricks and I am an Audio/Visual designer and integrator.

  • We are looking to provide community based marketing while simultaneously seeking to reduce landfill waste.
  • We install video display systems in sports bars, golf courses and other popular social gathering places. 
  • We then tile digital ads around popular live programming material, ensuring multiple views and repetitive exposure to a very specific demographic.
  • Any positive impact we can have on the environment while promoting local enterprise is crucial.

We need help establishing new locations with our Digital Signage systems.

 Each location costs approximately $15,000 to establish, including equipment and installation.  We use only licensed contractors for installation insuring legal compliance as well as supporting the local community. 

The Impact 

Every tree that doesn't get cut down from a rain forest in order to make a flyer that ultimately ends up in a landfill makes a difference.  The more communities and businesses that convert to digital advertising the better off we will all be.

Risks & Challenges

 Getting people to change the way they do things is always the biggest challenge.  Breaking bad habits is always a worthy endeavor.  Text coupons provide the ability to track the effectiveness of each marketing campaign.  Knowing our system works makes it a lot easier to lose the printers phone number.

Share our vision

Facebook, twitter, instagram

We can all make a difference.

story:
Short Summary

Home-in-Hand is an Internet of Things (IoT) startup. Our vision is to make inexpensive technology, which seamlessly integrates with existing devices available at home to be driven by users’ needs and not vice-versa. Currently, our focus is on room automation, hence, we have started with a project called SmartBoard.

Home-in-Hand’s SmartBoard is a replacement of traditional switch boards. It can be controlled via mobile app from anywhere in the world. Here is a list of features offered by SmartBoard:
  • Control up to 6 devices, 1 fan and 2 sockets from anywhere in the world
  • Disable complete board/individual interface
  • Subscribe and receive notification
  • Define scenarios, schedule them
  • Start timers on connected devices


Read complete feature list here

What We Need & What You Get

(As per Indiegogo limitation, we have moved from fixed to flexible funding)
We are passionate about technology. The technology which we are working on is called 'Internet of Things' (IoT) and is the next big thing. We want to bring this technology to Indian homes at very affordable prices.
Since, we have a limited budget and have invested most of it in producing the prototype, we are seeking crowdfunding of Rs 5 Lakhs (roughly $8500) for not only funding first 100 units but also to have the first 100 customers. So, you get first and exclusive units of SmartBoards for funding us.

Our PCB will be manufactured through our vendor in Gujarat and the front
plate of switchboard will be manufactured in Maharashtra.

The Impact

Similar products in the market cost more than Rs. 50K for minimum setup. It normally includes a gateway and multiple devices connected to the same. A few lean products only operate on Bluetooth. SmartBoard connects directly to your Wi-Fi router and does not need any gateway. Also, it can control multiple devices. 2 sockets provided on the SmartBoard allow users to connect and control any arbitrary movable electronic devices. Predefined scenarios which give the users automated control, makes SmartBoard stand out from the herd.

Risks & Challenges

Since, this is a technology which is in the niche domain, the biggest challenge is to find early adopters of the technology. We have tried to make the SmartBoard a replacement of traditional switchboards keeping the dimensions the same. Since, we already have a prototype ready and working, we foresee minimal risk in delivering the products.

Motivation

The Idea of SmartBoard originated due to the founder, Sandeep Gupta’s laziness, especially during Delhi winters. Sandeep realized that it is incredibly difficult to switch on the lights during the night especially when you are sleeping away from switch board. Also, there were a lot of redundant activities like turning off lights at 10 pm, reducing the fan speed in the middle of the night etc., which could easily be automated and provide better sleep patterns for users of such technology.

Achievement

Home-in-Hand was conceptualized at the start of 2014. It started with a prototype which was more or less a proof-of-concept.

It was followed by a 2nd prototype in October 2014, which was better in terms of usability but still lagged aesthetically.

Finally, the 3rd prototype was released in the first week of January 2015. It is the 3rd prototype for which we are seeking funding. The outer plate would be finer than what this prototype looks.

Schedule

Here is our expected execution schedule
  • Crowdfunding Campaign - Feb - Apr, 2015
  • Manufacturing - Apr - Jul, 2015
  • Delivery - Aug, 2015
  • Commercial manufacturing - Oct, 2015 onwards

What makes SmartBoard different?

We are not the only players in this field but certainly we are the first of the lot. We are offering features which are not yet available in competitors’ products. Also, the overall ownership price of this product is much less than other equivalent home-automation products which require supporting peripheral devices.
It is not only 'cool' to control your home devices via your mobile app but also very convenient to automate a lot of regular stuff. It can also help to keep a watch on your kids and take care of old parents remotely. When you fund, you will help us bring this technology to the market and be one of the first customers of the same!

Fine print

  • We ship only to India.
  • The perks may look a bit different from what has been shown in images above (the outer plate would look finer than the prototype)
  • We support only android phones as of now
  • The size of plate is 226mmx166mm (for wall grouted box size: 210mmx140mm)
We feel the above constraints would not be a hindrance for most of our
potential investors and customers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign as much you can. Not only us, they will thank you as well!!

FAQ

Q: Wait, you are asking me for Rs 5 lakhs?

A: No, not at all. Whatever you contribute, starting from $1, would provide a great support to us. We recommend you to go for $85 (approx Rs 5000) perk which will give you a SmartBoard.

Q: You mention, 'it's all or nothing' in video, however, I see this is a flexible funding campaign?

A: True, while we made the video it was supposed to be a 'fixed funding' campaign. However, due to technical issue on Indiegogo with reimbursements to India, we had to go for flexible funding.

Q: Why are all contributions in USD?

A: Indiegogo is an international platform and does not have an INR option. If you use Indian credit card, you would still be billed in INR, finally.

Q: Does it connect to my wifi router?

A: Yes, SmartBoard connects to wifi router and is then available to be controlled via internet from your mobile app.

Q: How can I install this board?

A: Installation is 2 step procedure - (a) Wall mounting - This is trivial and can be done by any qualified electrician. (b) Blinkup - Connecting to your wifi router. This would be done with the help of mobile app. Refer to here and here for more details. Detailed step-by-step procedure would be provided along with SmartBoard.

Q: Do I need to pay anything for shipping?

A: No, shipping is included. Please note, we ship only within India.

Q: Are there any future enhancements planned?

A: Yes, what we have prepared is the base for an IoT application. Currently, you can control manually. On the automation part, you can have schedule rules to run automatically. Further, we plan to enhance this to a generic rule engine. Imagine, you have to catch an early morning flight in winters and your geyser turns on automatically at an appropriate time, so that when you enter the bath you get hot water. But on regular days, the geyser turns on only at your office time. On hardware front, we plan to enhance it with a universal remote, so that your TV, STB, AC also become controllable.

For more, please read here.
